Peruth is 26 years old. She is married and has three children between 6 and 2 years, Two of them go to school. 

She sells wood and has been running a business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more wood for making chairs and tables for sale. The profits from the business will be used to expand her business to the extent of 77%.

loans.use: To buy more wood for making chairs and tables for sale.

loans.name: Julia Cipriana

texts.es:
Julia es una madre de familia de 54 años, con 3 maravillosos hijos, vive en Subtanjalla junto a su familia.
Al ser madre soltera tuvo que ver la manera de sacar adelante a sus hijos, ha luchado mucho por su familia. Por iniciativa propia se dedica a la venta de mazamorra y canchita (pop corn) y cree que le va bien por su constante dedicación, esfuerzo, la amabilidad que tiene y porque siempre ofrece productos de calidad.
Julia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un ropero para que sus hijos puedan guardar sus ropas. De esta manera mejorará su calidad de vida y así seguirá luchando para más adelante poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales.
texts.en:
Julia is 54 years old and a mother to three marvellous children. She lives in Subtanjalla with her family.

As a single mother, Julia had to find a way to help her children to get ahead. She has fought a lot for her family. Under her own initiative, Julia has a business selling "mazamorra" (a corn drink) and popcorn. She thinks it is going well because of her constant dedication, her efforts, her friendliness, and because she always sells good products.

Julia is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy a wardrobe so that her children can look after their clothes. This will allow Julia to improve her quality of life. She will then continue fighting so that, in the future, she might see her children become great professionals.

loans.use: to buy a wardrobe for her children.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a 24-year-old housewife who lives in a small village Nirendrapur in Maynaguri of Jalpaiguri district with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). They are too young for school. In her childhood Anima did not get an opportunity to study, as her parents could not afford it. She is illiterate and can sign her name only.

Anima's husband is 25-year-old Alen, a cycle-van puller. This is a very common vehicle widely used in rural areas of India to carry loads and people. It is an irregular type of job, so there are days when he gets no work and no pay. He puts in a lot of hard labor and time, but the profit is low. Moreover, the cycle-van has been old and over-used. In such a condition he wants to improve his business. He is thinking of buying a new cycle-van and renting the old one. Since there are very few vehicles in the village, cycle-van has a great demand.

So Anima is requesting a loan from BJS ( Kiva's partner), who gives business loans to rural women. She wants to purchase a cycle-van for her husband. It will help her husband to earn more. The loan will help Anima and her husband take a step closer to their goal of improved earnings and a better future for their family.

She is grateful to her generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of different varieties of bread, candies, noodles and other products that she usually delivers to her customers. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy more bread, candies, noodles and other products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lilibeth hopes to increase her business sales and dreams of improving her financial status. She meets up weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different  bread, candies, noodles and other products for delivery.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
This is Raquel. She is 35 years old and currently resides with her husband, Ricardo, in Intramuros, Philippines. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for years, and she profits well from this. Having a bigger responsibility requires more effort to provide for her family's needs, especially for her children. She and her partner had to work hard, determined to have a better income, to provide their children with a better education.

In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To improve sales, Raquel would like to apply for a loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. At an amount of 8,000 PHP (Philippine Pesos), she could already purchase larger quantities and more varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Raquel hopes to prosper through her business. She dreams for her family to be always happy and healthy. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT (Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Her name is Aida, now a widow, a resident of Taguig, Philippines.  She has five children who she is now raising by herself. She has to work doubly hard to meet their daily basic needs and for the schooling of her children.  She has dedicated herself in guiding her children.  The Php18,000 laon that was previously granted to her was a big help for her.

She would like now to apply for a Php12,000 which she will use to buy a variety of biscuits and cookies at wholesale price, and sell at retail. Filipinos love to eat biscuits for snacks, since they are cheap but yummy and filling to the stomach. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help, and she is positive that it will definitely help increase her sales and profits.

Aida hopes to grow her business so she can buy a house for her family. She desires that her children finish school and have a better future.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy wholesale products of various biscuits and cookies

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is thankful that he was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which he used to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his Jeepney. Through his earnings he is able to meet their daily household needs and the school needs of his children.
 
He would like to apply for another Php 12,000  which he will use to buy spare parts and for the monthly maintenance of his Jeepney.  It is important that his Jeepney is always in good running condition to ensure continous tranportation service.  His earnings help support their daily living expenses and the educational expenses of his children. He is thanking God in advance for the financial help that will be given to him.

Romeo dreams of his children finishing their studies so they can have a good future. He  still hopes to get another Jeepney unit. He meets up with his fellowship members to share stories of his work every week where he finds strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney.

loans.name: Kusum

texts.en:
Kusum is 45 and hails from Maynaguri. She is married to Suresh and blessed with two sons. They live in a small village Subhaspalli at Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri district. Two of her sons are studying in different grades.

Kusum‘s husband is a carpenter whose income is hardly sufficient for the family. So to help her husband financially, Kusum wants to sell cow's milk to her neighbors. By running her own business, she will be able to support her family and save for a secure future. However, this ambitious and energetic lady does not want to stop here; she wants to start her business by selling milk products like butter, curd and cottage cheese.

Kusum seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Kusum will be able to reach her goal, which includes constructing a new and better house and providing better education to her children.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Rosedaline Naa Okailey

texts.en:
Rosedaline is a student at the Accra Polytechnic Institute and would love to be a secretary in the future. The loan facility is to help pay for her school fees.
Her chosen profession interests her because it deals with smartness, competence, preparing of agendas, and minutes. She is someone who is fascinated with writing and orderliness.

She is inspired by an auntie and she happens to be her role model as well. She admires her diligence and determination to get to the top. She hopes to be a public or private secretary in the five to ten years to come. Without the help of this loan facility, 'I will be withdrawn from school'. However, her other alternative choice would be through the salary of her parents, which is not enough to cater for her education and that of her younger sibling's education.
Her country is peaceful, and the economy is doing well with the emergence of oil in the Western part of the country, so investors should take advantage of that.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees.

loans.name: Melanya

texts.en:
Melanya lives in Gyumri town with her two children. Her husband is a migrant worker who left the country with the hope of finding a job and supporting his family financially.
 
Melanya herself has been involved in a bakery business. Near the house where Melanya lives, she owns a small room where she cooks cakes and different candies. She works hard to receive orders from local stores and candy shops. Melanya's son helps his mother to deliver the cakes to customers and that's a great support for her. 

The requested loan is important for Melanya to purchase a new oven and increase the cooking of cakes and candies. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for an oven for baking cakes and candies.

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is from Ijevan town where she lives with her husband and son. Together with her husband, she works at local cafe as a cooker and waiter at the same time. They both work hard to be able to earn sufficient income for living.
 
The requested loan is very important for Susanna and her husband to purchase a car for organizing the delivery of cooked products. This will help them to cut transportation costs and increase the gathered income. 

Susanna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business startup loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a car for organizing delivery of cooked products for her cafe business.

loans.name: Hidayat

texts.en:
Hidayat, his wife, and their only child live in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Hidayat runs a food stall as his source of income. He decided to join Ruma about a month ago because he was excited to start out selling mobile airtime. 

He would like to save the extra income for his child's education. As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more airtime transactions in his community on the weekends. 

Hidayat is pictured in the photo sitting in his food stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Khanjani

texts.en:
Khanjani is a 30-year-old woman of courage and strength. She is from Maynaguri. She is a married woman with two children (one son and one daughter).  Her children go to school. Khanjani’s husband is a mason by profession, but his income is inconsistent. 

To give financial support to her family, she runs her own dairy business. She sells cow milk to her neighbors. She has one cow. Now she wants to expand her business. She decided to supply milk products like curd, cottage cheese, and ghee along with milk to her customers.

With the aim to satisfy her customers’ demands, Khanjani seeks to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to buy a new cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Khanjani wants to strengthen the family economy and help her children continue their education.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Musalam

texts.en:
Meet Musalam. Musalam is single and lives together with more than six family members in the family home in Jakarta, Indonesia’s capital city. 

Musalam runs a small stall that sells snacks, drinks, mobile phone airtime credits, and a bill payment service for his customers. He began working with Ruma about a month ago because he wanted to expand his business opportunities. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits. 

As the business runs, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more mobile and bill payment services in his community on the weekends. Musalam is pictured, in the photo, standing in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Maria Dolor

texts.en:
Her name is Maria Dolor, resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Crisanto, a  truck driver, and has two children. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her children.

Maria Dolor has a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Natasha, Boardwalk. Dealers buy the products at a lower price shown on the catalogue of the customers and sell them at a profit.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan that she will use to buy merchandise items and orders of beauty products, ladies’ bags, clothing, toiletries and undergarments for her customers.  Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality.  She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her.   

Maria Dolor aims to grow her business so she can send her children to the best school possible. She dreams that they will finish college and that they live a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for merchandise items such as cosmetics, shoes, bags, and apparel for her direct selling business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia, aged 64, and resident of Taguig City, Philippines.  Married to Reynaldo, a retired marine, they have four children who are now in  college.   She manages her own household while operating the business.  She works hard to augment their income to meet the family’s daily personal and household needs and the education of her children. 

Virginia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, rice, cookies, school supplies, beverages, oil to the local neighborhood.  She earns by buying  supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece.  She also makes frozen foods like embutido, siomai, and stuffed chicken and fish. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 3,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business and increase her sales, she is requesting a PHP 50,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy raw ingredients such as meat, pickles, eggs, vegetables, and oil to cook them and freeze them for sale.  She is positive that she will have a good return on her investment for all the specialties that she cooks. She is also thanking God in advance for your great help.

Virginia hopes to be able to grow her business and dreams that her four children will earn a college degree for them to have bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for frozen foods and grocery items for her general store.

loans.name: Asep

texts.en:
Meet Asep. Asep and his family live in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. Asep is already married; his main job is a canvasser. He also runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall, and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. 

Asep believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him processing more mobile services to his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learned from Ruma. 

Asep is pictured in the photo standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase one industrial overlock sewing machine, 10 regular sewing machines and one industrial sewing machine cover.

loans.name: Malina

texts.en:
Malina lives in a remote village in the district Jalpaiguri. She is 32 years old and married to Dilip and together they are raising their two daughters. Her daughters read in grade 12 and grade 6. Her husband is a green grocer by profession; he sells vegetables in the market.
 
Malina runs a small grocery shop, which permits her to have an income with which she can help her family with the nourishment and education of her daughters. She sells groceries like rice, flour, sugar, salt, oil, etc. in her grocery shop. But due to lack of capital, she could not purchase more stocks for her shop and a very small income is generated from the shop. Thus it is difficult for her to meet all the expenses of the family.
 
Malina has taken a loan to replenish her grocery shop. She plans to purchases necessary grocery items so that she can meet their customers' demands.

Malina thinks that the extra income will help her to adequately stock up her shop and this will improve business profitability and upgrade their financial condition. She aspires to provide good education to her daughters. She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: To purchase necessary products for the grocery shop.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna hails from Maynaguri. She is a 51-year-old illiterate woman who earns for the family by doing work as a laborer on daily wages. She lives with her husband and three grown sons at Bagnan, Jalpaiguri, West Bengal. Her sons are shuttering workers.

Her husband, 59-year-old Budhu, is a cycle-van puller by profession. He has been pulling a cycle-van for many years. A cycle van is a cycle-operated vehicle used for carrying people and loads in rural areas. However, his van was damaged and stopped functioning properly so he is unable to make good earnings. Due to this, he is facing problems covering the daily expenses of the family. Therefore he needs to buy a new cycle-van as soon as possible in order to generate income.

Jyotsna is also concerned and wants to help her husband in this difficult situation, so she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BJS to help her husband to buy a new cycle-van so that he can operate his business smoothly and earn for the family as before. She hopes the loan will help her to regain financial sustenance. The husband and wife want to save money for any odd situation and for a better future for their family. 

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a new cycle-van for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali is a 32-year-old entrepreneur who hails from Maynaguri. Her family comprises her husband and two school-going sons. Her first and foremost priority is her sons' education. In her childhood, Anjali did not get adequate opportunity for higher study as her parents could not afford it. So to provide education to her sons, she engaged in animal breeding. She lives in the village of Mouyamari in Jalpaiguri district with her husband and sons.

Anjali's husband, 36-year-old Milan, is a green grocer at the local market. His meager income is insufficient for giving the family financial sustenance, and he is unable to cover the basic needs of the family. It causes Anjali to show great maturity and seriousness in her work. 

She runs an animal husbandry and rears one milking cow. She sells milk in her neighborhood. By running her own business, she is able to support her family and cover her children's educational costs. However, in a household of four, their current monthly income will not be enough, so she wants to grow her business by serving more customers. 

Thus Anjali seeks to take a loan from BJS (Kiva's field partner) to buy a new dairy cow. With the expansion of business, she is expecting an increase in her monthly income. With the increased income and savings, Anjali will be able to provide her children with necessities in terms of food, health and education.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow for her milk supply business.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Her name is Rosita, 53, resident of Silang, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a carpenter and is mother to their six  children. She works hard to augment their income to meet their daily household, personal needs and to support the education of their children.
 
Rosita operates two tricycle units and she also has a  small variety store for added income. In the  Philippines, especially in the provinces like Silang, the tricycle is a common  means of transportation. Jeepneys and buses are limited and very few people own a vehicle. The town people usually ride a tricycle from their homes to the market, church, friend’s homes and other destinations within their community. They even use them to travel from one town to the other. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP a day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use for repairs and maintenance of her tricycles. It is very important that her tricycles are in very good running condition to ensure continuous service and income. Her earnings from her business help a lot in addressing the needs of her family. She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation is really a need in their area. She is thanking God in advance for the help that will be given her.

Rosita dreams of being successful in her business so she can give her children the best education possible and give them a better future. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from studying the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance expenses of her tricycle transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as wood, bricks, cement, and other materials in order to make repairs to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise them for further expanding his business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana, 53 years old, lives with her husband and their three sons. Her sons work in a garage and are associated with small businesses, respectively. They live in a small village of Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, West Bengal.  

Kalpana’s husband has grown old so he could not do any work. Thus, Kalpana runs a grocery shop adjacent to her house to generate income for her family, which sells essential commodities of everyday needs like rice, oil, salt, sugar, flour, biscuits, etc. Kalpana  is the main breadwinner for the family. She is a hardworking lady. 

But due to lack of capital she could not grow her business. Thus, she requests a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy stock of grocery items for her shop.  With the expansion of her business, she expects an increase in her income. 

She thanks her lenders because the loan will take a hardworking lady and her family a step closer to achieving their basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for the grocery store.

loans.name: Labanya

texts.en:
Labanya is a 53-year-old housewife from the remote village of Tekatuli in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She stays with her two sons and husband. They live in their own small house.

Labanya's husband is a farmer associated with agricultural activities. Labanya is an ambitious woman who always gives support to her family. She runs a grocery shop from her house. She purchases varieties of grocery items from a wholesale market and sells to her neighbors. Her earnings are a big support for her family.  But of late, she has had to face the problem of the growing prices of essential commodities, so it is hardly possible for her to run the grocery shop.

Labanya wants to grow her business. Thus, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to expand the business. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of groceries like flour, rice, oil, spices, etc., to add to her inventory in the grocery shop.   

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Labanya dreams to be more successful in business and hopes to build a concrete made big grocery shop.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for the existing grocery shop.

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
Mansura is a 28-year-old woman. She stays with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter) in a small village in Jalpaiguri district, West Bengal. Their children go to school.

Mansura is a housewife and her husband, Samsul, is a cycle-van puller. The cycle-van is rented from a local owner. Her husband carries goods and people in the van. From the beginning, they have faced many problems while covering all the household expenses. Her husband's earnings are so little that it is hardly possible for him to meet the basic needs of the family. They face problems bearing the educational expenses of their children. So they want to purchase a cycle-van, but they do not have enough money.

Then Mansura learned about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan from them. She plans to use the loan to purchase a cycle-van. Like a rickshaw and auto, cycle-van is a kind of puller that carries people and loads from one place to another, especially in remote areas. They hope it will enable them to strengthen their financial condition. 

Mansura and her husband are thankful to BJS and Kiva both.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband for business.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 24-year-old woman. She is married to Tapas. They live with their two children (one son and one daughter) in a remote village in the district Jalpaiguri. 

Minati's husband owns a cycle-van (a kind of transport, used in rural areas for carrying goods and people). He earns money by driving the cycle-van. He is the only earning member for the family. But the income is modest and hardly enough to manage the household expenses. So they thought of purchasing a new van. They are planning to give the old one on hire for carrying people and goods, which will give them additional income.

Minati has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a cycle-van for her husband, who is a young, enthusiastic and hardworking person with a great desire to provide his family members with a normal standard of living.

She hopes this will give her family a financial stability. Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving her a loan to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 53 years old and married to Fredrick. Together, they have six children and live in Kireka Zone, a city outskirt. Since 1995, Margaret has operated a retail shop that she started with the help of her husband. Her greatest business challenges are increased rental fees and stiff competition from neighboring retail shops.

Margaret is requesting a 3,000,000 UGX loan to buy more stock of sugar, corn flour, rice, and beans. He loan will help her buy items in demand by her customers and increase her working capital. Margaret hopes to expand her shop and be able to attract many customers in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, corn flour, rice, beans and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
Catherine is a young businesswoman from the Gokwe North District of Zimbabwe. She has been operating a flea market business for the past year with the help of her family. Catherine sells clothing, accessories, and bags. Catherine also volunteers weekly at the local secondary school to fulfill her duties as a Camfed Learner Guide. She helps students improve their leadership and communication skills. 

Catherine requested a loan, which she will use to purchase more items to increase sales and profits. With the additional profits she will earn, Catherine will be able to set some of the money aside to go toward her education.

loans.use: to purchase more items to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to secure a plot so that she can relocate her business, build a larger fowl run and increase production.

loans.name: Sittinona

texts.en:
Her name is Sittinona. She is thankful that she was granted an 18,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply for a new PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. More items displayed at the store will mean more sales and thus increase her earnings. It will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Sittinona hopes to be able to expand soon. She dreams to give her family a good future through all her hard work.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Bulamu Women's Group

texts.en:
Jane is a second-time borrower from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is a married woman, age 35 years and a resident of Gayaza. She has five children of whom four go to school.

She raises poultry and also has a retail shop where she gets money to look after her family. Jane is God-fearing and very hardworking, and her dream is to improve her poultry farming so as to increase her income. She borrowed a loan of 1,000,0000 UGX in order to buy chicks and chicken feeds so that she can increase her stock and her income.

She is so grateful to the lenders and wishes to borrow more funds after this loan. 

Photographed is the UGAFODE staff, extreme left, standing with the group members.

loans.use: To buy chicks and chicken feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock in bulk

loans.name: Melter

texts.en:
Melter lives in Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a poultry project at the local business center for the past year. Her family members also help her sell the chickens. Melter is a proud producer of 50 broiler birds every six weeks. Melter also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. 

Melter requested a loan, which she will use to purchases more chicks, vaccines, and feeds to boost production and increase profits. Melter hopes to build a house for her parents, buy food for her family, and pay her siblings’ school fees.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, vaccines, and feeds

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es:
El esfuerzo y la dedicación han llevado a María Ignacia a cumplir con su pulpería 24 años, negocio que ha venido creciendo y donde hace doce años también empezó a vender ropa, brindando frutos para su economía. Anteriormente había solicitado un préstamo para comprar ropa, zapatos y perfumes para suplir las necesidades de sus clientes, inversión que le ayudó mucho para incrementar sus ingresos. Por esta razón, con una sonrisa expresa su agradecimiento a todas las personas que le tendieron la mano cuando la necesitaba.
Esta comerciante cuenta solo con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes a diario la ayudan moral y económicamente. Sin embargo ella quiere seguir trabajando fuerte y convertirse en mujer autosuficiente, por lo que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su negocio. Razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar productos para su pulpería, tales como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, shampoo, entre otros. Esto le permitirá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes y obtener mayores ganancias para poder encaminarse a su sueño.
texts.en:
Effort and dedication are what have led María Ignacia to carry on with her grocery store for 24 years.  The business has been growing, and she also started to sell clothes 12 years ago, which provides financial profits for her.  

She has previously requested a loan to buy clothes, shoes, and perfume to meet her customers’ needs.  This investment helped her a great deal in order to increase her income.  For this reason, and with a smile, she expresses her gratitude to all of the people who lent her a hand when she needed it.

This merchant only has the support of her daughters, who give her moral and financial support every day.  Nevertheless, she wants to continue working hard, and she wants to become a self-sufficient woman.  In order to do so, she wants to continue investing in her business.

That is the reason that she is requesting a new loan to buy products for her grocery store.  She will buy things like rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and shampoo, among others.  This will allow her to offer her customers a variety.  She will get greater income in order to be able to start out on the road to her dream.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and shampoo, among others.

loans.name: Bwangu Lusanja Devt Group

texts.en:
Rodah is a single mother with four children. She is a resident of Lusanja Zone in the outskirts of Kampala town. Rodah is a member of the Bwangu Lusanja Development Group. Rodah is a market vendor who sells fresh foodstuff to people in Lusanja, where she lives. Her challenges include a limited income as well as raising her children as a single parent in an area where the cost of living is quite high.

Rodah is requesting a 300,000 UGX loan to buy fresh beans, peas, and vegetables to sell. Despite her challenges, she is hardworking and very determined to change the future of her family. Rodah is grateful for UGAFODE-Kiva support.

loans.use: to buy fresh beans, peas, and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Kayima

texts.en:
Kayima is a 38-year-old mother of six children. She is a poultry farmer in the outskirts of Kampala and she supplements her income with money earned from her side job selling local brew. Kayima resorted to farming after finding it hard to feed her family with the high cost of food in the city.

Kayima is requesting a loan to buy more birds to expand her poultry project. Her major problem has been the lack of money to buy birds and feed. Kayima is a hardworking lady who is very focused on her dreams of a better future for her family. She thanks UGAFODE microfinance for their support of her business ventures.

loans.use: to buy chickens to rear and sell

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is a resident of Kanyanya, just seven kilometers from the city. He is married to Rehema and the couple has two children. Ian is a poultry farmer and he currently has about 1,500 birds. Ian’s major business challenge is limited capital to stock chicken feed, which is costly.

Ian is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan to buy chicken feed. He is a repeat borrower. In the future, Ian hopes to grow his business into a big farm. He has been able to boost his business with his previous UGAFODE loan, although he still needs the financial boost. Ian is appreciative of UGAFODE and Kiva lender support and he pledges to repay his loan well to maintain the partnership.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Gonzaga

texts.en:
Gonzaga is married to Caroline and they have two children together as well as taking care of two orphans. He is a resident of an area in the outskirts of Kampala town. Gonzaga owns a simple electronics shop and he also does phone charging and repair with a capital base of 4,000,000 UGX. He supplements his income by farming in his village. Gonzaga’s main clients are neighbors and passersby. His major business challenge is limited income to fulfill his dream of turning his retail shop into a wholesale business. 

Gonzaga is requesting a loan to buy electronics and phone charges to sell as well as to pay tuition for his children. Despite his challenges, he is a hardworking man who is very determined to change his future and that of his children.

loans.use: to buy electronics and phone chargers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and vaccines, and to expand her fowl run.

loans.name: Blanca Del Carmen

texts.es:
Blanca de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta 7° grado de educación básica, es viuda y tiene dos hijas, actualmente una vive con ella.

Blanca se dedica al negocio de la panadería, tiene 20 años de experiencia en dicha actividad que aprendió con sus padres. Debido a la necesidad se vieron forzados a emprender su propio negocio, que hasta hoy en día a dado muy buenos frutos. Blanca trabaja todos los días en su panadería al lado de su hija de 20 años.

El préstamo será utilizado en la compra de materiales para la panadería, harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, etc. Todo para satisfacer la demanda de producto en la localidad.

Blanca se proyecta algún día tener un negocio más grande y contratar personal para que con las ganancias obtenidas mejorar su casa y vivir cómodamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 54 years old and studied to the 7th grade of basic education. She is a widow and has two daughters, once of whom still lives with her.

Blanca operates a bakery business and has 20 years of experience in that activity, which she learned from her parents. Owing to necessity, she was forced to launch her own business. Up to the present, the bakery has born very good fruits. Blanca works every day in her bakery, alongside her 20-year-old daughter.

The loan will be utilized to purchase needed materials for the bakery: flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, etc., all to satisfy demand for her products in the locality.

Blanca plans, some day, to have a larger business and to hire personnel, and  to utilize earnings to improve her house and live more comfortably.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, etc., for her bakery.

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella is a young entrepreneur who lives in the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. 

Giving back to the community is important to her, so Angella volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in order to improve young students’ life skills. She also runs a poultry project; she supplies broiler chickens to her community. Angella would like to increase production, however. With the loan from Kiva, she will be able to purchase more chicks, chick feed and vaccines. 

Angella will use the profits to improve her quality of life and become more financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feed and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, chick feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Shamiso

texts.en:
Shamiso is a 24-year-old businesswoman from Guruve District, Zimbabwe. She runs a welding and metal fabrication business with her husband. The business has been sustaining the family for the past 3 years. 

Shamiso produces and sells window frames, door frames, scotch carts, and wheelbarrows. Furthermore, Shamiso volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide; she helps students form and maintain study groups to promote cooperative learning. Shamiso will use the Kiva loan to purchase another welding machine and metal rods so that she can meet the demand of her customers. 

She intends to use the profits to improve her standard of living, expand her business, and create employment opportunities in her community.

loans.use: to purchase another welding machine and metal rods.

loans.name: Berman  Rufino

texts.es:
Berman es un joven emprendedor que le encanta aprender algo nuevo diario. Esta actitud lo llevó a convertirse en un ingeniero civil, pues miró en esa carrera universitaria la oportunidad de desarrollar su intelecto y de aportar de forma concreta al crecimiento del país. A sus 28 años de edad, está empezando con pasos pequeños a trabajar en lo que estudió, por lo que se siente realizado en su profesión.
Este joven emprendedor, cuenta con el apoyo moral y económico de su padre, quien es agricultor y no ha dudado en ningún momento en apoyarlo en su crecimiento. Ahora que ya está ejerciendo en su carrera, solicita un préstamo para comprar una laptop, herramienta de trabajo que necesita tanto para poder desempeñarse excelente en el área laboral. Él sueña con seguir trabajando, escalar los escalones lentamente hasta llegar a tener su propia empresa.
texts.en:
Berman is an enterprising young man who loves learning something new every day.  This attitude led him to become a civil engineer since he saw in this university major both the opportunity to develop his intellect and to contribute concretely to the growth of his country. At 28 years of age, he is beginning with small steps to enter the field he studied and therefore feels fulfilled in his profession.

This enterprising young man has the moral and economic support of his father who is a farmer and has never hesitated in supporting him in his growth.  Now that Berman is working in his profession, he is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop, a work tool that he needs in order to perform with excellence in the workplace. 

He dreams of continuing to work and of slowing climbing the ladder until he eventually has his own business.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es: El señor Humberto vive en Cochabamba provincia Carrasco en su casa propia actualmente trabaja en la agricultura en un terreno propio que lo adquirió con mucho esfuerzo, ahí se dedica a la producción de plátano y yuca siendo estos cultivos su fuente de ingreso principal, los rendimientos y los precios de estos cultivos son muy variables y eso hace que en algunos meses apenas logren alcanzar para los insumos de mantenimiento y gastos familiares, al no tener ingresos extras para otras cosas decidió empezar con la producción de piña, para ello solicita un crédito para la compra de plantines y la habilitación del terreno, este nuevo cultivo incrementara sus ingresos considerablemente para mejorar su bienestar.
texts.en: Humberto lives in Cochabamba in the province of Carrasco in his own house. He works in agriculture on his own land that he acquired with much effort. He grows plantains and yucca. These crops are his main source of income. The returns and prices of the crops are quite variable and this means that in a few months he only manages to make enough for supplies to maintain his crops and the household expenses. He has no extra income for other things. He decided to start growing pineapples so he is requesting a loan to buy seedling and adapting the land. This new crop will increase his income considerably to better his well-being.

loans.use: to buy seedling and to modify the land.

loans.name: Ruth Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ruth de 57 años de edad, es empleada, tiene 2 hijos de 7 años de edad y 23 años de edad, está casada y su esposo es docente en una escuela local. Con ella viven su esposo y sus 2 hijos.

Ruth tiene 15 años de trabajar como docente, dando clases en una escuela de su comunidad a los alumnos de 2°, 3° y 4° grado, además se encarga de los oficios de su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para cancelar una deuda, se presentó una emergencia y no pudo cancelar su cuota y con el préstamo se pondrá al día.

Ruth espera que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y aprovechen la oportunidad de terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Ruth is 57 years old, an employee and has two children aged 23 and 7 years old. She is married and her husband is a teacher at the local school. She lives with her husband and two children. Ruth has been working as a teacher for 15 years in the community school teaching Grades 2, 3 and 4. She also takes care of the housework.

The loan will be used to cancel a debt. An emergency can up and she couldn't make her installment payment and she needs to catch up on the debt. Ruth hopes that her children can finish their studies and take advantage of the opportunity to complete university.

loans.use: to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Karla Judith

texts.es:
Las computadoras siempre han sido el fuerte de Karla, una joven de 22 años de edad, quien desde su primera clase de computación descubrió que esa era su pasión. Esto la llevó a elegir sin dudas la carrera de Ingeniería en sistemas de información automatizada, estudios con los cuales se siente realizada. En su quinto año ha tenido la oportunidad de hacer pasantías en una pequeña empresa donde siente que está haciendo lo que le gusta y ha estudiado.
A su corta edad, ella pasado por varias situaciones en su vida, entre ellas casarse temprano y tener que separarse rápido. Sin embargo, eso no ha significado un obstáculo, al contrario, la hizo más fuerte para salir adelante. Ahora, a tan solo dos cuatrimestres de graduarse quiere asegurar su culminación de estudios, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para pagar estos últimos meses de la carrera y así cancelar su título desde ya. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien tiene una negocio de ropa en el mercado, y de su papá, quien es fisioterapeuta y es pensionado. Ayuda a esta soñadora a lograr con sus metas y así en un futuro pueda tener la oportunidad de ser parte de una empresa muy importante.
texts.en:
Computers have always been 22-year old Karla’s strong point. She discovered her passion when she took her first computer class, and this led her of course to choose a career in Systems Engineering. In her fifth year of classes she has had the opportunity for an internship with a small business doing what she enjoyed and was studying.

In her short life Karla has worked through various situations including a short marriage and separation. Nevertheless that wasn’t an obstacle; on the contrary it made her more determined to succeed in life. 

Now, with only four months to go before she graduates, Karla wants to be sure she can finish her courses so she is seeking a loan to pay for these last months and her professional qualification. She has the support of her mother who has a business selling clothes in the market, and of her father who is a physiotherapist and has a pension.

Please help this young woman follow her dream so in the future she can have the opportunity to be part of a very important business.

loans.use: pay for the last months of her courses and get her professional qualification

loans.name: Nigel Humberto

texts.es: Nigel es un joven que le apasiona la cultura y la sociabilización con las personas. Desde niño se imaginó crear maravillosos reportajes acerca de lo maravilloso que es Nicaragua y de los grandes deseos de presentar un programa de televisión, es por tal motivo que decidió estudiar Comunicación Social de la cual cursa su tercer año. Actualmente Nigel solicita un préstamos para la compra de una cámara fotográfica ya le ayudara a desarrollarse profesionalmente ya que es una herramienta muy importante para poder realizar sus trabajos asignados en clase. Sus planes futuros es encontrar un trabajo en medio de comunicación ya que le ayudara a adquirir experiencia laboral.
texts.en:
Nigel is a youth that is passionate about culture and the socialization of people. Since he was a boy he imagined creating marvelous reports about how fascinating Nicaragua is and his great desire to present a television program. For these reasons he decided to study Social Communication. He is in his third year.

Nigel is requesting a loan to buy a camera which will help him develop professionally as it is a very important tool to undertake the assignments given in class. His plan for the future is to find work in the communication media which will help him acquire work experience.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en:
Perpetual is a 23-year-old businesswoman from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education to improve the well being of local students. Perpetual also rents a table at the community flea market where she sells products such as bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, tracksuits, and jewelry. She has been running this business for six months and it has enabled her to support her family. 

Perpetual is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more shoes, clothing and accessories. She will use her loan to grow her business and eventually open her own store. This will bring stability to her business will enable Perpetual to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, clothing, and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Francisco Ramón

texts.es:
En la venta de repuestos de bicicletas de don Francisco atiende desde niños hasta adultos que día a día llegan en busca de algún nuevo accesorio para sus bicicletas, siempre van en busca de su negocio por la excelente atención y los productos de calidad que ofrece. Tiene 35 años, está en unión libre y tiene dos hijos. Al terminar la secundaria sus padres no contaban con el dinero suficiente para pagarle la universidad, razón por la que decidió buscar un empleo y así ser de apoyo en la economía familiar. Inició trabajando como ayudante en diferentes talleres, hasta que logró independizarse y establecer su propio negocio. 
Es un hombre honrado y trabajador, cuyo objetivo principal es incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar repuestos para bicicletas tales como llantas, cadenas, horquillas, tirantes, manillas, pedales, entre otros. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda puesto que podrá cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y al mismo tiempo logrará generar más ingresos, lo que le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y de su hogar. Entres sus planes futuros está establecer un negocio completo en cuanto a repuestos para bicicletas. Anhela poder brindarle a su familia un futuro próspero.
texts.en:
In his sales of bicycle parts, Don Francisco serves both children and adults who come in search of some new accessory for their bicycles. They always come to his business because of the excellent service and the high quality products he offers. 

He is 35 years old, lives in a common law relationship and has two children. Upon finishing secondary school, his parents did not have sufficient money to send him to the university. Consequently he decided to look for a job and thus help support his family. He started by working as an assistant in different shops until he managed to become independent and establish his own business.

He is an honest and hardworking man whose principal objective is to increase his production of capital. He needs to purchase bicycle spare parts, such as tires, chains, forks, struts, handles, pedals and more. He thinks the funding will be a great help since he will be able to meet his customer’s demands and at the same time generate more income. This will enable him to improve conditions at his business and in his home. 

Among his future plans is the establishment of a complete business with respect to bicycle spare parts. He also wants to provide a prosperous future for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle spare parts, such as tires, chains, forks, struts, handles, pedals and more.

loans.name: Rafoat

texts.ru: Рафоат имеет высшее образование. Она работает в суде. Рафоат более 1 года работает в этой системе. Она мать 2 детей. Ее дети совершеннолетние. Рафоат и ее муж получают не большую зарплату, и поэтому она планирует начать свой бизнес. Она хочет начать бизнес купле продажей женской одежды. Рафоат собирается привести товар с Турции и продавать на местном рынке. Она будет справляется с бизнесом одна и надеется, что у нее хватит сил и ума развевать новый бизнес. Рафоат запрашивает займ на сумму 30000 долларов США для покупки женской одежды, чтобы начать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Rafoat has a higher education. She works in a court. Rafoat has worked in the judicial system for more than a year. She is a mother to two children. Her children are all grown-up. Rafoat and her husband do not make a large salary, which is why they are planning to start their own business. She wants to start a business buying and selling women's clothing. Rafoat is planning to bring in merchandise from Turkey and sell it at the local market. She will run this business by herself and hopes that she has enough strength and intelligence to develop her new business. Rafoat is requesting a loan for 3,000 USD to buy women's clothing to start her new business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy women clothes for organizing new business

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David James is single, a resident of Taguig, Manila. At the age of 30, he is independent and manages to have a business. He addresses his daily personal expenses and helps support his family's living expenses.

David James is a mineral water distributor. He buys mineral water in containers from wholesalers, sells it per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. He also sells cellular phone loads, retail, for added income. He serves the needs of  his local community. He earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 8,000 loan which he will use to buy more stocks of mineral water and to buy wholesale cellphone cards for retail. He is positive that the financial help will boost his sales and income.  He thanks God in advance for the help that will be given to him.

David James aims to have a Water Station of his own. He desires to be stable to continue to support his old parents' needs.  He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for a sidecar to be used for purchase and delivery of mineral water.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis es un joven de 26 años de edad, casado y con un hijo del cual aún esta cargo. Su principal actividad económica es la fotografía profesional. Con el anhelo de brindarle un futuro prospero a su hijo y las ganas de salir adelante, han hecho de este joven un gran ejemplo para su hijo. Actualmente Jorge Luis está estudiando Contaduría Pública, él ha elegido esta carrera ya que le gustan mucho las matemáticas y siente que le ayudara mucho para obtener mejores ingresos que los que actualmente percibe. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para poder pagar su curso de titulación y culminar sus estudios con éxito. Estimando que el préstamo a su solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá tener muchas oportunidades de empleo al terminar sus estudios. Sus planes a futuro es seguir estudiando y obtener una especialización en Contabilidad de Costo. Las metas próximas de Jorge Luis son mejor las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en: Jorge Luis is a 26 year old man, married and with a son who is still under his care. He works as a professional photographer. His desire to give his son a prosperous future and to move forward in life make him a great sample for his son. Currently, Jorge Luis is studying Public Accounting. He has chosen this career because he likes Math a lot, and he thinks it will help him earn more income than what he does now. He is requesting a loan so that he can pay his certification course and finish his studies successfully. The loan will be very helpful because he will be able to have many employment opportunities when he finishes his studies. His plans for the future are to keep on studying and obtain a specialization in Cost Accounting. His further goals are to improve the conditions of his house.

loans.use: to pay for his certification course.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.es:
Alexander es un hombre de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos y su negocio es el transporte público.
Él es emprendedor, luchador, amable, inteligente, social, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de la Ciudad de Cochabamba, Zona de Lacma, Provincia Cercado, dicha zona se caracteriza por su gran densidad poblacional y cuyas principales actividades económicas son las de comercio y manufactura. 
Alexander es de tez morena, cabello corto, estatura mediana, su trabajo es el transporte libre como taxi, él se dedica a manejar un auto y transportar pasajeros de un lugar a otro. Su deseos de superación lo han llevado a estudiar fisioterapia y kinesiología en la universidad, él se siente muy capaz de llevar adelante una carrera profesional y está decidido a finalizarla, como todo estudiante tiene necesidades de una computadora para estudiar, también necesita libros y materiales de estudio.
Su sueño es egresar de la universidad y realizar una especialidad referente a su carrera.
Es por esos motivos que Alexander solicita un préstamo para la compra de una laptop para finalizar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Alexander is a 23 year old single man who has no children. He works in the transportation sector. He is enterprising, a fighter, friendly, intelligent, sociable, consistent, responsible and very hard-working. He works in the southern part of the City of Cochabamba, Lacma Sector, Cercado Province. This area is characterized by it`s high population density and it`s principal economic activities are manufacturing and commerce.

Alexander is dark-skinned, has short hair and is of medium height. He works as a taxi driver , driving a vehicle and transporting passengers from one place to another. His desire to excel personally have lead him to study physiotherapy and kinesiology at university. He feels quite capable of going forward with a professional career and has decided to complete his studies. Like any student he needs a computer for his studies as well as books and study materials. His dream is to graduate from the university and take specialized training for his career. For these reasons Alexander is requesting a loan to buy a laptop to complete his university studies.

loans.use: to buy a laptop to finish his university studies.

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.en:
Maria de la Luz is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Maria is 34 years old and is a single mother of two girls. She makes a living by selling donuts, a business in which she has been in a long time, and by sewing dresses and other types of clothing; but the donut selling is her priority.

She asked for this loan to invest it in her business since the cold fall and winter season is around the corner. Specifically she wants to buy her ingredients by wholesale; thus saving her money.  With the additional income she may be able to generate with this loan, Maria looks forward to expanding her business and also selling churros and pastries.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as wholesale flour, thus saving her money

loans.name: Antonia Verónica

texts.en:
Antonia is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Antonia is 50 years old, is married, and is a mother of two. She and her husband live in her sister’s house where they pay for some of the house’s utilities. Her husband is a hard-working man who owns a tortilla selling business, and her sons don’t depend anymore on her and her husband.

She helps her husband at his business and additionally she sells candy, sweets, quesadillas, and desserts outside, in order to have her own income. Antonia asked for this loan to finish some improvements she has been carrying out at her home for some time, specifically changing the roof from sheet to a cement one. 

For Antonia, having her own income has been a great accomplishment, and she has been able to pay her own expenses.

loans.use: to finish improving her house by installing a cement roof

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en:
Marcial is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is his story:
Marcial is 38 years old, is married, and is father of two boys; one of them studies in middle school and the other started working recently. He, his wife Aide (to whom he has been married for 20 years now) and his two sons live in Huitzilzingo, a suburb in the outskirts of Mexico City.

He makes a living by harvesting crops such as broccoli and lettuce in some fields near his house which he owns, and he sells them in Mexico City’s central market.  He asked for this loan to invest it in his business, specifically to buy seeds and fertilizer.

Marcial’s biggest achievement has been to be able to grow his patrimony, and he looks forward to harvest more and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his planting fields

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:
Joaquina is 38 years old, is married, and is mother of three children. She makes a living being a merchant with the help of her husband. This is a business in which she has been involved for eight years now.

She owns a food stand in which she sells suadero and chorizo tacos, quesadillas, hamburgers, juices, fruit cocktails, and smoothies. Antonia asked for this loan to stock up her business, attract more clients, and increase her income. 

With the effort she puts into her work, she aspires to support her children and be able to offer them an education and a good standard of living. Her short term goal is to improve her house and make it nicer.

loans.use: to stock up her business and attract more clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase skirts, shoes, pants, and tops

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a young mother of two children who lives in Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers each week at a nearby secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. Getrude teaches students different ways to overcome difficult obstacles in their lives. She spends much of her time running her business as well. Getrude has a poultry project that has been in operation for five months. 

Getrude is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines. The additional profits from her loan will allow her to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chick feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a 24-year-old mother of three from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a poultry project for over 18 months at her homestead. With her family’s assistance, Faith sells chickens to her community. She started the business with batches of 25 broiler birds every six weeks and she has increased her capacity to 100 broiler birds every six weeks. 

Faith is also a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide; she facilitates life skills classes at the local secondary school. With the loan from Kiva, Faith intends to  purchases more chicks, feeds, and vaccines to increase her production capacity and to boost her profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business and start raising hens that lay eggs. Faith will work very hard to support her family and change their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchases more chicks, feeds, and vaccines

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en: Agatha is 23 years old, and she is married with one child. Agatha lives with her family in Guruve District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education to students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition, Agatha owns a stall at the local flea market where she sells products such as jean trousers, formal trousers, pants, tracksuits, shoes, women’s tops, dresses, and shorts. She has been running this business for more than a year now and it has enabled her to support her family. With the Kiva loan, Agatha will purchase more clothing so she can sell even more products. Agatha intends to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and she will be able to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed and to expand her fowl run.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for more than five years and she earns well from this. Having a bigger family requires more effort to provide for their needs, especially for her children. She has had to work hard, with the goal of having better income, to provide their children with better education. 

To improve sales, Marivic would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 20,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Marivic hopes to prosper through her business so that she could cover the everyday needs of her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 12,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover  her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gloria hopes that her business will continue to flourish and she dreams to give her children better education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of vaccines, feeders, feeds, and chicks

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is a businesswoman from the Guruve District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers her time as a Camfed Learner Guide. This means that she helps improve young students’ lives through education. To support herself, Juliet runs a poultry project in her community. She sells quite a few broiler chickens, but she would like to grow her poultry business to meet the rising demand for poultry in her community. A lack of capital has hindered her ability to expand. Juliet is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase more chicks, chemicals, and feed to increase her broiler chicks, stock, and generate revenue. An increase in profits will help her improve her standard of living and contribute positively to her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chemicals, and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise them for further expanding his business.

loans.name: Netsai

texts.en: Netsai is a businesswoman from Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. Netsai buys and sells clothing and accessories at the local flea market to support herself. She also makes weekly trips to the nearby secondary school to meet with students. She is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide, and she helps students learn techniques to communicate with each other and reach their goals. Netsai is requesting a loan from Kiva to purchases more stock to increase sales and profits. Once Netsai has earned more money, she will be able to afford to go back to school and take courses in retail studies.

loans.use: to purchases more stock to increase sales and profits.

loans.name: Tatenda

texts.en:
Tatenda is a 25-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children and lives in Guruve District, Zimbabwe. Tatenda sells chicken to the people in the community; she has been operating her business for the past year and a half. Over the past 12 months, Tatenda has grown her business to a capacity of 80 birds every six weeks. 

In her free time, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the community school. Tatenda is requesting a loan from Kiva because she intends to make bulk purchases of chicks, feeds, sawdust, vaccines, broiler concentrate, and maize to reduce costs. She will then be able to boost her sales and profits. With the additional profits, Tatenda wishes to expand her business and supply to local supermarkets.

loans.use: to purchases chicks, feeds, sawdust, vaccines, broiler concentrate, and maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more different types of stylish clothes for resale to customers in her area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca lives in Muzarabani District, Zimbabwe. Driven by the need to be economically independent, Prisca has been buying and selling clothes for the past 10 months. She sells jackets, shirts, skirts, shoes, slippers, and dresses to people in her community. When she is not working in her flea market, Prisca serves as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at the local secondary school. With the loan from Kiva, Prisca intends to make bulk purchases of jackets, shirts, skirts, and dresses to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will allow her to provide for her future child.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing and accessories so that they can be resold.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothing stocks.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachael is a mother of two who lives in Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. She is also a businesswoman who sells kitchenware, and a Camfed Learner Guide who teaches life skills sessions at the local secondary school. Rachael is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can increase her inventory of products, which will result in more sales and more profits. She hopes to be able to provide for her family with the profits.

loans.use: To increase her inventory of products, which will result in more sales and more profits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock to improve sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grocery items in bulk.

loans.name: Nyaradzo

texts.en:
Nyaradzo is a 30-year-old mother of four from the Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and teaches life skills at the local secondary school. Additionally, Nyaradzo operates her own business. She buys and sells grocery items such as sugar, cooking oil, soap, stationery, candles, flour, milk, juice, salt, and cornmeal. 

Nyaradzo is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can expand her business. She will be able to increase her stock and boost her sales. Nyaradzo hopes to build her own shop in the community and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and belts to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Talent

texts.en:
Talent is a 25-year-old businesswoman, wife, and mother from Mt Darwin District, Zimbabwe. 

She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at a school in her community, and she also has a thriving poultry business. Over the past year she has grown her business to its current capacity – producing about 100 broiler chickens every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. However, Talent would like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feeds to increase production, and continue to be financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of broiler chicks  and feed.

loans.name: Lizzie

texts.en: Lizzie is 25-year-old businesswoman from Mt Darwin District, Zimbabwe. She is married and has one child. Lizzie has been successfully running a flea market from her home since 2012. She operates as a door-to-door vendor and sometimes sells items at her homestead. She sells skirts, blouses, panties, bras, and shoes. When she is not working, Lizzie volunteers in her community by cleaning the health clinic or helping the elderly with everyday chores. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who mentors students at the local secondary school. With the loan from Kiva, Lizzie intends to make bulk purchases of clothing to expand her business and also give back to her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing stocks

loans.name: Juan Carlos
