texts.es: El señor Juan vive en Tiraque tiene 36 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en terreno de 4 Has herencia de sus padres, produce papa, haba y cebada, con rotación de cultivos tiene experiencia en el rubro, además cuenta con cabezas de ganado 4 de engorde y 3 lecheras. Ahora requiere el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y agroquímicos, quiere aprovechar esta época porque los precios son bajos y le entregan en el mismo lugar,  con esto mejorara sus ingresos y nivel de vida.
texts.en: Juan lives in Tiraque. He is 36 years old, single and economically independent. He works in agriculture, harvesting a 4-hectare plot of land that he inherited from his parents. He produces potatoes, beans and barley -- rotating his crops. He is experienced in agriculture and also has cattle (4 fattening cows and 3 milk cows). He now needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer, potato seeds and agrochemicals. He wants to take advantage that prices are low at this time and that he would receive the products at the same place. This would improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer, potato seeds and agrochemicals.

loans.name: Farzona

texts.ru: Фарзона трудолюбивая девушка. Ей 26 лет. Она не замужем и не имеет детей. Фарзона начала свою трудовую деятельность с 2010 года. Она работает в государственном учреждении секретарем. Фарзона на работе проявляет хорошо. Она также учится в университете. Фарзона является студенткой 3 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Она учится в факультете Менеджмента. Фарзона учится в заочное отделение. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Farzona is a hardworking woman. She is 26 years old. She is unmarried and does not have any children. Farzona started her professional career in 2010. She works in a government agency as a secretary. Farzona has done very well at her job. She also studies at university. Farzona is a third-year student at the Tajik State University of Commerce. She is in the Management Department. Farzona takes correspondence classes. She is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is thankful that she was granted a 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy  gardening materials (wire and baskets) and supplies (seed and fertilizer) needed in her business.  Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply now for a Php 19,000 loan which she will use to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business.  It will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her.
 
Emelita dreams of being able to give her her children the best education possible so they can have a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies for her business.

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
Suena la alarma e inicia un día productivo en la casa de doña Martha, mientras ella prepara el desayuno con ayuda de su hijo menor de diez años, su hijo mayor de 21 años ordena y limpia la pulpería antes de irse a trabajar. La unión hace la fuerza y es así como está familia ha logrado salir adelante. Es una mujer amable, trabajadora y madre soltera, tiene 43 años y ha mantenido en pie su pulpería por más de diez años. Agradece el financiamiento de Kiva a través de MiCrédtio con el que logró incrementar sus productos y mejoró la administración de su negocio, con la que ganó más clientela y generó más ingresos lo que le permitió hacer más grande su pulpería. 
Con ánimos de seguir prosperando, Martha solicita un segundo crédito para incrementar la producción de su capital, requiere comprar granos básicos, como arroz y frijoles; también aceite, condimentos, gaseosas, pan, golosinas, productos de limpieza personal, entre otros. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento puesto que anhela establecer un negocio más grande en el que pueda cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. Su meta es ser una empresaria exitosa y trabajará arduamente hasta lograrlo, su fuente de motivación son sus dos hijos, a quienes quiere brindarle mejores condiciones, salud y educación de calidad.
texts.en:
The alarm clock rings and a productive day starts in the home of Doña Martha. While she prepares breakfast with the help of her younger son, age 10, her older son, who is 20 years old, arranges and cleans her small grocery store before going off to work. In union there is strength and that is how this family has managed to get ahead.

Martha is a friendly, hardworking, single mother who is 43 years old. She has kept her store in operation for more than ten years. She is grateful for Kiva financing through MiCredito, which has enabled her to increase inventory and improve the administration of her business. Consequently she has attracted more customers and generated more income, which has allowed her to expand her store.

With the goal of continuing to prosper, Martha is requesting a second loan to increase her production of capital. She needs to purchase basic grains, such as rice and beans; also oil, condiments, soft drinks, bread, sweets, personal cleaning products and more. She puts her faith in financing because she wants to establish a larger business where she can meet the demands of her customers. 

Her goal is to be a successful business woman and she will work hard until she succeeds. She is motivated by her two sons for whom she wants to provide better living conditions, a healthy life and a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, such as rice and beans; also oil, condiments, soft drinks, bread, sweets, personal cleaning products and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothing, accessories, shoes, and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks, chemicals, and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock to improve sales and profits.

loans.name: Carisle

texts.en: Carisle is a 26-year-old married woman with two children. She resides in the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She is a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school where she volunteers as a life skills facilitator. She also volunteers in her community by assisting the elderly. Carisle supports herself by operating a poultry business from her home. She started the business from the small savings she made with friends. Originally, Carisle started her business by producing a batch of 25 chickens every six weeks. However, her business has grown to producing 100 broilers every six weeks. If given the loan, Carisle is going to continue to increase the number of broilers she produces and buy vaccines for her chickens. The profits will support her family and allow her to help disadvantaged children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and vaccines

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 25-year-old married mother of one from the district of Muzarabani in Zimbabwe. She sells clothes, shoes, and blankets at a small shop in her community. In her free time, Sarah is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who works with students at the local school to improve their cooperative learning skills. 

Sarah is seeking a Kiva loan to purchase large quantities of skirts, shoes, pants, and tops. With the profits she will earn, Sarah will be able to expand her business, meet her basic needs, and improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 21-year-old married woman who has one child. She is from the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe. Melody devotes her time to assisting the elderly in her community who do not have anyone to care for them. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer at the local school. She motivates students to change their lives, and the world, for the better. Additionally, Melody is a businesswoman who sells clothes at the local market and from her homestead. She sells shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, bed sheets, and stockings to the community. 

Melody is requesting a Kiva loan so that she can increase her stock to improve sales. She will purchase a bale of shirts, blouses, and dresses so that she will be able to meet the demand from her customers. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business, and it will allow Melody to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of shirts, blouses, and dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of sugar, cornmeal, salt, and washing powder.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in the Mt Darwin District of Zimbabwe, where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide. She helps students succeed at school and in their daily lives. In addition, Charity rents a shop at the local school so that she can sell groceries such as sugar, cooking oil, flour, and soap to her community. Through hard work and dedication, she dreams of seeing her small business expand. 

Charity is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase groceries in bulk and add new products to her shop. Charity hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with the additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more chicks and feed to increase output

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines to boost production.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Beauty is a married businesswoman and mother from the distric of Muzarabani in Zimbabwe. She operates a grocery shop at the local business center in her village. She sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks and snacks. Beauty was able to start her business with the small savings she received from participating in the training Camfed provided. Each week, Beauty volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide. She teaches the students beneficial life and study skills. 

Beauty is requesting a loan from Kiva to increase her sales and profits. With the loan, she will be able to buy all of her products in bulk. Beauty intends to increase her family’s standard of living. She also intends to help vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Jiguiseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe  JIGUISEME   sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à MEDINE un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame BIBA assises au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes   JIGUISEME , fait la vente  des oranges.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  des quantités importantes d’orange d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 26 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Jiguiseme group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Medine, one of the popular neighborhoods of Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their 14th group loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so that they can better satisfy their customers' needs.

Biba, who is seated in the middle of the photo, sells oranges. With her loan, she plans to buy a large quantity of oranges. She is highly sought after by her customers, and she sells her fruit at retail in the market to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Biba hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 26,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back her loan and its interest and the other part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy oranges

loans.name: Forget

texts.en:
Forget is a 20-year-old poultry farmer from Gokwe North District, Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating the business for over two years. She also helps students deal with challenges in their lives when she is volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide. 

A loan from Kiva would mean that Forget would be able to purchase more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines. She also hopes to expand her fowl run to increase production. Additional profits will enable Forget to further her education.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks, chick feed, and vaccines.

loans.name: Soutoura Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SOUTOURA  sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, et ont en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles  à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaires dans la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles sont à leur dix-septième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Madame SAFIATOU assises à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe des femmes  SOUTOURA, fait la vente  des  poissons fumés.
Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  1 sac de 50 kg de poisson fumé au grand marché,  d’où elle est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits pour la revendre en détail au marché à une clientèle composée d’ homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 46 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of the Soutoura group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have three children. They mostly live in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular neighborhoods in Sikasso, in the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their 17th group loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can satisfy their customers' needs.

Safiatou, who is seated second from the left in the photo, works selling smoked fish. With her loan, she plans to buy one 50-kilogram sac of smoked fish from the grand market. She is highly sought after by her customers because of the quality of her stock. She makes her sales at retail to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Safiatou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 46,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back her loan and its interest and the other part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of clothes and footwear to sell.

loans.name: Pride

texts.en:
Pride is single and lives in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide and works with the local school to improve young students’ leadership skills. 

To support herself, Pride runs a poultry business in her community and sells broiler chickens. She wants to expand her poultry business to meet the rising demand for poultry in her community, but a lack of capital has hindered her ability to do so. 

Pride is seeking a Kiva loan, so that she can buy more chicks and feed, to increase her broiler chick stock and generate revenue. An increase in profits will help improve her standard of living and contribute positively to her community.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and feed.

loans.name: Yorling Arleja

texts.es: Yorling es madre de tres hijos, quienes son sus principales impulsadores que la motivan a trabajar arduamente todos los días para brindarles lo mejor. Con solo 27 años de edad ya tiene su propio negocio hace 4 años donde comercializa una variedad de producto desde dulces para niños hasta productos para el hogar. Todo inicio cuando tenía un dinero ahorrado con el cual opto por invertirlo en el negocio que actualmente posee, hoy en día esa cantidad inicial de inversión es duplicada. Sin embargo Yorling estima que no es suficiente para brindarles un mejor servicio y más variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo cual solicita un préstamo para comprar gaseosa, jugos, agua embotellada, materiales didácticos alusivos a las figuras patrióticas del país, ya que se acerca un mes donde este tipo de material es muy demandado por los estudiantes. Estima que el préstamo a solicitud es de mucha ayuda porque logra incrementar su inventario, y de esa forma logra brindarles un mejor servicio de calidad y precios para sus clientes. Sus planes  futuros son hacer crecer su negocio y componer su casa de habitación y hacer una gran inversión para mejor su capacidad productiva y de ganancia.
texts.en:
Yorling is the mother of three children; they are the main drive that motivate her to work hard everyday so she can give them all the best. With only 27 years of age, she already has her own business where she sells a variety of products from candy for children to home products. 

Everything started when she had some money saved with which she opted to invest in the business that she now owns. Today, that initial inversion has doubled. Nonetheless, Yorling estimates that this is not enough to give a better service and a greater variety of products to her clients, that’s why she is requesting a loan to purchase sodas, juices, bottled water, and teaching materials that allude to the patriotic figures of the country. 

She estimates that the requested loan will be of much help because she will be able to increase her inventory, and that way managed to give better prices and quality services to her clients. 

Her future plan is to make her business grow, fix her home, and make a great investment to better her productive capacity and her earnings.

loans.use: To purchase soda, juice, bottled water, teaching materials that allude to the patriotic figures of the country.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her inventory, which would boost sales and profits.

loans.name: Portia

texts.en:
Portia is a 28-year-old businesswoman from the district of Nyaminyami in Zimbabwe. She rents a shop at the local flea market where she sells bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits and t-shirts. She has been running her business since 2013, and it has enabled her to support her family. Portia also volunteers in her community; she teaches leadership skills to young students. 

With the Kiva loan, Portia will purchase more clothing supplies for her business. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business, and it will enable her to change her family’s status and finances.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es: El señor Tomas y su esposa Carmen, viven en Cochabamba provincia chapare;  tienen 36 y 35 años de edad respectivamente, ambos con un nivel de instrucción primaria, de estado civil casados por más de 10 años, económicamente son independientes, se dedican a la actividad de agricultura siembran papa y locoto en una superficie de 1.5 hectáreas. Para la venta de sus productos cuentan con un mercado consolidado la feria semanal de colomi, el señor requiere un crédito para la compra de abono orgánico, semilla de papa y productos agroquímicos, de esta forma tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá mejorar su nivel de vida en beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Tomas and his wife Carmen live in Cochabamba, a province of Chapare; they are 36 and 35 years old, respectively. They both have an elementary school education, and a married marital status for more than 10 years. They are economically independent; they make a living from agriculture, planting potatoes and locoto (a type of chili pepper) in an area of 1.5 hectares. To sell their products they depend on a market that sets up during the weekly fair of Colomi. 

Mr. Tomas requires a loan to purchase organic fertilizer, potato seeds, and agrochemicals. With these, he will have better earnings and he will be able to improve upon his quality of life to benefit his family.

loans.use: To purchase organic fertilizer, potato seeds, and agrochemicals

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг разведенная женщина, которой исполнилось 31 год. У нее есть сын и дочка, с которыми она живет в городе Куляб. Садбарг одна обеспечивает своих детей. Конечно без мужской поддержки трудно, но Садбарг справляется. Она работает в столовой поваром. Этой деятельностью она занимается  около 5 лет. Садбарг предлагает посетителям вкусные национальные блюда. Посетители всегда довольны ее услугой. Сейчас Садбарг хочет закупить холодильник в свою столовую. В нем она будет держать прохладительные напитки. Однако для осуществления этой покупки ее средст не хватает и она просит кредит. Садбарг надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Sadbarg is a divorced, 31-year-old woman. She lives with her son and daughter in the city of Kulob. Sadbarg is providing for her children by herself. It has been difficult without the support of a husband, but Sadbarg has managed. She works in a cafeteria as a cook. She has been in this position for about 5 years. Sadbarg offers customers delicious ethnic Tajik dishes. Customers are always happy with her services. Now Sadbarg wants to buy a refrigerator for her cafeteria. She will store refreshments in it. However, she does not have enough funds to complete this purchase, which is why she is requesting a loan. Sadbarg relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store and preserve refreshments.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
Telma previously requested a loan for 40,000 PHP, which she used to buy LPG tanks needed in her retail gas business, which she has been running for two years.  Through her earnings she is able to address her family's daily living expenses and support the education of her children. 

Telma is requesting another loan for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more LPG tanks to add to her product inventory.  More tanks displayed at her store help increase her sales and her income. Her earnings from her business help meet her family's daily needs and the school needs of her children.

Telma hopes to open another branch someday.  She wants to give her children the best education possible for them to have a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more tanks of LPG to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase incense and perfumes

loans.name: Everjoy

texts.en:
Everjoy is a businesswoman from Mt Darwin District, Zimbabwe. With her husband’s assistance, she has been buying and selling clothing for the past three years. She started the business to pay her sibling’s school fees and improve her own standard of living. Everjoy also volunteers each week as a Camfed Learner Guide in the local secondary school. 

Everjoy is requesting a loan, which she will use to make bulk purchases of clothing to increase her inventory. With the additional profits, Everjoy hopes to expand her business into a large boutique and create employment opportunities for people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a 28-year-old businesswoman from Mt Darwin District, Zimbabwe. She buys and sells goats with her family members’ assistance. Stella has been operating her business for 18 months. She sometimes sells the goat meat to people in her community, as well. Stella also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school; she teaches students leadership skills. With the loan from Kiva, Stella will purchase goats in bulk and increase her profits. She will also buy vaccines and feed in order to fatten the goats.

loans.use: to purchase more goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks, vaccines, and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bedspreads and comforters for resale.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz is 33 years old, married, and has two sons. She lives with her parents and has work selling products through a catalog for the last five years. Beatriz started helping her mother-in-law sell Mexican snacks, and later she started her own business selling clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She is asking for a loan to restock her inventory; she wants to buy shoes and women's clothes. She describes herself as trustworthy and says that her biggest achievement have been making some home improvements, providing stability for her family. Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy shoes and women's clothes to sell through her catalog.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Mery

texts.es: Rosario es una señora de 44 años de edad, vive al oeste de la ciudad, está separada hace 10 años de su esposo. Vive sola ya que no tiene hijos dependientes, cuida la casa de un familiar, pero ella quiere independizarse y tener su propia casa por esa razón solicita un crédito para pagar el anticrético de una vivienda, ya que le apena mucho vivir con sus familiares, como no tiene los recursos suficientes recurre al crédito, actualmente trabaja en una empresa de limpieza  muy reconocida de la ciudad con una antigüedad de 5 años, con el crédito desea mejorar sus concisiones de vida.
texts.en: Rosario is a 44 year old woman. She lives in the West side of the city. She has been separated for 10 years from her husband. She lives alone because she has not dependent children anymore. She takes care of the house of a relative, but she wants to be independent and have her own house. For this reason she is requesting a loan to pay for the full rental amount (anticretico) of a house because she is quite embarrassed to live with her relatives. Because she does not have enough resources, she is requesting the loan. Currently, she is working at a very well known cleaning company of the city where she has worked for 5 years. With the loan she wishes to improve her life conditions.

loans.use: To pay the full rental amount (anticretico) of a house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more goats and vaccines

loans.name: Thandiwe

texts.en:
Thandiwe is a 22-year-old single businesswoman who has two children. She lives in Mt Darwin District, Zimbabwe, and has been successfully selling groceries for over 18 months. Thandiwe operates her business from her homestead, and sometimes markets her products door-to-door. Thandiwe is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide who teaches students methods of cooperative learning. 

With the loan from Kiva, Thandiwe will make bulk purchases of groceries to reduce costs and boost her sales and profits. With the additional profits, Thandiwe hopes to expand her business by opening a grocery store. 

Thandiwe is planning to improve her standard of living and study further to enhance her education.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les dix femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Médine de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de grains de mil, de condiment, d’habillement. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  5eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Nah (la 3eme femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains de mil dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil chez les stockeurs  à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Nah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 35 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The 10 women of Danaya Group all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 44 years old and have four children. They all live in the Médine neighborhood of Ségou (4th administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, family, and marriage ties, as well as from their business activities in the neighborhood. 

These women sell millet, spices, and clothing. With the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Nah (the third woman standing in the photo, left to right) is a major millet retailer in the neighborhood and environs. She plans to use her loan to purchase five sacks of millet from the warehouses in Ségou. She sells them for cash and often credit at home and in the market to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Mrs. Nah hopes to see an average monthly profit of 35,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will be used for the needs of her children and will also expand her business. She hopes to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To purchase millet.

loans.name: Tilda

texts.en:
Tilda is an 18-year-old businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been running her grocery business for the past year. Tilda supplies the community with sugar, rice, and cooking oil. She has managed to financially support her family with her business. Additionally, Tilda serves as a Peer Educator in her community and a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school.

With the Kiva loan, Tilda is going to make bulk purchases of her products to cut down on her expenses. She hopes to grow her business and be able to give her parents and sisters the life they deserve.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of her products to cut down on expenses.

loans.name: Lessley

texts.en:
Lessley took advantage of the skills that she gained at school and started her own business. She is just 18 years old, but she operates a successful business sewing and is selling uniforms for Mudzi District, Zimbabwe schoolchildren. Lessley is also a volunteer community activist who campaigns for the economic independence of young women as well as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer who facilitates life skills to students. 

With the Kiva loan, Lessley would like to purchase material, thread, and other supplies so that she can produce even more uniforms.

loans.use: To purchase material, thread, and other supplies

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a young businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been selling clothing at a flea market for the past six months. She is also a Camfed Learner Guide who delivers 'My Better World' sessions to students each week. 

With the loan she is requesting from Kiva, Abigail would like to purchase better quality clothes in bulk so that she can attract more customers. With the additional profits she will earn, Abigail will pay her siblings’ school fees.

loans.use: To purchase better quality clothes in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 21-year-old married businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. Ever since she completed her schooling, Grace has been focusing on her ever-growing business. She originally bought and sold groceries out of her homestead, but now she has expanded the business into a small shop at the local business center. She supplies the community with sugar, rice, tea, stationary, sanitary items, cooking oil, and potato chips. 

Grace serves as a Peer Educator in her community, and as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school. 

With the loan she is requesting from Kiva, Grace will make bulk purchases to reduce her costs and increase her sales and profits. She hopes to be economically stable so that she can support her siblings through school.

loans.use: To make bulk purchases

loans.name: Ikrobiby

texts.ru: Икробиби родилась в 1955 году. Она живет и работает на юге страны. Икробиби одна вырастила своего сына Умеда. Она разведена и ее муж женился на другой женщине уже давно. Она с молодости трудилась упорно с раннего до позднего вечера, чтобы прокормить себя и сына. Она более 14 лет занимается изготовлением и продажей самбуса, булочки и т.п. Она имеет свою лавку. Икробиби с бизнесом справляется сама. Она хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом в плохом состоянии. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ikrobiby was born in 1955. She lives and works in the South of the country. Ikrobiby raised her son, Umed, by herself. She is divorced and her husband got remarried to another woman a long time ago. Since her youth, she has worked very hard from sunup to sundown in order to feed herself and her son. For more than 14 years, she has baked and sold sambusas (Central Asian meat or vegetable filled patties), rolls, etc. She has her own shop. Ikrobiby runs her business all by herself. She wants to repair her house, as her house is completely dilapidated. She is requesting a loan for 3000 somoni to buy construction materials to repair her house. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing house

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
As a Camfed Learner Guide in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe, Melody volunteers her time in teaching life skills to young students. She also assists elders in her community and operates a stall at a local flea market where she sells various clothing items and accessories.

Following the success of her small business and to meet customer demand, Melody intends to use a Kiva loan to increase her stock. She will purchase shoes, slippers, shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and jewellery in bulk. One day, Melody will open her own store. If her business grows, Melody can continue to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase shoes, slippers, shirts, t-shirts, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and jewellery in bulk.

loans.name: Forget

texts.en:
Forget is a 22-year-old married businesswoman from Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide; each week she assists young students to overcome obstacles at school and at home. Forget is also a vibrant entrepreneur who operates a grocery tuck-shop from her home. She sells food items such as cooking oil, sugar, salt, cornmeal, biscuits, snacks, and she even sells some clothing. 

Forget inspires young women in her community as an entrepreneur, and she has been running her business for a year. Forget is very pleased with how much she has achieved, but she knows that she can accomplish more. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Forget intends to increase her stock to improve sales and profits. An increase in profits would mean that she will be in a better position to provide for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is grateful for the Php 40,000 loan that was extended to her which she used to buy more of fruits and vegetables of different kinds. She has been successful in this business for ten years now.  Through her earnings she is able to send her child to school and meet their everyday basic needs.  She and her husband help each other to maintain their business.

She is requesting another Php 40,000 loan to add more fruits and vegetables needed in her business.  The income from her buy and sell business is a stable source to sustain their daily needs and in sending their child to school.  She is thanking God in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Bella believes that her business will grow as she aims to expand her place.  She desires to have a quiet and happy life with her family.  She meets every week with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay back micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for various fruits and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en: Albertina is 55 years old, married, and has five children. She has a kiosk. She is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD, which she will use to purchase additional items, including eggs, nuts, siri limes, tomatoes, cooking oil, rice, cigarettes, and other things to sell. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with working capital of 1,000 USD. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve her management and to prepare her business to grow bigger in the future. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin that provides her with working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: To buy eggs, nuts, siri limes, tomatoes, cooking oil, rice, cigarettes, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe and is a source of inspiration to young people in her community because she is determined to succeed. She often volunteers at the local secondary school as a Camfed Learner Guide; she teaches study and life skills to young students. 

Additionally, Caren operates a grocery shop at her local business center where she sells sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks. If profits allow, Caren will expand her business into a larger store. She wishes to improve herself financially and give her family a higher standard of living. Her greatest hope is to see vulnerable children being taken care of. 

Caren will use the Kiva loan to purchase her products in bulk to reduce costs as well as boost sales and profits.

loans.use: to purchase products such as sugar, cooking oil, rice, flour, washing soap, soft drinks, and snacks in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase amount of goats to raise and sell them for further expanding in his business.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло 41 год. Она замужняя женщина, у нее две дочери и два сына. Детям по 14, 10, 8 и 5 лет и они еще ходят в школу. Шахло активная деятельная женщина. Она работает в сфере услуг. Вот уже три года как Шахло работает поваром в столовой. Ее меню состоит из национальных блюд. Она очень вкусно готовит и клиенты всегда довольны ее блюдами. Сейчас Шахло хотела бы расширить свою деятельность. Она нуждается в аппарате гриля для приготовления кур. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Расширив состав меню Шахло еще больше привлечет клиентов. Поэтому она надеется на поддержку.
texts.en: Shahlo is 41 years old. She is a married woman and has two daughters and two sons. Her children are 12, 10, 8 and 5 years old and all attend school. Shahlo is an active, ever-busy woman. She works in the service sector. For three years, she has worked as a chef in a cafeteria. Her menu consists of national dishes. She cooks very delicious food and her customers are always satisfied with her dishes. Now Shahlo would like to expand her business. She needs a grill to make grilled chicken. She is requesting a loan for this purpose. By expanding her menu, Shahlo will be able to attract more customers. This is why she relies on your support.

loans.use: to buy a grill for making grilled chicken.

loans.name: Lise

texts.en:
Lise is 20 years old and a single woman with no children. 

Lise runs a small business selling coconut buns and banana chips in her community and has been doing this for 2 years.

Lise has requested a loan to buy a gas oven, cooking oil, sugar, yeast, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lise will love to support her family's living.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, cooking oil, sugar, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en: Petra finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only is she doing her hobby, she earns an income as well. She busies herself in order to sufficiently provide for the family. She grabbed the opportunity to become a full fledged member of PMPC. She credits the cooperative with loaning her capital to support her banana business. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase farming tools and fertilizers. In the future, Petra wishes to become a supplier of bananas in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farming tools and fertilizers.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of clothing, beauty products, undergarments, toiletries and other direct selling brands. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
She would like to apply now for a Php 30,000 loan which she will use to buy additional personal goods, such as clothing, beauty products like cologne, toiletries such as soap, shampoo, conditioner, and other products used for cleaning. More items displayed at her store will mean more sales and thus increase her earnings.  Her business is a stable source of income to meet her family’s daily needs and children’s education expenses. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her. 

Jesusa hopes that her business will grow so she could send her children to the best schools possible.  She dreams of giving her family a better future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Ediesel

texts.en: Ediesel resides in Panalsalan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. She is 39 years old and happily married. Ediesel hopes to live a comfortable life. She applied for a loan amounting Php 15,000 to buy equipment needed for fishing. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters to her that she has been given priority as a Micro-finance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment for fishing.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda resides in Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Phillipines. She is 49 years old and happily married. Imelda hopes to live comfortably in a house with good roofing. Recently, she applied for a loan amounting to Php 25,000 to buy materials needed to repair her house, like hollow blocks, nails and cement. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters to her that she has been given priority as a Micro-finance member of PMPC. This is what she is thankful for when all her financing needs on her retailing business were supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to repair her house, like hollow blocks, nails and cement.

loans.name: Siuli

texts.en: Siuli is 30 years old and a married woman with 5 children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbages and so on in her community, and she has been doing this for 3 years. Siuli has requested a loan to buy seeds, a weed sprayer, bush knives and chemicals, etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Siuli hopes to extend her business to support her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, bush knives, a weed sprayer, chemicals, etc.

loans.name: Taisia

texts.en: Tasia is 23 years old and a partner woman with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pork buns and noodles, etc. in her community, and she has been doing this for 2 years. Tasia has requested a loan to buy a sacks of flour and sugar, boxes of chicken, yeast and cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tasia will love to increase the improvement of her family living.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour and sugar, boxes of chicken, yeast and cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is a 24-year-old married businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She sells secondhand clothes that she gets in bulk from neighboring countries. Abigail volunteers as a life-skills facilitator at the local secondary school and also assists the vulnerable children in her community as a Camfed Learner Guide.

With the requested loan from Kiva, Abigail intends to purchase a bale of clothes so that she has various options to offer her customers. This will also help her increase sales and make more money.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes so that she has various options to offer her customers.

loans.name: Vimbai

texts.en:
Vimbai is a businesswoman from the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She spends much of her time volunteering as a Camfed Learner Guide; she teaches essential life skills to secondary school students. Vimbai also operates her own poultry business, and she produces 100 broiler birds every six weeks, then sells them to local residents. Vimbai started her business so that she could become financially independent, and she hopes to see other young women in her community prosper like she has. 

With a Kiva loan, Vimbai will purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production; she intends to become a supplier to major supermarkets one day.

loans.use: To purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food materials

loans.name: Nicky

texts.en: Nicky is a 19-year-old single male with no kids. He runs a small business in his community, selling meat pies, pork buns and cakes, etc. and has been doing this for 2 years. Nicky has requested a loan to buy a gas oven, a sack of flour, yeast, boxes of chicken and cooking oil, etc. He joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With his earnings, Nicky hopes to built up a small bakery shop in front of his house.

loans.use: to buy a gas oven, a sack of flour, yeast, cooking oil and boxes of chicken, etc.

loans.name: Seukatarina

texts.en: Seukatarina is a 36-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small plantation and grows taro, bananas, taamu, yams and so on to earn a living. She has been doing this for 4 years. She has requested a loan to buy a weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals, an axe and fillings, etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Seukatarina hopes to start up another small business for her family.

loans.use: to buy a weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, an axe and fillings.

loans.name: Lusa

texts.en: Lusa is a 42-year-old married woman with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items such as noodles, chicken, sausages, snack foods like twisties and bongo, etc. She has been doing this for three years. Lusa needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, noodles, boxes of chicken, sausages, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, salt, boxes of chicken, sausages, noodles. etc.

loans.name: Coronado José

texts.es: José es un señor de 47 años de edad, casado y padre de dos hijos que aún tiene a su cargo. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura y ganadería la cual dio inicio cuando a la edad de 15 años apoyaba a su papa a la siembra de arroz de secano y maíz misma actividad a la que actualmente él también se dedica. José aparte de comercializar la cosecha de sus siembras también comercializa leche fresca que la aprovecha de su ganado para obtener otros ingresos. Él solicita un préstamo para cuidar de su ganado comprándoles vitaminas, desparasitantes y guate para alimentar a su ganado. José estima que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda ya que de esta forma lograra mejorar las condiciones de su ganado. Sus planes futuros es incrementar su hato ganadero.
texts.en:
José is a 47-year-old man, married, and father to two children, who are still his dependants. 

His main sources of livelihood are cattle raising and agriculture—occupations in which he got started when, at the age of 15, he used to help his father to grow rainfed rice and corn. Currently, he is growing the same type of grains.

In addition to marketing his crops, José also makes good use of the fresh milk from his cattle, which he sells to earn extra income. 

To care for his cattle, he is requesting a loan to buy them corn fodder, deworming medications, and vitamins. José considers that the loan he is requesting will be very helpful because, through it, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his cattle.

His future plans are to increase his dairy herd.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, deworming medications, and corn fodder to feed his cattle.

loans.name: Gapua

texts.en:
Gapua is a 64-year-old, married woman, with seven children. She owns and operates a small store, selling daily items, such as sausages, noodles, sugar, and flour. She has been doing this for two years.

Gapua needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, salt, sugar, noodles, chicken, etc. She hopes to use her profits to extend her store. She became a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2012 to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, salt, sugar, noodles, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a businesswoman from Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. She is 35 years old, married, and has an expertise in selling. 

Arlene runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family. Arlene has been an active member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for three years and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good-standing, without records of default. 

Now, Arlene has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Arlene continues to look for better business opportinuites, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items.

location.town: Plaridel - Cartagena Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more goats, vitamins, and deworming medicine

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou lives in Cartagena, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old and is married with four children. 

Marilou has her passion of making food delicacies, like "pan bisaya" on any occasion, especially during fiesta. "Pan Bisaya" is a bread, composed of basic ingredients, like flour. The folks called it "pan bisaya" because it is not oven-cooked bread in the bakery. It is cooked by wood charcoal in a specially-designed cooking pan. A friend of Marilou's approached her to turn her "pan bisaya" expertise into a business and Marilou gave a shot to a "pan bisaya" business. 

In 2010, Marilou applied her membership with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good-standing and repays her obligations in a timely manner.

Recently, she asked for financial assistance of PHP 20,000 to buy more sacks of flour and other raw ingredients for her "pan bisaya" business . Through this loan, she hopes to increase her income and help in the expansion of her business. 

Marilou has found assistance for their financial needs through Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and she is very thankful, with all her heart. She wishes to give her family a good life and wants to see all her children holding their college diplomas in the future.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of flour and other raw ingredients for her "pan bisaya" business.

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.ru: Евгения трудолюбивая женщина. Она родилась в 1978 году. Она разведена и не имеет детей. Евгения живет одна. Она более 10 лет работает в мед-учреждении кассиром. Она выполняет свою работу честно и качественно. Данное время она нуждается вашей финансовой поддержке, так как ей некому больше обращаться. Она больна и должна срочно лечиться. Евгения запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Evgeniya is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1978. She is divorced and does not have any children. Evgeniya lives alone. For more than 10 years, she has worked in a medical establishment as a cashier. She does her job well and honestly. Currently, she needs financial support as she does not have anyone else to turn to. She is ill and needs to have treatment as soon as possible. Evgeniya is requesting a loan for 5000 somoni to buy medicine for her treatment. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her medical treatment.

loans.name: Jucelina

texts.en: Jucelina lives in Baucau. She is married and has five children. She has been involved in business activities since 2007 when she started with her own working capital of $ 80.00. She has a kiosk in her house and now she is applying for a loan of USD 1,000.  She is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, which she will use to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including cooking oil, soy sauce, perfume, salts, candies, glue, medicine, detergent and other things to sell including hard drinks. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she will improve her business and increase her incomes in the future.

loans.use: to buy things to sell including cooking oil, soy sauce, perfume, salts, glue, medicine, etc.

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en: Pedrita is 51 years old, with six children.  She personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities.   She became a member of Paglaum MPC, and has been a member in good standing for almost two years. Recently, Pedrita wanted to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PHP 10,000 for the purchase of new nets and fishing accessories.  They want to have all the needed fishing accessories to minimize chances of a low or zero catch.  She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages.  She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors, so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings from the daily sales.  She wishes to see her children have stable jobs as well.

loans.use: to purchase new nets and fishing accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 37 years old, married, and a resident of Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao Philippines. Her husband earns a living through labor works, mostly on construction. Arlene thought about how she could help her husband in supporting the daily needs of their family.  Out of her small amount of savings, she decided to engage in "tuba" selling in their house. "Tuba" is also called a coconut wine, since it was extracted from young coconuts. "Tuba" is a favorite past time drink of most Filipino people, especially in the barrio or barangay.

Arlene has been a member of PMPC for two years and enjoys the privileges being a member of the cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more gallons of "tuba" to sell for her increasing customers to make promising sales daily. Arlene deeply wishes to maintain a membership in good standing with PMPC, and hopes to live a comfortable with her family and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of "tuba" to sell.

loans.name: Shylet

texts.en:
Shylet is a married businesswoman from the Mudzi District in Zimbabwe. She has been sewing uniforms and other clothing items for the members of her community ever since she acquired a few business skills in school. Shylet is very proud of how successful her business has become and the recognition she has achieved from people in her village.

Shylet also counsels young students as a Camfed Learner Guide volunteer, and she would love to see the performance and attendance of the students improve. With the loan from Kiva, Shylet would like to purchase cloths and other materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloths and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is from Catarman, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and married. Lorena is a hardworking mother, while her husband is a carpenter. They work hard to sustain the needs of their family. Lorena is responsible and dedicated in her work as a seamstress. This is her only source of income and she is very grateful for her life.  She has a business producing school uniforms and carrying out repairs to clothes. This business has given her the opportunity to work and survive. Lorena applied for a loan in order to expand her business and to increase production. She will buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies. This will allow her generate more income and be able to cater tailoring services.

loans.use: to buy additional textiles, buttons and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 48 years old, married with 4 kids, a resident of Tuburan Katipunan Zamboanga Del Norte.She earns a living through food vending and vegetable vending. She is a member of PMPC for 8 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase housing materials.

Rebecca deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: to pay for housing materials

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis tiene 29 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su conyuge y una hija de 1 año de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio Tayales del distrito Santo Tomás, Jose luis cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua, y esta ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Jose Luis es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 2 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en segundo año de producción tiene tres años de edad, actividad la realiza hace 9 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 2 reses de su propiedad, también cria animales menores(gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de pan llevar. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 2 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 29 years old. He has a stable home that he shares with his wife and his 1 year old daughter. He lives in his own house, which is made out of rustic material. It is a single floor house, located in the small village of Tayales, in the municipality of Santo Tomas. Jose Luis has good personal and professional references within the area. The home has water system, and it is located in the province of Cutervo, region of Cajamarca, in the Peruvian Northern Sierra.

Jose Luis cultivates coffee. Up until now he has 2 hectare. He cultivates the Catimor variety, which is resistant to disease. This is the second year of production for this plantation, which is 3 years old. He has been doing this for 9 years. He has experience in the coffee industry.

He also raises cattle. He has 2 animals now. He also raises small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs, among others). He also cultivates some of the ingredients for bread.

He'll use this loan to maintain and cultivate 2 hectare of coffee. He wants to have a good production for the season of 2015. This will translate into more sales and more profits, so he can improve his life and his family's life.

loans.use: to cultivate and maintain 2 hectare of coffee. Assuring a good production for the season of 2015.

loans.name: Reynan

texts.en: Reynan believes that education is a key to succeed in life. He wants to earn a degree and land a good job in the future. Reynan wants to help his family and his siblings to finish their education also. With the loan of PHP 9,600, he will be able to pay for tuition and graduation costs. He is about to finish his course but would need to fully pay the school fees. Reynan sees himself to be in a position to help others too in the future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition and graduation costs

loans.name: Leni

texts.en: Leni is married with one child. She is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. Leni is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan to have an additional capital for her corn production business.  Leni has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Leni hopes to expand her business and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to increase capital for her corn production business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children now of adult age. 
Alicia is engaged in an e-load retailing and ice vending business for 10 years already. She earns approximately PHP 1,500.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional e-load for retail.
Alicia has been a member of PMPC for 9 years. In the future, Alicia hopes to expand her e-load retailing and ice vending business.

loans.use: To purchase additional e-load for retail

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 34 years old. She is married to a fisherman and they are gifted with four children. 

Emily personally sells the catch in nearby municipalities from her husband who uses their small fishing boat. Since she became a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), she has been a member in good-standing for almost three years. 

She wants to obtain financial assistance from PMPC, amounting to PHP 10,000, for the purchase of new nets. She also wants to buy the fish catch of her neighbors, so she can sell more fish to the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, Emily dreams of purchasing a new boat engine for a big fishing boat. She wishes to see her children finish their studies and have stable jobs in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new nets for  fishing.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: A $1000 loan is offered to Sofia to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day  because the goods she keeps in her store are very interesting to people. She will buy some additional supplies with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin such as perfume, buckets, kitchen utensils and other things to sell. She has been involved in business activities since 2013 with her own working capital of $700. She feels so comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day. So with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy perfume, buckets, kitchen utensils and other things to sell.

loans.name: Vaiuta

texts.en: Vaiuta is a 36-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a 'elei' printing business in her community. She has two years of experience with this business. Vaiuta has requested a loan to buy materials, design board, sponge, etc. She plans to use her profits to to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, design board, sponge, etc

loans.name: Taitafea

texts.en: Taitafea is 40 years old and married with seven children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. Taitafea has requested a loan to buy sacks of sugar, flour, yeast, cooking oil, etc. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taitafea will save for unexpected emergencies and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Thavry

texts.en: Thavry is a 24-year-old, married woman with no children. She has worked as a garment-factory worker since 2010. Her husband is 26, and a construction worker. They live in Kampong Chhnang Province of Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $9 a day. Now Thavry would like to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband, to run as motorcycle taxi when he is free from work. This loan will help her husband earn more income. In the future, she is going to run a small shop for clothes designing.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband to run as motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djekafo vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier Mission de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce de condiment, d’habillement et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  4eme cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Yah (la 2eme femme debout de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pagne wax de tout genre dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagne wax à Ségou. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Yah espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 25 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des petits besoins de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce. Elle souhaite continuer la collaboration  avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The five women of the Djekafo Group all live in nuclear families. On average, they are 41 years old and have three children. They all live in the Mission neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, familial, and marriage ties, as well as through their business activities in the neighborhood. 

These women sell spices, clothing, and food. With the goal of expanding their businesses, the group members decided to work with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan cycle.

Mrs. Yah (second woman standing in the photo, right to left) is a major retailer of all types of pagnes [traditional cloth] in the neighborhood and environs. She plans to use her loan to purchase 10 pagnes in Ségou. She sells them for cash and often credit at home and in the market to a group of customers made up of men and women.

Mrs. Yah hopes to see an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will be used for the needs of her children and also to expand her business. She hopes to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: To purchase pagnes [traditional cloth].

loans.name: Dede

texts.en:
Meet Dede. Dede and her family live in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. Dede is already married; she helps to contribute to her family's income by running a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. She was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited her stall. She quickly became interested and joined Ruma about a month ago. 

Dede believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, she hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable her to process more mobile services for her community on the weekends. She also hopes that she will be able to improve her business as she learns from Ruma. Dede is pictured in the photo standing in front of her stall. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in her community

loans.name: Alda

texts.en: Alda is married and she has seven children. She has a kiosk. She is requesting a loan of USD 600 to improve her kiosk, and to buy more goods to keep in her kiosk to sell like red onions. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $500. She lives near the people, so many people come to buy her red onions. She hopes to make her business bigger in the future with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin she can improve her business in the future. She also has animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.use: to buy more red onions to sell.

loans.name: Yayan

texts.en:
Meet Yayan. Yayan and his family live in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. Yayan is already married and he runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, mobile phone airtime credits, and serves utility bill payments for his customers. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. 

Yayan believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services for his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learns from Ruma. Yayan is pictured in the photo standing in front of his small stall (mobile shop). He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide bill payment and mobile services in his community

loans.name: Mahsuma

texts.ru: Махсума уже 3 года кредитуется в ИМОНе. Она имеет хорошее кредитное досье. Махсума очень честная женщина. Ей 27 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями и братьями. Махсума имеет педагогическое образование и работает более 4 лет в средней школе преподавательницей. Махсума постепенно развевает свою педагогическую деятельность. Она очень креативная преподавательница. У нее очень большая семья. Их 8 человек. Ее старший брат не имеет место работы и поэтому он собирается уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Махсума должна помочь брату и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета в Россию. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mahsuma has been obtaining financing from IMON for 3 years. She has a good credit history. Mahsuma is a very honest woman. She is 27 years old, single and lives with her parents and brothers. Mahsuma has a pedagogical education and has been working as a secondary school teacher for over 4 years. Mahsuma gradually develops her teaching experience. She is a very active teacher. She has a large family - there are 8 of them. Her oldest brother is unemployed and, thus, is planning to go to the Russian Federation. Mahsuma has to help her brother, and this is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni to buy him a ticket to Russia. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase an airline ticket for her brother to go to Russia for work

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi âgé de 30ans a pour femme une revendeuse et père de 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Il est revendeur de plats en porcelaine au grand marché de Lomé depuis 2006. A son second prêt, il va s'acheter des marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Il espère réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans son activité. A l'avenir, il espère ouvrir une seconde boutique et assurer la bonne scolarisation des enfants.
texts.en: Kossi is 30 years old, the husband of a retailer, and the father of two children, one of whom attends school. He has been selling porcelain dishes at the main market in Lomé since 2006. [Kossi is] on his second loan and is going to purchase merchandise in order to satisfy his customers. He hopes to re-inject the extra profits into his business. In the future, Kossi hopes to open a second shop and ensure the good education of his children.

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda has been operating a general store to make a living. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental with her family. 

She keeps on improving her business in order to offer better services to her customers. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying dried fish. She took a new loan recently to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

She is hopeful she will be able to sustain the business and expand for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: Revendeur de yaourt de façon ambulante, Komlanvi sollicite un second prêt pour acheter des matières premières(lait en poudre, sucre, arôme...) Il souhaite réinjecter les profits supplémentaires dans son activité afin d'ouvrir une crémerie plus tard. Il est marié et père de famille.
texts.en: A mobile retailer of yogurt, Komlanvi is seeking a second loan to purchase raw materials (powdered milk, sugar, flavoring, etc.). He hopes to re-inject the extra profits into his business in order to open a dairy later on. He is married and a father.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials (sugar, milk, flavoring).

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is thankful that she was granted a PHP 20,000 loan, which she used to buy raw ingredients like meats, rice, vegetables, and condiments needed in her food stall business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their basic daily needs. 
 
She would like now to apply for PHP 10,000 which she will use to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products.  She is positive that her earnings will increase as she expands her business.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Lea aims to give her children the best education possible.  She dreams that all of her hard work will bear fruit to give her family a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Elsa is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Elsa has been farming sugarcane for eight years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming sugarcane for eight years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 47 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Gloria has been farming sugarcane for six years and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Sugiyono

texts.en:
Sugiyono, his wife, and their only child live in Kudus, Central Java. Historically, Kudus was an important holy city in the sixteenth century in Indonesia. 

Sugiyono manages a motorcycle parking space for commuters/factory workers. To increase his family income, he decided to join Ruma about two months ago. Sugiyono also wanted to save the extra money for his child’s education. As the business continues, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva in order to provide more airtime transactions on the weekends. 

Sugiyono is pictured in the photo standing in his parking space. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide mobile services in his community

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Lina works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling fruits and root-crops. Lina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell to customers.
