Lina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Akue

texts.en:
Meet Akue. Akue and his family live in West Bandung, a regency area located in West Java province. He is married and works as an employee in a private company. Akue also runs a small stall that sells mobile phones, mobile phone accessories, and mobile phone airtime credits. He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall.  He quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. Akue believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services to his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learns from Ruma. 

Akue is pictured in the photo standing in front of his small stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to provide mobile services in his community.

loans.name: Rendiyono

texts.en:
Meet Rendi. Rendi and his family live in Sukabumi, a city located about 106 km from Jakarta. 

Rendi is already married and he runs a small stall that sells mobile phone airtime credits and serves mobile phone repairs and utility bill payments to his customers. 

He was introduced to Ruma by one of Ruma's staff who visited his stall and he quickly became interested to join Ruma about a month ago. Rendi believes that using technology will make the business run easier. As the business continues to grow, he hopes to get a working capital loan from Kiva to enable him to process more mobile services to his community on the weekends. He also hopes that he will be able to improve his business as he learnt from Ruma. 

He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To provide bill payment and mobile services in his community

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 34 years old. She lives in Baucau; she is married and has no children. She has been involved in carpentry activities since 2011. She started with her own working capital of $500. Her husband is a carpenter. She has furniture in her house.  

She is requesting a loan of $600, and she is taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she will use it to buy additional materials including wooden boards, wooden beams and other materials. She is happy to take a loan from Tuba Rai Metin. She will be able to open a bigger business in the future and her income can increase. So with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy wooden boards, wooden beams and other materials.

loans.name: Nessie Jane

texts.en: Nessie Jane has been helping her husband by working in order to make a living. She has operated a service for over two years, running a motorcycle transportation and rental service, while her husband works as a seaman.  It is her plan to improve the business and without hesitation, she joined GDMPC and is borrowing a loan to buy spare parts and vehicle maintenance costs for her seven units of motorcycles. Improving her business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC micro finance services. In the future, she wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay vehicle maintenance costs for her seven units of motorcycles.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is settled in Ozamiz City with her family and is running a cafeteria to earn a living. 

She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for buying raw ingredients for her cafeteria.  She start accepting orders and catering services and she gets more income from these activities. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell. 

She hopes to improve the business so as to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Amélévi

texts.fr: Femme de 53ans, Amélévi a pour mari un électricien avec 03 enfants en charge. Pour contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend depuis 1994 des œufs à ses clients à domicile. Son premier crédit sollicité de WAGES l'aidera à acheter de marchandises afin de servir ses clients. Elle espère faire de l'élevage et assurer une bonne éducation des enfants.
texts.en: Amélévi is a 53-year-old woman married to an electrician with three children in her care. To contribute to the family's needs, Amélévi has been selling eggs at home since 1994. Her first WAGES loan will help her to purchase merchandise in order to serve her customers. Amélévi hopes to raise livestock and ensure her children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase eggs.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is thankful that she was granted a 36,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her General Store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense.

She would now like to apply for a 38,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods and cellular phone loads which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children.  She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.  

Jocelyn dreams of having a bigger General Store and aims to give her children the best education possible for them to have a better future.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies
.
*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.
spiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, beverages, toiletries and other grocery supplies.

loans.name: Hursandoy

texts.ru:
Хурсандой жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина  в возрасте 41 года. Она замужем и имеет 2-их детей. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сама  Хурсандой живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Муж Хурсандой также не имеет образования и находится в данный момент России на заработках.

Чтобы иметь постоянный доход на пропитание, Хурсандой занимается своим делом. Она выращивает скот, а потом продаёт полученное от него мясо и молоко. От данного дела она получает хороший доход.  Сейчас  Хурсандой хочет увеличить количество своего скота, чтобы получать в дальнейшем больше дохода. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Хурсандой очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hursandoy is a happy and hardworking 41-year-old woman. She is married and has 2 children. She comes to Arvand for the first time after finding out about an opportunity to obtain financial support. Hursandoy lives with her family in a rural area. She does not have a higher education because it was impossible for her to attend an university due to family financial difficulties. Hursandoy's husband also does not have an education and currently works in Russia.

Hursandoy is involved in her own business to have a regular income for living. She raises livestock and then sells milk and meat obtained from it. She ears a good income from this business. Now Hursandoy wants to increase her livestock headcount in order to earn more income in the future. This is why she came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Hursandoy really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is married and she has seven children. She started to sell palm wine in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She is selling palm wine because she earns a good income from this business, because many people like to drink palm wine. Now she is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business, because with the loan from Tuba Rain Metin, although a small effort, but she could have a good management for her business. So she is happy with the loan that is offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her.  She also has animals like buffalo.

loans.use: to buy palm wine to sell.

loans.name: Ni Ketut

texts.en:
As of her last loan, Ni Ketut had planned to becomes a successful woman who can support her family's needs. Formerly a pig breeder, then she succeeded to improve her standard of living by running a small kiosk business. She can earn profits of 150,000 IDR per day from her small kiosk. She has a lot of customers that come from around her neighbourhood. Ni Ketut provides good prices and good service.

Now, Ni Ketut is asking for a new loan. Besides using it for the purchase of merchandise for her kiosk, Ni Ketut will use her loan to support her husband as a farmer by buying various kinds of seeds to plant in their garden. This week it s starting to rain. It's a good time to go into the garden and start plants. She hopes all their businesses run well and she can manage to achieve maximum results.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her kiosk and various kinds of seeds to plant in her garden.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor is a 42-year-old woman who lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. At home, she is a lovely mother of two dependent children and two married children. To make a living, she manages and operates a farming business in rice farm land which is located near her house. So far, she has been involved in this business for nearly twenty years.  The average earning is USD 2.00 a day.

Hor wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Elda

texts.en: Elda is a 42-year-old, married woman and a mother of seven children from Baybay, Leyte. She has been engaged in scrap buying business for more than 20 years now. She buys bottles, tin cans, plastics, galvanized iron, and other recyclable materials. Elda lives in the place affected by Typhoon Haiyan. She is asking for a loan to buy more scrap and recyclable materials such as bottles, tin cans, plastics, galvanized iron and others. With this, she will be able to sell this scrap material to a company that buys recyclable materials. In the future, Elda hopes to make her business a success and a sustainable source of income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more scrap and recyclable materials.

loans.name: Elwin

texts.en: Elwin, 33, is married and settled in Aurora, Zamboaga del Sur. He makes a living by operating a transportation business for over four years and he earns well to sustain their needs. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used to buy accessories and tires. To maintain better service, he took a new loan recently to cover repair and maintenance costs. He wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover repair and maintenance costs.

loans.name: Nyasha

texts.en:
Nyasha resides in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for over a year. Nyasha started her business by selling door-to-door but her business expanded into her current shop. She sells sugar, cooking oil, soft drinks, biscuits, powdered milk, and bath soap. Nyasha volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide  at the local school and provides students sessions on life and study skills.

With the requested loan from Kiva, Nyasha intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, soap, and salt to reduce transportation costs and get bulk discounts. With the increased profits, Nyasha would like to assist orphans and vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, soap, and salt to reduce costs of transportation and get bulk discounts.

loans.name: Istiqomah

texts.en:
Istiqomah is very pleased with her strategic effort to boost her income. She has increased sales and increased customers. Her earnings also increased so that she could pay off the loan quickly. She says thank you to all lenders for their support. Now she has a successful business and she can help her husband earn income to support her family's welfare. 
To support the productivity of her business and to improve the services to her customers, Istiqomah needs a new loan to purchase more merchandise for her kiosk. She will provide for the daily needs of her customers. She needs a loan of 3.000.000 IDR use to purchase rice, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, snacks, etc.
She hopes the more merchandise she can provide, the more she can serve her customers and increase her earnings. All the profit will be saved for her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, salt, shampoo, soap, snacks, etc

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin is a 38-year-old man lives in a remote area of Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. At home, he is a lovely father of three dependent children who are currently in school. To make a living, he manages and operates a farming business in a rice farm land which is located at his house. So far, he has been involved in this business for more sixteen years.

Sin wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system.  Because there is inadequate money, he has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, he hopes to have clean energy to power his household lights, TV and radio. He is very happy and thankful because with this loan, HKL has provided him a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Shahzadi

texts.en:
Shahzadi is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s, Brac Pakistan, to buy tires for the tractor trolley for her husband. Her husband provides services of loading and unloading of construction material, such as sand, soil and bricks to the builders. Due to continuously working, the tires of the tractor trolley have been wearing out.  Now the tractor is not picking up the load and the tires mostly got punctured.
Therefore, Shahzadi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Brac Pakistan, so that her husband can buy new tires for the tractor trolley. She wants her husband to be able to carry on in this business because this is the only source of income for her family. 
Shahzadi is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner’s, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tractor's tires for her husband's business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to the bathroom in his home.

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru:
Зокирчон жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый парень  в возрасте 25 лет. Он женат и имеет 1-го ребёнка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Зокирчон живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Зокирчона также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Зокирчон занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Зокирчон подрабатывает строителем, собирает доски для продажи и занимается пчеловодством.  От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Зокирчону в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Зокирчон хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Зокирчон очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zokirjon is a happy and hardworking 25-year-old man. He is married and has one child. He comes to Arvand for the first time after finding out about an opportunity to obtain financial support. Zokirjon lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have a higher education because it was impossible for him to attend a university due to family financial difficulties. Zokirjon's wife also does not have an education and is a homemaker, involved in household work and raising children.

Zokirjon is involved in his own business to have a regular income for living. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. Zokirjon also works part-time as a construction worker, collects wood planks for sale and is involved in beekeeping. He earns a good income from this business. The wife also helps Zokirjon with the business by selling milk obtained from the livestock. Now Zokirjon wants to increase his livestock headcount in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain a loan to buy livestock. Zokirjon really hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Roheni

texts.en:
Roheni is 51 years old, married and lives with her husband . She has one daughter who is married.  Roheni has owned a grocery shop for over 10 years to provide family income. She is pleased to be able to help her husband to improve their life.
She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used for improved access to water and sanitation for her family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 
The sanitation will improve the health for her and her family. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for her family

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 61 years old, married and has four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
She belongs to a poor family, living hand to mouth. Her husband owns a small clothing shop in which he sells used clothing. He has been running this business for many years. His business is unable to generate sufficient income for his family.
It is necessary to grow the business to meet the family's needs but a lack of capital is the major problem for him.  
Therefore, Razia took out a loan for her husband’s business. With help from this loan, he will purchase more used clothes to sell. 
Razia thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, vive con su abuela en casa propia, la joven  posee una sala de belleza ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de recibir a sus clientes y por los buenos precios, ella solicita nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: shampoo, uñas acrílicas, tintes para cabello, gelatina para cabello, esmaltes, acondicionadores, entre otros, ya que le ha ido muy bien es su negocio y asi poder seguir con su trabajo y tener junto con su abuela una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face is pixilated in the photo is 25 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She resides in her own home along with her grandmother.

This young woman has a beauty salon in her home. She has many customers because of the friendliness that she exhibits to them at the time of service and for the affordable prices that she charges. The borrower is requesting a new loan in order to buy more products such as shampoo, acrylic nails, hair dyes, hair gels, nail polish, conditioners, and other supplies. She is already doing very well in her business, so she will be able to continue her work and have a better quality of life along with her grandmother.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, acrylic nails, hair dyes, hair gels, nail polish, conditioners, and other supplies.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 46 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has two dependents, now at their school age. 
For her source of living, Amelita is engaged in managing a little sari-sari store. She’s been doing this business for two years already and earns approximately PHP20,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional grocery items and consumable goods for retail.
Amelita has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Amelita hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional grocery items and consumable goods

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom’s son has been driving an auto rickshaw for many years;.  It has been depreciating with the passage of time. He sold his old rickshaw and wants to buy a new rickshaw. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing old, and their needs as well. 
Kalsoom has been making savings for many days to buy a new auto rickshaw for her son, but at the time of purchasing some money has become short. Therefore, Kalsoom has requested a loan for her son so that he can buy a new rickshaw with the contribution of savings.  Kalsoom is a 42-years old woman, living with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Kalsoom hopes that now her son would be able to generate more income. She is very happy after taking this loan.  She thanks Kiva and field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her son.

loans.name: Susandra

texts.en: Susandra is a prospective student at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara. He wants to work in a large port. Susandra came from East Nusa Tenggara, exactly on the coast in the city Lembata.  The parents of Susandra work only as farmers, whose income is uncertain. Because of erratic weather, in addition to farming, his father is also looking for fish in the sea, to provide for his family. His parents earn only enough revenue to finance the family's daily life. Susandra is eager to help his parents for the betterment of the lives of his family and his brothers. With the student loan program from Kiva, he wants to pursue his studies. He is very grateful to all lenders to Kiva, which will help in him study, even though they do not know him personally.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is from Taguilon Dapitan City. She is 51 years old and is married with three kids. She earns a living through fish selling. In the year 2007 Evangeline applied for her membeship with PMPC. Hearing all the benefits, she never hesitated to become one. She maintains the status of being a member in good standing and repays her obligation in a timely manner. Recently, Evangeline asked for a financial assistance of PHP 20,000 to buy fish for fish selling. Through this, she hopes to increase her income and be of help in the expansion of her business. She has found assistance for their financial needs through PMPC and she is very thankful with all her heart.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita is 37 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their four children, three sons and one daughter. Her husband is a personal driver who transports his boss wherever he goes.
She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6.000.000 rupiah. This loan will be used to improve access to water and sanitation for her family. She will build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home. 
The sanitation will improve the health of her family. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders

loans.use: to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en: Cherry is 50 years old and lives in Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children now at their adult age. For her means of living, Cherry is engaged in managing a little sari-sari store and buying and selling coconuts. She’s been doing this business for 24 years already, and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional grocery items and consumable goods for retail. Cherry has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Cherry hopes to expand her sari-sari store and coconut buying and selling business.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items and consumable goods for retail.

loans.name: Emanuel

texts.en:
Emanuel is 32 years of age and a resident of Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married with two kids. They have a little fishing business from which to earn a living. With their business they meet many challenges, and they realize that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Emanuel and his wife work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business by having an additional unit of a fishing boat. They have requested from Paglaum MPC a PHP 20,000 loan for the project. They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future. Emanuel smiles at the thought of having a decent and comfortable life and seeing their children get their own diplomas one day.

loans.use: to pay for another fishing boat unit.

loans.name: Malaeola

texts.en: Malaeola is a 44-year-old married woman with 10 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, banana, and yams to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years. Malaeola has requested a loan to buy weed sprayer, bush knives, chemicals etc. She has been a member of SBPD since 2011. With her profits, Malaeola hopes to renovate her house and support her family financially.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings etc

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 56 years old, married, and a resident of Brgy. Taguilon, Dapitan City. She earns a living through fish selling. She is a member of PMPC for 5 years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying for a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase a fishing net. 
Merlyn deeply wishes to maintain her status as a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To pay for a fishing net

loans.name: Consuelo Del Milagro

texts.es:
Consuelo del Milagro tiene 32 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Consuelo del Milagro se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, con más de 8 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Consuelo del Milagro piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona, de esta manera podra aumentar sus ventas, sus ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Consuelo del Milagro is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She lives with her family in the District of Oyotún in Chiclayo Province, which is part of the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru.

Consuelo del Milagro raises and sells animals. She has more than eight years of experience in this business, which is located in an area behind her house. Consuelo is requesting a loan in order to buy more animals. This investment will give her a greater variety of animals and increase her productivity, which will have a great impact on her business.

Consuel del Milagro believes that increasing her stock of animals will allow her to satisfy the different tastes and needs of her customers in the area. This will increase her sales and earnings, which will help to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals to sell.

loans.name: Ydubis

texts.es:
Ydubis tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y sus cinco menores hijos de 14,13,12,7 y 3 años de edad de los cuales los dos primeros cursan secundaria y los otros dos primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Él vive en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, contando con servicios de agua y luz; dicho distrtio esta ubicado en en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Ydubis es la ventta de aves de corral como gallinas, patos, la compra lo realiza en su caserio y la venta lo realiza en Pucará, cuenta con 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, además se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agricola ingresos adicionales que le permiten solventar el credito sin ningun problema. El destino del crédito será para compra de aves de corral y hacer arreglos a su cocina con ello le generara mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ydubis is 34 years old and lives with her husband and five young children who are 14, 13, 12, 7 and 3 years old. The first two go to secondary school and the two younger children go to a public primary school in the district of Pucará.  Ydubis lives in the rural part of the Pucará district which is connected to water and electricity services. The district is located in the province of Jaén, a region of Cajamarca in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Ydubis sells fowl including chickens and ducks. She makes her purchases in her hamlet and then resells them in Pucará. She has 5 years of experience in this line of work in addition to working as a farmhand. This additional income will enable her to repay her loan without a problem.

Ydubis will use this loan to buy fowl and makes improvements to her kitchen to generate a higher income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fowl and make improvements to her kitchen to generate a higher income

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad is 59 years old and separated. She has three children and is a resident of Lipata Taguilon Dapitan city in Zamboanga Del Norte. Trinidad  joined PMPC in 2013 and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the cooperative offers. She is requesting a loan of 14,900 PHP. She intends to use this loan to purchase grocery items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Florecita

texts.en:
Florecita is 45 years old, married, and a resident of Taguilon, Dapitan City, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter, and they have four children, three of whom are in school. 

Starting with capitalization of PHP 5,000, Florecita opened a sari-sari store in 2010 and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. In addition to financial assistance, she has been able to enjoy the benefits offered by the co-op and generate savings. 

The recipient of four previous loans, Florecita is now requesting a new one for PHP 14,900  to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, especially basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for her store

loans.name: Beth

texts.en:
Beth is 53 years old and lives in Poblacion, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with one child, who is now an adult. For her source of income, Beth is engaged in managing her newly opened sari-sari (general) store, where she has been selling groceries and other consumable products. She earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month in this business. She has requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional stock of groceries and other consumable goods for retail.

Beth has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, Beth hopes to expand her sari-sari store.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of groceries and other consumable goods to sell

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma signed up for membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (general) store. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. Thelma has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune. Recently, she took a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. In the future, Thelma hopes to build a decent home for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel tiene 57 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, él reside en el distrito de Buenos Aires junto a sus dos menores hijos desde hace más de 15 años, la vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la crianza y comercio de ganado, además de la agricultura; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Morropon, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Luis Miguel es a la prestación de servicios técnicos electricista y a la compra y venta de artefactos. Actividad que realiza desde hace más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio. El destino del crédito será para la construcción de una pared de división en su domicilio, lo que le va a permitir darle mayor seguirdad a su familia y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de todos ellos.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 57 years old, and he has been living in the Buenos Aires district with his life partner and their two young children for more than 15 years. Life is peaceful in this community, and people engage in breeding and selling livestock as well as in agriculture. Said community is located in Morropon, a province of the Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.

Luis Miguel engages in providing services as an electrician and he also engages in buying and selling artifacts. He has been engaging in this activity for more than 20 years and he has a solid experience. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a partition in his house, as this will allow him to grant better security to his family and to improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To build a partition in his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry and pigs.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is thankful that she was previously granted a Php 12000 loan that she used to buy materials needed in her doormat-making business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. 
 
Erlinda is requesting another Php 12000 which she will use to buy 200 kilos of fabrics and thread to sew more doormats to sell. She aims to grow her business so she can fulfill her dream of having a factory for her doormat making.  

Erlinda dreams of living a happy and healthy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners gathering each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for 200 kilos of fabric and thread for her doormat business.

loans.name: Rene Aristides

texts.es:
Rene, se dedica a la medición de terrenos, vive con sus padres, es soltero, con su trabajo costea sus gastos personales y les ayuda económicamente a sus padres; el negocio está funcionando desde hace dos años, el oficio lo aprendió preparándose académicamente, trabaja de ocho de la mañana  a cuatro de la tarde, las dificultades que enfrenta en su trabajo son los cambios del clima.
Invertirá en la compra de banners, hojas volantes y otras herramientas de publicidad que serán de utilidad para dar a conocer su negocio, espera atraer nuevos clientes y tener mejores ingresos.
Sus proyectos son lograr tener un  negocio que le genere más ingresos para cumplir con el pago de la deuda, ser más independiente y mantener el apoyo para sus padres.
texts.en:
Rene is a land surveyor. He is single and lives with his parents. His work allows him to cover his personal expenses and to help his parents financially. Rene has been in this business for two years. He learned this line of work through his academic preparation. Rene works from 8:00 A.M. to 4:00 P.M. The difficulties with his work include dealing with weather changes.

Rene will invest in the purchase of banners, advertising leaflets, and other forms of publicity. This will be useful in helping to spread the word about his business. He hopes to attract new clients and have a better income. His goals include having a business that generates more income so that he can repay his debt, becoming more independent, and maintaining support for his parents.

loans.use: to pay for banners, advertising leaflets, and other forms of publicity.

loans.name: Mario Jevin

texts.en: Mario’s goal is to be a ship's captain.  Mario has had this dream since childhood.  But Mario has concerns that he can not achieve these ideals due to economic factors hindering his family.  His father earns a living through motorcycle taxi services, in order to be able to educate their children, day-to-day his father drives to the store and picks up customers, to the city. While his mother does not have any special skills. His parents make every effort to help Mario reach his desire and goal to be a reliable sailor. Through the Student Loan program of Kiva, Mario hopes to complete college and quickly find a job on a cruise ship. He is very grateful to the investors of Kiva, because thanks to their help, he can cover the cost of tuition and continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase necessary materials to install a safe roof in the house.

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru:
Мукаддас жительница юго-западного района Кубадиён. Территория района расположена в пределах долины реки Кафирниган, южная часть района имеет государственную границу с Афганистаном, проходящую по реке Пяндж. Климат в районе резко континентальный,смена сезонов происходит достаточно мягко и незаметно, зимы в полном смысле этого слова практически отсутствуют. 
Мукаддас живет в одном из сел этого района вместе со своей семьей. Ее муж мастер-строитель. У Мукаддас еще нету детей, ей уже 35 лет. 
Мукаддас сейчас хочет посвятить себя новому бизнесу. Она планирует начать бизнес по купле и продаже миндаля. По причине нехватки начального капитала, она обратилась за кредитом. Мукаддас, начав новый бизнес, сможет увеличить семейный бюджет и улучшить жизненные условия.
texts.en:
Mukaddaslivers in Qubadijon, a region in the southwest [of Tajikistan]. This region  is located in the valley in the Kafirnigan river. The southern part of the region borders with Afganistan; the state border is formed by the Pyanzh river.The climate in the region is continental: the change of seasons is relatively mild and imperceptible; there is practically no winter in the full sense of the word.

Mukaddas lives in one of the villages of this region together with her family. Her husband is a construction foreman. Mukaddas does not have children yet; she is already 35 years old. At present Mukaddas would like to dedicate her efforts to a new business. She plans to launch a business buying and reselling almonds. Since she lacks the starting capital, she has applied for a loan. By starting a new business, Mukaddas will be able to increase the family budget and improve her life conditions.

loans.use: to buy almonds for resale, as a source of income.

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is a married woman and a mother of four children from Baybay, Leyte. Flor has operated a sari-sari or variety store business in her place for more than 12 years now. She sells different kinds of goods and items to the people in her place. This is the source of her income. Flor lives in the typhoon ravaged place in the Philippines. Her business was affected when super typhoon Haiyan hit the country ago.

Flor is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil and seasonings. With this she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. 

In the future,Flor dreams of making her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soda and beverages, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods, cooking oil and seasonings

loans.name: Robi

texts.en:
Robi is 38-year-old lady, living with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw from several years; his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Robi has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy the moto rickshaw's body. 

She hopes that she would be able to make enough saving till the time comes for her children to marry in the future.

loans.use: to buy a rickshaw body for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina a housewife, is need of a loan for her husband so that he can refurbish and expand his restaurant. 

Samina is blessed with a son, and she aims at getting him educated with the funds generated from this restaurant.

The items required include furniture which can be bifurcated into tables and chairs, groceries which can be further divided into vegetables and meat, plus a new gas cylinder.

Hence, this loan is pivotal for Samina as it would help her enhance her husband's earnings with the expansion of his restaurant, simultaneously fulfilling her aim of getting a quality education for her child.

loans.use: To buy furniture, a gas cylinder, etc

loans.name: Syukur Dermawan

texts.en: Syukur is a 22-year-old student; he was living alone and away from his parents. Syukur's parents live in a village on the island of Nias, North Sumatra, Indonesia. His father works as a laborer on a rubber plantation, and his income is not fixed. The income is inadequate because rubber prices are very low at this time. Sometimes if there were rubber tapping, his father works in the fields of others. His parents want their children to go to school so that they have a happy future. Syukur is the third child of four siblings. Thanks to the encouragement of his parents, Syukur is determined to study at the Academy of Maritime of Nusantara, because of his idea that he would like to work in a large port in Indonesia. Since the economic conditions of the parents are not fixed, Syukur wishs to follow the Student Loan program from Kiva, in order to ease the burden of his parents and also continue his studies. Syukur is very grateful to the lenders from around the world who would help him in his studies, even though he is not able to get to know them personally.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Eva

texts.en: Eva is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to improve her business. She will use the loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy some additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as cooking oils, oils, water, coffee, biscuits, candies, sardines, soaps, cigarettes, detergent, and other things to sell, including hard drinks. Eva started to open her kiosk in 2001 with her own working capital of USD 1,500. She is married, has five children, and her husband is a teacher. She is taking the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to add to her working capital to improve her business in the future. She has animals like chickens and pigs.

loans.use: To buy cooking oils, oils, water, coffee, biscuits, candies, sardines, soaps, cigarettes, detergent, and other things to sell, including  hard drinks.

loans.name: Marselinus

texts.en:
Marselinus lives in a small kampong, which is located at the end of the village, in the area of the islands. The islands are connected by small boats. 

Marselinus is currently studying a Commerce program of Procedures and Harbor Administration on a sailing school called the Academy of Maritime Nusantara, which is located on the island of Java, specifically in the city of Cilacap. Because his father is only a farmer in the fields, Marselinus has bigger dreams. The income of the parents is enough for their daily needs, but Marselinus is the second child of four children. His parents have tried all efforts to help realize the goals of Marselinus. 

With the Student Loan program from Kiva, Marselinus is very grateful, because the difficulty can be resolved. He will be in good spirits again and diligent in learning, in order to quickly complete his studies. 

He wants to be a professional employee on a cruise shipping company. His eager dream is to help his parents and his siblings to be more advanced and developed. 

Marselinus is very grateful to the lender who will help him cope with his predicament.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Eri Kristian

texts.en:
Eri would like to study at the Academy of Maritime Nusantara and work in a large port in Indonesia. He comes from the village of Onozitoli, in the northern part of the island, near the island of Sumatra.   He is motivate to learn and aspires to be a professional employee in a port. 

Due to economic conditions (his parents are farmers), Eri has difficulty completing his studies. His parents' income is not fixed, they also have to pay for three additional children who attend school. Eri's parents are very sad to see that Eri wants to go to school, but their economic conditions prevent that. 

Eri hopes to get a loan from Kiva through the Student Loan program. He is very grateful to Kiva investors who assist him to continue his studies. Eri wants to help the parents and siblings for a better future.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 67 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 4 adult children.
 
Rosita's income is from buying and selling coconuts.  She earns approximately 6,000.00 PHP each month. She requested a loan to purchase additional coconuts for copra processing and whole nut reselling.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Rosita hopes to expand her coconut buying and selling business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for copra processing and whole nut reselling.

loans.name: Scovia

texts.en:
Scovia is a 33-year-old married woman with 3 children who are between the ages of 12 and 8; all attend school. 

She has worked in a shop for 3 years. She will use the loan to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap. The profits will be used to reinvest in her business and pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, cooking oil, and soap.

loans.name: Kirk

texts.en:
Kirk is 41 years old and lives in San Nicolas Tudela,Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Kirk is a farmer and earns approximately 5,000 each month. He has requested a loan to purchase needed housing materials. 

Kirk has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Kirk hopes to save more money.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials.

loans.name: Pablo Leonel

texts.es:
Pablo Leonel es soltero, tiene 23 años de edad. Vive en casa familiar con tia de 47 años de edad, él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y económicas. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia; ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Pablo Leonel se dedica al servicio de transporte en mototaxi, en la zona de Cayalti y anexos, desde hace más de 03 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para mantenimiento de mototaxi, lo que asegurá el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo, lo que le va a permitir seguir generando ingresos y poder seguir costeando sus gastos.
texts.en:
Pablo Leonel is a single man aged 23. He lives in his family house with his aunt, aged 47, and he can count on good economic ad personal references. He lives in a community whose inhabitants engage in retail, agriculture and livestock breeding; the community is located in Cayaltì, a district Chiclayo, a province of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

Pablo Leonel engages in providing transportation services with his mototaxi, in the area of Cayaltì and its vicinities, an activity he has been engaged in for approximately 3 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for the maintenance of his mototaxi, thus making sure his vehicle works to perfection. This will allow him to keep on earning an income and keeping on paying for his expenses.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of his mototaxi.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old house wife who looks after her  four-person family. 

She is a good seamstress and provides home-based sewing services to the people. She needs to purchase a new sewing machine, a variety of fabric, thread, needles, and clothing. 

The purchase of these items is very important for her to continue to work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. 

So Naseem is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. Brac Pakistan issued her loan as per her requirement. Naseem is very thankful to kiva's partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase items to use in her sewing business.

loans.name: Tajinura

texts.en:
Tajinura hails from Maynaguri. She is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). Her two children are in grade 10 and in grade 8 and other is a daily labor. 

Her husband, Soleman, is a responsible man. He has high determination inside himself. He accumulated a certain amount of money and purchased a cycle-van. One of the public services that is most important for the people of rural West Bengal is that of the van service. The people depend on this service in order to move from place to place and to carry loads. It is a kind of cycle-operated transport that is a very popular means of transport. In order to grow his business, he wants to purchase a new cycle-van and to give the old one on hire to earn additional income.

So to help her husband, Tajinura has taken a loan from BJS.  She will use the loan to purchase a new cycle-van, in order to improve the living standards of his family and to provide her children higher education. She thinks this business will be very profitable for them.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Pablo Cesar

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 21 años de edad, su estado civil es soltero. Vive con su madre, cuenta con servicios públicos (agua y luz). Vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región Piura, costa norte de Perú. La comunidad es pequeña los pobladores se dedican a la crianza de ganado, comercio y al comercio de platano.

La actividad que desarrolla Pablo es la comercializacion de zapallo, cuenta con varios años de experiencia en el negocios, él necesita crédito para la compra de una motocarga de segunda, para poder trasportar su mercaderia para su venta respectiva, de este modo podrá aumentar sus ventas, sus ingresos, y por consecuente sus ganacias, mejorando también su calidad de vida y la de su madre.
texts.en:
Pablo is 21 years old and single. He lives with his mother. He has access to public services such as water and electricity. He lives in the Buenos Aires district, in the Morropón province in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. It is a small community, where people make a living raising cattle, running businesses, and selling bananas.

Pablo makes a living selling pumpkins. He has several years of experience in this business.

He needs a loan to buy a second-hand three-wheeler van so that he can transport his products to his customers. In this way, he will be able to increase his sales, his income, and, consequently, his profits, which will help him to improve his quality of life and that of his mother.

loans.use: to purchase a three-wheeler van to transport his merchandise.

loans.name: Luchi

texts.en:
Luchi, age 27, is happy tending her little store. She is a single mom with two kids. The store is her means of earning a living to support her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Luchi keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from the store. Luchi believes that with PMP's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.

Luchi has reached her one year mark of being a member to Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 for the store. She will be expanding her inventory with additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store, and from there she could afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a  40-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than 21 years now. This is the source of their income. Jocelyn lives in a typhoon-ravaged place. Several months ago, a super typhoon hit the country and ruined thousands of houses and businesses including Jocelyn's business. Their income declined after the typhoon. As of this time, she and her husband have just started to rebuild their fishing business again. She is requesting a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy a new fishing engine and new fishing nets. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the  market. In the future, Jocelyn dreams of expanding their fishing business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the needs of the family, especially for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and to buy a new fishing engine and new fishing nets

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is a 27-year-old housewife who lives in the small town of Maynaguri in their own house. She is married to Ananda, who is also 30 years old and both Sunita and her husband are illiterate, and only can sign their name. They are blessed with two little children. One of them goes to school and other is too young for school.

Sunita's husband is a cycle-van puller. He carries loads and people on his cycle van and earns for the family. A cycle-van is a kind of carriage which is pulled using a bicycle and is widely used in rural areas by the regional people. But the income of her husband is very small and it is difficult to maintain the family. They decided to purchase another cycle-van and give it on rent from where the income will be more.

Then Sunita came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods in their locality so that her husband earns more than previous. Their future dream is to strengthen their family economy and admit their children in renowned schools to become professionals.

Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for carrying goods and people.

loans.name: Sanka

texts.en:
Sanka is a very young entrepreneur from Maynaguri, in Jaipaiguri District.  She is only 33 years old and resides with her husband. The couple is blessed with two children.  One of their children is in school, and the other is a toddler. 

Sanka’s husband works in a garage. His income is meager to bear all the expenses of the family. Thus Sanka has been actively involved in cattle rearing to support her family financially. She supplies milk to her neighbors to generate additional income for the family. Now she wants to expand her business and satisfy the demand of her customers. But the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of business capital.

To solve this problem, Sanka is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via BJS to purchase an additional dairy cow. An additional cow will provide her with a lot of practical benefits.  She will be able to supply more milk and increase her sales volume. In the short run, she will be saving the returns to send her children to a better school. In the long run, she will have saved enough money to go for better breeds of cows to grow her business. 

Sanka is very much delighted after getting the loan and she is grateful to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Shibani

texts.en:
Shibani is a hardworking woman of 43 years.  She lives with her husband and two sons. Her sons go to school.  They are in grade 11 and grade 8 respectively.  She lives with her family in their own house in a small village of Maynaguri, in the district of Jalpaiguri. Shibani‘s husband has a grocery shop, but the income from it is not moderate. They have to face a lot of problems to maintain expenses of her family as well as the educational cost of her children.

Therefore Shibani decided to start a dairy business to give financial support to her family.  She plans to supply dairy products like ghee, paneer, curd, etc., along with milk, to her customers. Her neighbors will be her main customers. 

Thus Shibani is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase a dairy cow. She has chosen this business as there is a great demand for milk and milk products in their region and she has experience in this field. She wants to expand her dairy business with the savings from her profit.

The loan will help Shibani to start her business and to give financial support to her family.  She is grateful to her generous lenders those who extend their hands of cooperation towards her in her odd situation.

loans.use: To purchase  a dairy cow to start a dairy business

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is a 48-year-old, energetic, and optimistic entrepreneur from Maynaguri who believes that hard work has its own reward. She is married and a mother of one son. Her son works in a garage and her husband paints houses.

To add some income to the family fund, Sushila has been rearing cattle for many years and developed a passion for dairy farming. To generate income, she sells dairy products from her farm, such as milk, butter, paneer, and curd at the local market and in her neighborhood.

Now she is seeking a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a quality dairy cow which, she hopes, will produce more milk per day. Milk and milk products sold from this cow will provide Sushila with a sufficient income to provide a decent lifestyle to her family.

Sushila's extra income that she will generate from the dairy cow will satisfy her family’s needs. Her first preference is her son's education. She wants to provide him better education for his bright future.

She is thanking Kiva and BJS for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk and milk products selling business.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is aged 23. She is married with one child who does not yet go to school. She works in a shop and she has been selling for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more beans, biscuits, rice, and sugar to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more beans, biscuits, rice, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Eka

texts.en: Eka is now 19 years old; he is still very young and eager to get ahead in life. He lives in a small village called Plunjaran, which is located in the highlands; the air is cool there. The livelihoods of the communities in which Eka lives on average are farmers. However, his father works outside the city, in order to pay for their children's school. Eka is the first child of four brothers, his three sister are still in school. His parents have a desire that all children can get an education so their future is for the better. Only a provision of  education can be given by parents, because his parents only work as laborers. Due to the condition of his parents, Eka is motivated to quickly complete college. Eka apply for a loan from Kiva, to help ease the burden of his parents. Eka also hopes with this loan he can quickly get a job as a clerk at a port or shipping company.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Bimala

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Bimala hails from Maynaguri. She is married and the mother of one daughter, who is a student of grade 11 at a local school. She is an illiterate woman who only can sign her name, but of strong determination and dedication, with which she has established herself as a successful entrepreneur. She is engaged in an incense sticks-selling business for earning for her family. She is a hardworking and caring housewife. They live at Petkati, a small village in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband is a cycle-van puller by profession. He has been pulling a rented cycle-van (a cycle-operated vehicle) until now, but most of his income washes away paying for the rent, and they are left with little money to pay for their household expenses. They pass their days with great difficulty. Now Bimala's husband has decided to buy a new cycle-van of his own to generate more income.

Bimala has therefore requested a loan from BJS to help her husband buy a new cycle-van. Her husband is hopeful that this will have a positive impact on their income and that they will be able to provide higher education to their only daughter.

Bimala and her husband are very much grateful to their generous lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: to purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Glenda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Glenda, posee una venta de pupusas, ella es soltera, vive con su mamá, tres hermanas y su padrastro; hace un año inicio a vender pupusas con una prima, lo realiza de siete de la mañana a dos de la tarde, su madre le enseño todo lo relacionado con el negocio.
Utilizará el préstamo para comprar una plancha, maíz, aderezos, quesillo, aceite, etc., tendrá equipo para mejorar la productividad y la materia prima para elaborar la venta, espera atender mejor a sus clientes, tener más ingresos, cancelar la deuda y apoyar a su familia económicamente.
Sus sueños son mantenerse trabajando y logar mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Glenda, who sells pupusas (stuffed tortillas), is single and lives with her mother, three sisters, and her step father. One year ago, she began selling pupusas with a cousin, working from 7 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. Her mother taught her everything to do with the business. 

She will use the loan to buy a floor, maize, garnishes, cheese, oil, etc. and will be equipped to improve her productivity and will have the raw materials to make her sales. She hopes to better serve her customers, have better earnings, pay back her debt, and support her family financially.

Her dreams are to support herself by working, and succeed in improving her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy a floor, maize, garnishes, cheese, oil, etc, so she will be equipped to improve her productivity and will have the raw materials to make her sales.

loans.name: Binata

texts.en:
Binata is 43 years old, married and the mother of two sons. She lives with her family in Petkati, a rural area in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She is uneducated and can sign her name only. She was deprived of education due to her parental poverty. Her oldest son is a car driver, and the youngest is a student of grade 10.

Binata is a housewife who looks after her husband and sons and manages the household work. Her husband, Prasanna, is a rickshaw puller. He carries people on his rickshaw (a means of transport operated by cycle, widely used in rural areas) from one place to another inside the village. He lives with his family in very poor conditions. He doesn't surrender to this, but strives strongly to improve life for his family. He is a talented and responsible man, and is trying to buy a new rickshaw to give it on rent for another means of income. His goal is to earn enough money to care for his family. He believes this business will be very profitable for him, and he can earn a lot of money. Unfortunately, the money he has saved is not enough to purchase a new cycle-van.

That is why Binata is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) in order to buy a rickshaw. Binata hopes that her husband will surely expand his work and improve their social and financial living conditions in the future. She dreams to provide higher education to her youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase a rickshaw for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nurfauzi

texts.en: Nurfauzi is registered as a student at the Academy of Maritime of Nusantara; he takes the Ship Technician program. Nurfauzi comes from a remote village that is bustling and clean, with still a lot of rice fields and large tracts of land. Nurfauzi wants to become a professional technician on a ship. His parents have very much hope to be able to help Nurfauzi, but their income is only enough for their daily needs. His father works as a truck driver: he started as a bus conductor and later became a bus driver and is now a truck driver. With the condition of his family, which is uncertain, his father has minimal income for his family life. Nurfauzi has the courage to follow the Student Loan program from Kiva to help finance his studies, and which can ease the burden of parents. He hopes to make happy the people he loves, especially his parents. Nurfauzi is very grateful to Kiva investors from all over the world, because it helps him to achieve a better future.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 45 years old. She is married with three children aged between 18 and 8 years, all of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running a business for 15 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy Fanta, juice, soap, sugar, and salt for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy Fanta, juice, soap, sugar, and salt for sale.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Baybay, Leyte. She is engaged in the firewood retail business. Lucy has been in the business for more than three years now. This is the source of her income. Lucy lives in the typhoon-affected areas in the country. 

Lucy is asking for a loan to buy more wood to sell. With this, she will will be able to improve her firewood stocks thus allowing her to sell more to her customers. Lucy hopes to make her business a success so that it will generate more income necessary for their expenses, especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more wood to sell

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en: Rosa has been involving in business activities since 2005. She started with her own working capital of USD 1,500. She is married and her husband is a teacher. She is making cakes to sell every day because many people like to buy them. And now she is taking a loan of USD 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to improve her business. She will use it to buy additional supplies with the loan including dyes, seed bread, sugar, wheat, cooking oil, and other materials to make cakes. So, she was happy when Tuba Rai Metin offered a loan for her to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy dyes, seed bread, sugar, wheat, cooking oil, and other materials to make cakes.

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en: Augustin is aged 30. He is married with two children aged between four and one year old, one of them goes to school. He works in a shop and has been running in a business for four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more soaps, salt, sweets, and cooking oil for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To buy more soaps, salt, sweets, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Afuera de la ciudad, está una casa pequeña de madera, donde vive Reina, una mujer emprendedora que hace cinco años decidió establecer, junto con su esposo, su pulpería como una forma de ingresos para ella y su familia. Esta madre de dos hijos de 16 y de 18 años de edad, ha trabajado de la mano con su esposo, quien sin duda la apoya moral y económicamente. Desafortunadamente sus hijos dejaron de estudiar para ayudarle a su padre en las siembras, sin embargo ella no pierde la esperanza que puedan regresar para convertirse en profesionales.
Por esta razón, quiere seguir invirtiendo en su pulpería, por lo que solicita de un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, gaseosas, papel higiénico, entre otros productos de gran demanda que le permita incrementar sus ingresos. Esto le ayudará a esta mujer de 36 años de edad, generar más ganancias, poco a poco ir ahorrando y así cumplir con el sueño de ver a sus hijos estudiar de nuevo.
texts.en:
Outside of the city there is a small wooden house, where Reina lives.  She is an enterprising woman, who decided five years ago to set up her grocery store, together with her husband, as a source of income for her and her family.

She is the mother of two children, 16 and 18 years old.  She has worked hand-in-hand with her husband, who without doubt has supported her morally and financially.  Unfortunately, her children have stopped school in order to help their father with farming.  Nevertheless, she is not losing hope that they will be able to return so that they can become professionals.

For this reason, she wants to continue investing in her grocery store.  She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, beans, soda, and toilet paper, among other products in high demand, which will allow her to increase her income.

This will help this 36 year-old woman generate a greater income, saving little by little in order to fulfill the dream of seeing her children return to school again.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, soda, toilet paper, among other products to sell

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La socia Luz Maria se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar,aceite, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Luz Maria continues working at her grocery store. She sells basic goods such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  Through this business she wants to get ahead, and her dream is to expand her grocery store.

She is requesting a loan to buy more rice, sugar, oil, milk, and cookies. She is happy for the loan and is committed to making repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Jose Lorenzo

texts.es:
La jornada laboral de José empieza a las cinco de la mañana, cuando se levanta a ordeñar sus vacas, para luego seguir con el riego de sus cultivos. Rutina con la que ya lleva 30 años, cuando inició a sus 18 años de edad con la influencia de su padre, quien también era agricultor y ganadero. Empezó sembrando frijoles y maíz, agregando posteriormente a la lista el arroz y otros granos básicos.
Este padre de 54 años de edad, cuenta con el apoyo de su familia completa, su esposa, quien administra el negocio, y sus dos hijos de las edades de ocho y siete años, son la motivación de este hombre luchador. Su edad no es un obstáculo para seguir creciendo como agricultor, por lo que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su trabajo. Por esta razón solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y herbicida para poder tener un nuevo cultivo de calidad y cumplir con las metas en sus ventas. Esto le permitirá poder ahorrar para habilitar en un futuro un pozo artesanal que tanto necesita.
texts.en:
José's work day starts at 5am when he gets up to milk his cows, and next he irrigates his crops. He's had this routine for about 30 years, beginning at age 18 with his father's influence, who also worked in agriculture and livestock. He began by planting beans and corn, next adding to the list rice and other basic grains. 

This father of 54 years counts on the support of his whole family. His wife, who administrates the business, and his two sons age 8 and 7, who are this tenacious man's motivation. His age isn't an obstacle for continuing to grow as a farmer, which is why he wants to continue investing in his business. For this reason, he asks for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicide to be able to have a new crop of high quality and meet his sales goals. This will allow him to save up to buy an artisan well in the future, which he very much needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and herbicide.

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr:
a_ - 
Agée de 44 ans  Akou est  Mariée  et  mère d’ 4 enfants  résidant  à Adidogomé. Elle a commencée son activité de  commerce  en vendant de la boullie. Elle s'approvisionne  2 Fois  par mois marché assiyéyé  et  revend  à  son  domicile  à  la  devanture.  Akou  sollicite  un crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Akou is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She lives in Adidogomé. She started her business selling corn porridge. Akou gets her supplies twice a month at the Assiyéyé market and sells [her product] in front of her home. Akou is seeking a loan to expand her business in order to meet the needs of her customers and make more of a profit.

loans.use: To purchase three sacks of corn.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a 25-year-old woman residing in a remote village, Vivekananda Palli, in Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri district. She studied until grade six. She is married and is a mother of two children (one son and one daughter). Being a housewife, she looks after her husband and children and does all the household work. One of Sumitra’s children goes to school and is in grade one, and the other is a toddler. 

Her husband, Uttam, 35 years old, provides services in shuttering work for building-making. In this regard, her husband needs a variety of materials such as wood, nails, ropes, hammer, rods, etc. Now, he wants to improve his shuttering business to satisfy the demand of his customers and to generate more income to provide financial support his family.

So, Sumitra is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner BJS for her husband, so that he can buy materials to improve his shuttering business. With the profit, she hopes to enhance her husband’s business, which will increase her family’s financial status. She wants to save money to provide proper education to her children. 

Sumitra is thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial assistance.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her husband's shuttering business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise her customers are asking for

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo es soltero pero tiene 4 hijos Ricardo vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Ricardo se gana la vida como cerrajero y quiere un prestamo para terminar la pared trasera de su domicilio que es colindante con el cerro y no tiene una division aun Ricardo no tiene a quien acudir pero goza de buena salud y su actividad economica es estable
texts.en:
Ricardo is single, but has four children.  Ricardo lives in La Paz, in a house made of bricks and cement, which belongs to him.  Ricardo earns his living as a locksmith and wants a loan to complete the back wall of his home, which is next to the hill and not even separated from it at all.

  Ricardo has no one to turn to for help, but is in good health and  has a steady income.

loans.use: to finish the back wall of his home, which is next to the hill and not even separated from it

loans.name: Noemi Abarca

texts.es:
La socia Noemi Abarca  se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos naturales, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de productos naturales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member Noemi Abarca continues to work selling natural products. She works from 8am until 5pm. She has worked in this business for 4 years already, and it suits her well. Her dream is to grow her natural products business. She asks for this loan in order to buy more natural products. 

She is very content with this loan, and promises to comply with the terms of paying it back.

loans.use: to purchase natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new painting machine for his workshop.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 36 years old.  She is married with three children aged between 12 years and 6 months; two of them go to school. She has a shop and has been running the business for the past six years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy soap, cooking oil, sugar, and rice for sale.  The profit from the business will be used to renovate her house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy soap, cooking oil, sugar, and rice for sale.

loans.name: Edgardo Ismael

texts.es:
