Edgardo Ismael tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar, La misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca. Edgardo Ismael vive en la parte Rural de este distrito. Cuenta con servicios (agua y luz). Dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Edgardo Ismael es brindar el servicio de transporte de pasajeros mediante una mototaxi, cuenta con movilidad propia la actividad la viene realizando desde hace 4 años, cuenta con clientela reconocida de la la zona asi como el translado de escolares. El destino del crédito será para hacer arreglos en su mototaxi, asegurando asi el correcto funcionamiento de su herramienta de trabajo y pueda seguir generandole ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edgardo Ismael, age 20, is single and lives in a relative’s house.  The house is located in the Pomahuaca district.  Edgardo Ismael lives in the rural part of this district.  He does have water and electrical services.  The district is located in the Jaén province, in the Cajamarca region, in the northern highlands of Peru.

Edgardo Ismael provides passenger transportation services with his ‘mototaxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  He has his own vehicle, and he has been doing this for four years.  He has clientele, and he is known in the area for school transportation.

The loan will be used to make repairs to his mototaxi.  This way he will be assuring good functioning of his work tool.  He will be able to continue generating income.  This way he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his mototaxi.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is aged 31. She is married with three children aged between 8 and 4 years.  She has a shop and has been running her business for five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more books, soap, cooking oil, and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy cows and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more books, soap, cooking oil, and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Bunnarat

texts.en:
Bunnarat, 48, is a driver. He has been in this job since 2009. He lives with his widowed mother in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. He earns $8.33 per day. 

Bunnarat's mother is a diabetic. He is requesting a loan for medicine and treatment for her. This loan will help save his mother.

loans.use: to pay for medicine and treatment for his mother

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en:
Sanjar, 18, comes from a rural area of Tajikistan. He is a very hardworking and smart young man. He recently graduated from high school and applied to Tajikistan State University of Law, Business and Politics. Now, he is a student in first year. 

Sanjar’s parents have been busy with animal husbandry. There are five children in his family. Sanjar must pay for his university tuition, but he has no money. His parents don’t support him, because their income is small and not enough to provide five children with all the necessities. 

He is asking for a loan to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Abida

texts.en: Abida is a housewife and a mother of 3 children; she requires funds to buy a new rickshaw for her husband. The family's income is generated through the transportation business and they barely make ends meet. Abida's husband is the main earner of the family and generates all his the income from driving the rickshaw. Unfortunately the current rickshaw has completely broken down, halting the inflow of income. This has resulted in Abida's children skipping school due to lack of resources at their mother's disposal. Hence, Abida wants a loan to help her husband to buy a new rickshaw and start generating income once again which would streamline all her activities and thus send her children back to school to get an education.

loans.use: To buy a brand new rickshaw

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is 35 years old and the mother of five children. Her husband owns a small firm in which he operates a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories; he employs laborers to work the molding machines on daily wages. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials. This time he has taken a huge contract but does not have enough cash in hand to buy raw materials to continue his manufacturing. Therefore, Lubna has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy plastic raw materials for the molding machines.
 
She has to look after a huge family; she has to take care of each child, their school fees, their diet and their health. For these purposes she needs a huge income and her husband is the only person who is responsible to bear their household expenses. She is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic raw materials for the molding machine.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida, 37, lives with her three children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband had been driving an auto rickshaw that did not belong to him. With the help of savings, he purchased a used rickshaw. Its engine was good, but its body was totally damaged, and he did not have sufficient cash on hand to buy a new rickshaw. 

He wanted to start driving but was looking for lump sum amount. Therefore, Shahida requested a loan for her husband to buy a new rickshaw and drive it happily. She hopes her husband will now be able to generate a consistent income. She is very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy medicine and pay for medical treatment.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
Ayesha is a 57-year-old married woman who has five children. She lives in a populated area, and her son knows about people's needs in this area. He is a market vendor who sells seasonal fruits from his place in a central bazaar and also from his home. He has a few years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. 

Ayesha's son chose this business because it is profitable and brings in a stable income. People use fresh fruits every day and consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of fruits. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he could sell the maximum amount of fruits till evening and get maximum reward for his efforts. 

Ayesha applied for a loan so her son can purchase more fruits and thus increase his monthly turnover. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for resale

loans.name: Indira Gissell

texts.es: Indira Gissell es Lic. en Contabilidad Pública pero por la falta de empleo se ha inclinado al comercio, quien con el crédito anterior invirtió en su negocio de cosméticos y variedades, ha venido creciendo poco a poco, ahora trabaja en un establecimiento de piza junto a su hermano, Indira Gissell tiene un hijo que estudia la escuela primaria, ella ahora es madre soltera y busca a diario mantener sus ingresos o superarlo para los gastos de su pequeño e ir mejorando las condiciones de su vivienda, solicita el crédito para comprar laminas de zinc y cambiar el techo el cual no presenta buen estado, siendo esta una de sus prioridades para vivir en un ambiente tranquilo y seguro.
texts.en:
Indira Gissell is a Public Accounting graduate but due to lack of employment opportunities she has been working in commerce. 

She invested her previous loan in her cosmetics and variety business, growing little by little. She now works in a pizza establishment together with her brother.

Indira Gissell has a son in primary school, and she's now a single mother looking every day to maintain or improve her earnings in order to provide for his son and improve her housing conditions. 

She is requesting the loan to buy zinc sheeting to replace the roof which is not in good condition. This is one of her priorities to live in a quiet and safe environment.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting and purlin.

loans.name: Abdul Basit

texts.en:
Abdul Basit, 27 years old, laid the foundation of his business 6 years ago in Karachi. He is married and lives with his wife and parents, who are proud of his achievements at such a young age. Abdul Basit is an obedient and responsible person. He wants to give his family a better life. 

Abdul Basit manufactures towels and sells them to wholesalers. He has a good clientele, he works hard to get frequent orders and he delivers quality products to his customers. Abdul Basit has requested a loan through BRAC Pakistan to buy threads and fabric to manufacture towels to deliver his orders in a timely manner. His future plans are to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase threads and fabric to make towels

loans.name: Ricardus Erik

texts.en: Ricardus' ideal is to become a sailor and this has been a dream since childhood. Ricardus lives on the coast, in the area of Lembata, East Nusa Tenggara. The area is divided into the highlands and the coast; people work there as farmers and fishermen. Ricardus' village residence is very simple, and it is hard to find a job. Ricardus' father works as a laborer and plants only corn, and his mother does not have any special skills. His parents make every effort to help Ricardus achieve his plan to be a sailor. The hopes of his parents are very big for Ricardus to succeed and thrive in the future. Through the Student Loan program of Kiva, Ricardus hopes to complete college and quickly find a job on a cruise ship. He is very grateful to the investors of Kiva, because thanks to their help, he can cover the cost of tuition and can continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his education fees for three years

loans.name: Tabassum

texts.en: Tabassum is a 33-year-old married woman, living in Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband drives an auto-rickshaw and earns a very low income that is why she started teaching at her home. She teaches students from 1st standard to 5th standard. She has been teaching since 2005 and equally participating in daily household expenses and monthly savings. With the teaching she also owns a small stationery stall at her home for her students. She offers photocopies, lead pencils, drawing pencils, canvas, books and other items. Tabassum has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can buy more stationery and furniture for her school. She also teaches her own children in her school, and she derives sufficient income from this practice at the end of the month. She is very glad after receiving this loan and gives praise for the lenders who are taking an active part in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy stationery and furniture for her school.

loans.name: Ana Luisa

texts.es:
Ana de 44 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está casada, y su compañero de vida es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos  de 10 años de edad, 12 años de edad, 14 años de edad, 17 años de edad y 26 años de edad,  los 3 menores están a su cargo y estudian 1° grado, 2°grado y 6° grado de educación básica, su pareja de vida es responsable de mantener el hogar.

Ana toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura y a los oficios domésticos, además se dedica a lavar y planchar ajeno, manifiesta que le ayuda a su pareja de vida y a su hijo mayor a cultivar la tierra, el terreno está ubicado a unos 15 minutos de su casa  y se trasladan caminando.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizante y plaguicidas para sembrar 7,000 mts cuadrados de maíz, así con la cosecha esperada  tener mejores ingresos  económicos con la venta  y solventar algunas necesidades básicas en su familia

Espera darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta que sean profesionales, y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Ana, 44, did not have the opportunity to study. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have five children ages 10, 12, 14, 17 and 26. The three youngest are under her care and go to school. They are in first, second and sixth grade in elementary school. Her husband is responsible for maintaining the home. All of her life, Ana has been devoted to agriculture and domestic chores. She also washes and irons other people's laundry. She states that she helps her partner and her oldest son cultivate the fields. The land is located 15 minutes from her house, and they travel by foot. She needs a loan in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides to sow 7,000 square meters of corn. With the expected harvest, they will have more income from the sale and afford some basic needs of the family. She hopes to provide education for her children until they become professionals and improve the quality of her life and that of her family.

loans.use: buy fertilizers and pesticides and cultivate corn.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas, aged 62, is married to a farmer and blessed with six children. She has managed a vegetable production in her village for almost ten years. She earns a weekly net income of PHP 3,000, which is usually spent on the family's daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds, Felicitas would like to get a loan of PHP 28,000 to purchase seedlings and fertilizers to use on her vegetable production. She's hoping that her vegetable business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings and fertilizers to use on her vegetable production.

loans.name: Khetam

texts.en: Khetam is a 51-year-old married woman from Qalqilia city. She is a mother of two children; a son and a daughter, both of whom attend school. Her husband is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. Five years ago, Khetam opened a grocery store in the city. She sells regular grocery products such as sugar, milk and some cleaning products. Khetam took a USD loan from FATEN to help her to buy more products to sell in her grocery store. By taking this loan, Khetam will be able to increase her sales and also her income. Khetam appears in the photo in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 30-year-old married father of three. He is a Palestinian refugee, and lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Ten years ago, he started his own electricity maintenance business to cover the needs and expenses of his family and to provide them with better living conditions. He worked hard throughout the years to improve his business. Today he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to buy necessary electrical tools which will facilitate his business and provide better service to his customers. 

Youssef recently moved his garage outside the camp in order to attract more customers and develop his family’s living standards. This loan will help Youssef increase his income and thus provide his family with better social and financial living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: To buy necessary electrical tools to facilitate his business and provide better service to his customers.

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Shakila is the age of 35 and living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods, provides services for repairing electrical components such as ceiling fans and washing machines, and also troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He also sells electrical components such as bulbs, switches, sockets, etc.

He wants to buy new inventory for his shop but does not have the amount required to buy new inventory. Therefore, Shakila has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband becomes empowered to buy his desired inventory.

Shakila is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's electrician shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Lucy, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. 

Lucy, 39, has been farming for the past 15 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practising mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, tea, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. 

Lucy is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow. Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals. 

Kenya's Chuka area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Lucy could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there. 

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Lucy, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Lucy believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. 

She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Lucy to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
Lucila tiene 69 años de edad, es casada, vive con su esposo, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Lucila se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como borregos, cerdos, patos y cuyes, desde hace más de 15 años de antiguedad en el negocio. Solicita préstamo para la ampliación de sus corrales, construir más corrales para la crianza de cerdos y para la compra de alimento para la crianza de los mismos. De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Lucila is 69 years old, married, she lives with her husband in their own home, in a big community in the urban zone of Cayalti. She enjoys good personal and work references from her neighbors, the aforementioned community which is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Lucila works raising and selling animals such as sheep, pigs, ducks and guinea pigs, with a history of over 15 years in this business. She is requesting a loan to widen her pens, build more pens to raise pigs and to buy feed for her animals. In this way she will make her business grow, get more earnings and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to widen her pens, build more pens to raise pigs and to buy feed.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is a 44-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Zubaida's husband has been driving an auto rickshaw in Lahore for many years but now his rickshaw’s body and engine are fully damaged. He has sold his rickshaw to a scrap dealer for a very low price. He now wants to buy a new auto rickshaw but is still short of the full amount.
 
Zubaida's husband is unable to earn even a single penny for his family without a rickshaw. Zubaida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With this loan amount, her husband can easily buy a new rickshaw. Zubaida and her husband thank Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Abdulkader

texts.en:
Abdulkader is a 40 year old married man and a father of 4 children. His oldest child is 17 years old and the youngest one is 6 years old. He lives with his family in the capital city of Yemen, Sana'a. He is a University graduate. 

Now, Abdulkader is an employee in the public sector. The salary that he receives from his job is not enough to cover all the expenses of his family. Also, his house lacks many home appliances and needs; his salary is not enough to purchase everything. He is a talented and responsible professional man. He has a lot of determination within him to go ahead and improve the living standards of his family and to prepare his house with all the needs of the family.

From this side, he decided to start his own business in addition to his work in the public sector. He plans to purchase a taxi to work as a driver. He will transport people from one place to another inside the capital city of Sana'a to earn money in order to provide his family with a better future. 

Abdulkader believes that this business will be very profitable for him, and he will earn a good amount of money. Unfortunately; Abdulkader's salary is not enough to purchase that taxi. As a result, he applied for a loan of 1,100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a taxi to work as a driver to earn money that will help him provide his family with a better future. 

Abdulkader looks forward to purchasing another taxi and renting it with a monthly salary to make a better future for his family. He also hopes to purchase a piece of land and build his own house on it.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi and work as a driver to earn money to provide his family with a better future.

loans.name: Bufalo D Group

texts.en:
Sauda, who is in her mid 30s, is single with four children. Two of them go to school and two are still small.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 5am to 4pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit. 

This will be Sauda's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for cooking food. 

She dreams of sending her children to good schools.

Sauda will share this loan with her loan group "BUFALO D" which consists of fourteen members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking food.

loans.name: G.s. Bendicion El Sauce Group

texts.es:
El  G.S  bendición el Sauce está conformado por cinco integrantes madres solteras con diez hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante l coordinadora es Ana y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de ropa nueva como: pantalones, shores, faldas, blusas, camisolas, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa de cama, ropa de niño. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  g.s. la bendición el Sauce agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les  brindan  a personas de escasos recursos para salir adelante y tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Solidarity Group Bendicion El Sauce is composed of five members who are single mothers with ten children for which they are responsible.  The are from El Sauce, a place in the northern zone of the region.  They are characterized as being hard-working, responsible and with a desire to get ahead personally.  
Unfortunately due a lack of economic resources, they were not able to study and they found themselves obligated to work from a young age in order to help out with the household expenses.
Thanks to their efforts and their desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Ana and she makes a living selling new clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, dresses, camisoles, underwear, sleepwear, and children's clothes.  She dedicates some 12 hours a day to her business offering her products.  In order that in a future not too far off they might get better incomes, Solidarity Group Bendicion El Sauce thanks the Kiva investors for the help they offer to persons with scarce resources in order to get ahead and to have a dignified work environment.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business by purchasing pants, shorts, skirts, blouses, camisoles, dresses, underwear, sleepwear, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 47-year-old woman with a higher secondary education. She lives in a remote village, Petkati, in Jalpaiguri district, which is far away from the main capital city of Kolkata, West Bengal, in the eastern region of India. She is a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). One of them is physically handicapped. Two of her children are students. One is in college, and another reads in grade 12 in the village school. Her husband, Narayan, is 54 years old and is a farmer by profession.

The only source of income for her family is her husband's agribusiness. He grows seasonal vegetables, but his income is not satisfactory for a family of five members where there are two students. So, Arati wants to start a fishery business in their pond near her house.

So, she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She wants to start her business and put juvenile fish and fingerlings in the pond. Apart from this, she wants to buy new fishing equipment, such as landing net and a rod and reel. Since the household income is not sufficient to run the family, Arati wants to concentrate fully on her fish-selling business because fish is considered as a staple food in West Bengal, and the demand is very high throughout the year. There’s a high chance of generating a good income.

She thanks BJS and Kiva for being so considerate towards her.

loans.use: to purchase juvenile fish, fingerlings, and other fishing equipment to start a fishery business.

loans.name: Sari

texts.en:
Sari is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of four children from Baybay, Leyte. Sari and her husband have been engaged in a furniture making business for more than 12 years, and it is the source of their income. Several months ago, Sari's business was ruined when a typhoon hit the country. The family's income declined after that. 

Sari and her husband have just started to rebuild their business again. Sari is asking for a loan to buy more wood, nails, a compressor and paint. This will enable Sari and her husband to make more furniture which they can sell to the market. In the future, Sari hopes to make her business a success and more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more wood, nails, a compressor and paint

loans.name: Nasira

texts.en:
Nasira, aged 40,  is the mother of three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Nasira is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband owns a small dairy farm consisting of buffaloes and cows. He works in dairy products such as milk, curd and butter. He sells milk daily to different tea stalls. 

Nasira's husband is an honest man. He manages his household necessities from his milk sales earnings. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins his clients' trust. He is in need of one cow to increase his milk sales business income. Nasira has asked for a loan so that she can support her husband's business. Nasira thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new cow

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina has been involved in opening a furniture shop since 2012. She started her business with her own working capital of $40. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens and goats.

Severina is married, and there are four members in the family, including her husband, a carpenter. 

Severina has a furniture shop in her house. She is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional materials, including wood boards, wood beams, wood glue, chisels, nails and other materials. 

She is happy because, with this loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: To buy wood boards, wood beams, wood glue, chisels, nails and other materials.

loans.name: Indira De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Indira de 25 años de edad, casada con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Esta joven mujer se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, lamentablemente no pudo estudiar por falta de recursos económicos pero, lucha en la vida para sacar adelante a su familia. A pesar de las adversidades de la vida, es muy positiva, y optimista para proporcionarle estabilidad a su hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles como: azúcar, leche, pan, gaseosas, frutas, café, fósforos, huevos, mantequilla, queso, cuajada, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Indira agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Indira, 25, is married with a minor child.  She is from El Sauce, a place located in the northern zone of the region.  This young woman is characterized as hard-working and responsible.  Unfortunately, she was not able to study due to a lack of economic resources, but she struggles in life to move her family ahead.  Despite the adversities of life, she is positive and optimistic in order to offer stability to her son.
Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, she makes a living with a grocery store.  It is a small store that sells food products such as sugar, milk, bread, soft drinks, fruits, coffee, matches, eggs, butter, cottage cheese, cheese, and juices.  She dedicates some 12 hours a day to her business offering her products.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business so that in a future not too distant she can get a better income.  Indira is grateful for the help the Kiva investors offer to persons with scarce resources and poor countries like Nicaragua in order to have a good work environment.

loans.use: to stock her small grocery store with food products such as sugar, milk, bread, soft drinks, fruits, coffee, matches, eggs, butter, cheese, cottage cheese, and juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, compost, pest controls, and other supplies.

loans.name: Margret's Group

texts.en:
Margret's group is comprised of 3 hardworking women. Margret is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is single  and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Margret has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh Irish potatoes. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes for sale, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Margret hopes that, in the future, she will be able to improve her family's standard of living. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of Irish potatoes for sale

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is a positive and responsible 48-year-old man. He is married and has five children. He lives with his family in a small village. The house where they live is in need of repair and is not quite set up for good living. Tahir's wife is a homemaker and a very hardworking and caring mother.

Tahir has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for more than 24 years. This income covers their living expenses. But his income is not sufficient to allow for repair of the house. This is why Tahir wants to obtain a loan to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair his house.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en: Maura, aged 27, and her husband, who is a motorcycle driver, manage a motorcycle transport business in their village. Maura has been in this business for almost two years and earns a net income of PHP 350 daily. Her net income from this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance in their transportation business. She and her husband work hard to earn more income for their child's future. She's hoping that her business will continuously become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is a mother of 6 children. She is a housewife who requires a loan for her husband so that he can buy a cast iron to manufacture tools like hammers, wrenches, and screwdrivers.The earnings generated from selling these tools will be used to send Tahira's children to school and to buy the day-to-day groceries for her house. Due to insufficient resources and rising inflation, her husband is unable to buy the raw materials, assemble the tools, and sell them in the market in a timely manner. This loan will enable Tahira to fund her husband and help him to streamline all the manufacturing activities, creating an inflow of income.

loans.use: To buy cast iron for manufacturing tools

loans.name: Yolanda Emperatriz

texts.es:
Yolanda Emperatriz tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el caserio el Ingenio de Buenos Aires, desde hace más de 20 años, vive en casa propia, junto a su hijo, ella es separada del padre de sus hijos. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila y se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, además de el comercio; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Yolanda Emperatriz es a la venta de cerveza, y animales como cerdos, y productos de belleza, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 8 años, ella cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y en es muy conocida en la zona con muy buenas referencias tanto personales, como laborales. El destino del crédito será para la compra y venta de cerdos, lo que le generará un ingreso adicional con lo cual podrá mejorar sus ganancias, y por consecuente su caldiad de vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda Emperatriz is 38 years old, lives in the small village of Ingenio de Buenos Aires. For more than 20 years, she has lived in her own home with her son. She is separated from the father of her children. Life in the community is peaceful and they work in agriculture and cattle raising, also in trade; said community is located in the Morropon province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Yolanda Emperatriz works selling beer and animals such as pigs, and beauty products. She has done this kind of work for more than 8 years. She counts on her experience in the business and is well-known in the area with good references both personal and work-wise. The aim of the loan is to buy and sell pigs, which will earn additional income with which she will improve her earnings and thus her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy and sell pigs.

loans.name: Candy Marylin

texts.es:
Candy es una joven entusiasta de 19 años, soltera y vive en Lima junto a su familia. Por iniciativa propia empezó su negocio brindado Show Infantiles y hoy tiene muchos clientes, es muy solicitada, ella cree que le va bien porque es muy carismática, trabajadora y responsable. A su corta edad ya tiene muchos planes que quiere ejecutarlos más adelante para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Candy está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar una laptop para utilizarlo y hacer sus show infantiles, por ejemplo poner la música, entre otros, de esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y ella empezará a estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Candy, age 19, is an enthusiastic young woman. She is single and lives with her family in Lima. Through her own initiative, she started a business in which she puts on children’s shows. Today she has many clients and is frequently requested. She is doing very well because she is very charismatic, hardworking, and responsible. At such a young age, she has many plans that she wants to carry out in the future so that she can improve her family’s quality of life.

Candy is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the support they have provided. She will be able to purchase a laptop computer that she can use for putting on her children’s shows. For example, she can use it to store her music and do other things. As a result, her earnings will improve and she can begin studying for a professional degree.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to use in her business.

loans.name: Glenda Xiomara

texts.es:
Glenda de 32 años de edad,  estudio hasta 6°grado, está casada y su esposo es Fotógrafo y agricultor; tienen tres hijos  de 1 año de edad, 8 años de edad y 13 años de edad que viven con ellos, estudian 1° y 6° grado de educación básica, su esposo es el responsable en el sustento del hogar.

Glenda se dedica a los oficios del hogar, además le ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas. Todos los días caminan 5 minutos desde su casa hasta el lugar de siembra, desde las 6:00 am hasta las 11: 00 am

El préstamo será utilizado  para  comprar una pareja de animales de trabajo (bueyes), piensa adquirirlos jóvenes y terminar de desarrollarlos para que luego le faciliten el trabajo agrícola con el arado de sus cultivos. También piensa alquilarlos para obtener otros ingresos para su familia.

Glenda se proyecta tener ganado lechero y ofrecer productos tanto leche como sus derivados y de lo obtenido con la venta darle lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Glenda, 32, studied up the sixth grade, is married and her husband is a photographer and farmer.  They have three children, 1, 8 and 13 years old, who live with them and study in the first and sixth grade of basic education.  Her husband is responsible for the livelihood of the household.
Glenda makes her living doing housework and in addition she helps her husband with the agricultural work.  Every day, they walk five minutes from their house to the place they cultivate from 6:00 a.m. until 11:00 a.m.
The loan will be used to buy a pair of work animals (oxen).  She thinks of acquiring them young and finish raising in order that they will later help with the agricultural work in the plowing for their crops.  She also is thinking that they could rent them out for other income for the family.
Glenda also plans to have milk cows and to offer milk and dairy products and, from the income from the sales, give her family the necessities.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls for work (oxen).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy livestock and start his own business.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana, who is married to a barber, wants a loan to help her husband setup a barber shop.  The loan would be used to buy items like scissors for cutting hair, water sprayer, seats and a mirror.  Unable to make the ends meet, the new setup would generate enough earnings to help Rehana come out of difficult financial times.  Moreover, Rehana's husband plans to expand his barber shop buy inserting more seats and hiring more personnel who would help him out in cutting the hair.  Therefore, the loan is extremely important for the inflow of income into Rehana's home and for meeting the basic requirements of her household.

loans.use: To help her husband buy equipment and a front mirror.

loans.name: Massiel Andreita

texts.es:
Massiel es una joven soltera muy entusiasta, trabaja en atención al público en un cine de su ciudad natal, Chimbote.
Cada día se despierta motivada y trabaja muy duro para poder apoyar a su familia. También estudia la carrera de Administración porque quiere superarse y poder tener mejores oportunidades laborales más adelante. El buen desempeño que tiene en el estudio y trabajo es el resultado de todos los valores que inculcaron el ella sus padres y los deseos de superación que siempre tiene en mente.
Massiel está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá iniciar su pequeño negocio de venta de joyas (utilizará el préstamo para comprar las joyas), de esta manera tendrá ingresos adicionales con los que mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y así seguirá luchando para sacar adelante a su familia y convertirse en una gran profesional.
texts.en:
Massiel is a young single person, very enthusiastic, she works in customer service at a cinema in the city of her birth, Chimbote. Every day she gets up motivated and works very hard to be able to help her family. She is also studying a degree in Administration because she wants to excel and be able to have better opportunities in the future. She carries her duties out well both in her studies and work, this is the result of all the values that her parents instilled in her and the desire to excel that she always has in her mind.

Massiel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have provided, she will be able to start her small business selling jewelry (she will use the loan to buy the jewelry), in this way she will have additional income with which she will improve her quality of life for her family and thus continue struggling to pull her family through and turn herself into a great professional.

loans.use: to buy jewelry to start a business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30-year-old, married father of three children. Eleven years ago, he started working in car body work to cover his family’s living needs and expenses. Today, he has fourteen years of experience in his domain with very special talents and a reputation in his region. Mohammad is working hard to satisfy his children’s needs, especially in educating them to provide them with a better future. For this reason, and since his income isn't good enough to cover the increasing school tuition fees, he is acquiring a loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to pay the the requested amount of his children’s school fees. He always hopes to increase his income by expanding his business to provide better living conditions to his beloved family.

loans.use: To pay the the requested amount of his children’s school fees.

loans.name: Arbnor

texts.en: Arbnor wants to thank all of the lenders for his first loan, which he used to do some general renovations to his home, including the flooring. The loan had helped him to be able to create a pleasant atmosphere and good living conditions. He is still working for a private company as a construction worker while his wife continues to work as a cleaner in a small restaurant. Now, because he has successfully paid off his first loan and was satisfied with the loan process, he is requesting a second loan to replace the windows and doors before winter arrives. He promises to pay on time again and hopes he will be considered a good client.

loans.use: To replace the windows and doors before winter arrives

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last five years. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of the repairs. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: M Danish Khan

texts.en: M. Danish lives in Karachi. He is 28 and recently got married. They live in a rented house with their parents. He runs a general store in the nearby market. He started this business three years ago. Now it has grown and his customer base has increased. In order to better serve his customers, Danish has requested a loan to buy more inventory to avoid out of stock situations and to provide additional products to his customers. He is hopeful that he will open up another outlet in the future with the savings he will make from this investment. He is thankful to Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase general items for his shop

loans.name: Kaycee

texts.en: Kaycee is aged 26, married to a driver and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her income is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to a lack of capital for her business, she would like to take a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, breads and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, canned goods, noodles, breads and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase personal and household products to sell

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosario de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta 9° grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen cuatro hijos de 21 años de edad, 27 años de edad, 30 años de edad y 33 años de edad, solamente la menor vive con ellos estudia 2° año de la universidad. 

Rosario se ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a los oficios del hogar, tiene un pequeño negocio en el que vende agua, pues tiene un pozo en su casa, además le ayuda a su esposo  a limpiar  y seleccionar el frijol para la venta, el trabajo lo realiza en casa. También cuida el ganado en ausencia de su esposo.

El préstamo será utilizado para la comprar de dos novillas reproductoras y terminar de desarrollarlas para obtener beneficios más adelante.

Rosario se proyecta que su hija se gradúe  de la carrera universitaria para ver los frutos de su esfuerzo. También dedicarse más  a crianza de ganado para vender carne o productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Rosario, aged 57, studied up to ninth grade. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. They have four children—aged 21, 27, 30, and 33. Only their youngest child, who is a second-year student at the university, lives with them. 

For most of her life, Rosario has been a homemaker. She has a small business selling water because they have a well on their property. In addition, she helps her husband to clean and select the beans for sale. She does this at home. She also tends to the cattle when her husband is away.

The loan will be used to buy two breeding heifers and ensure their proper growth in order to benefit from this purchase in the future.

Rosario's plans include ensuring that her daughter graduates from university, so she can see the fruits of her labor, as well as getting more involved in raising cattle for beef or dairy products sale.

loans.use: to purchase two breeding heifers.

loans.name: José Eber

texts.es:
José de 50 años de edad, por falta de recursos económicos solo pudo estudiar hasta 2°grado de educación básica, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar. Han procreado 2 hijos de 2 años de edad y 6 años de edad y no estudian. Además con ellos vive su madre, él es el sostén de la familia.

José se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 15 años, lo aprendió de su padre, actualmente siembra 49,000 mts cuadrados (7 manzanas) de maíz, distribuido en distintas parcelas ubicadas en diferentes lugares de su comunidad. Trabaja desde las 6:00 am hasta las 3:30 pm, apoyándose de su vehículo para llegar todas las parcelas.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar fertilizante, plaguicida y herbicida para asegurar su cosecha.
José espera que con el fruto de su trabajo cubrir las necesidades de su familia y tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
José, 50, could only study until the 2nd grade of primary school because of lack of funds. He is married and his partner is engaged in household chores. They have two children, 2 years old and 6 years old and they do not attend school. His mother also lives with them. He is the household head. 

José has been farming for 15 years. He learned from his father and now plants 49,000 square meters (7 manzanas) of corn on different plots in different locations around his community. He works from 6 am to 3:30 pm. He uses a vehicle to get to all of his plots.

The loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and herbicide to ensure his crop. José hopes that the fruit of his labor will meet the needs of his family to give them a decent life.

loans.use: to grow corn

loans.name: Stella's Group

texts.en:
Stella's group is comprised of six hard working women. Stella is 21 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Stella has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh foods to sell, and will help Stella to generate greater profits and pay the school fees for her children. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's standards of living. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fresh foods to sell

loans.name: Gabriel Renzo

texts.es:
Gabriel es un joven entusiasta y soltero de 19 años, trabaja como chofer en una empresa de su ciudad natal, Pueblo Nuevo. El buen desempeño que tiene en su trabaja es el resultado de todos los valores con los que actúa cada día y que fueron inculcados en él por sus padres y la ética intachable con la cual toma sus decisiones. Cada día Gabriel despierta muy motivado porque quiere sacar adelante a su familia. A pesar de no poder estudiar una profesión por tener algunas dificultades económicas, eso no es un impedimento para que siga luchando por sus sueños.
Gabriel está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor para su casa, de esta manera su familia podrá gozar de sus momentos libres juntos, así su calidad de vida mejorará y continuará esforzándose para más adelante poder empezar a estudiar una carrera profesional y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a young, enthusiastic single man of 19 years of age. He works as a driver in a company in his hometown of Pueblo Nuevo. The good performance he has in his work is the result of all the values that he enacts everyday that were instilled in him by his parents. He has irreproachable ethics which helps him make decisions. Gabriel wakes early each day motivated because he wants to support his family. Despite not being able to study for a profession because of financial difficulties, it has not deterred him to keep fighting for his dreams.

Gabriel is grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they provide will allow him to buy a TV for his home so his family can enjoy their free time together so that the quality of life will improve. He will continue to strive to be able to later study for a career and raise a family.

loans.use: to purchase a television for his family

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a 28-year-old married man from the town of Carles, Iloilo. For ten years now, he has  been engaged in the fishing business. Edwin would like to improve his livelihood after the challenge he encountered during the typhoon Haiyan devastation. He is asking for a loan to buy a fishing boat and fishing nets. Edwin hopes that with the help of the loan, he will be on his way to business recovery. In the future, he hopes to have many more fishing boats and to make his business a success. His income will be for his little son's future education.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and fishing nets

loans.name: Marielita De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Marielita tiene 36 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, reside en el caserío La Toma, distrito de Buenos Aires desde hace más de 20 años junto a sus hijos. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que se dedican al comercio y crianza de animales, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Marielita es a la venta de abarrotes, y cerveza desde hace más de 5 años. Ventas las realiza en su domicilio. Ella es conocida en la zona, con muy buenas referencias crediticias y personales, el destino del crédito será para surtir su bodega y pago de peones para la cosecha de una hectarea de maiz que tiene para cosechar, lo que le generará ingresos adicionales para mejorar sus ganancias, y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marielita is 36-years old. She lives with her partner in the small village of La Toma in Buenos Aires District. She has lived there for more than twenty years with her children. Life in her community is tranquil, as the people make their livings as shopkeepers and by raising animals. Her community is located in Morropón Province, Piura Region on the northern coast of Perú.

Marielita's business for more than five years has been selling groceries and beer. She makes her sales from her home. She is well-known in the area and has very good personal and credit references. The loan will be used to stock up her grocery shop and to pay for laborers to harvest a hectare of corn that she has ready to harvest. That will generate an additional income to improve Marielita's profits and thereby her quality of life as well as her family's.

loans.use: to stock up her small grocery shop and to pay for laborers to harvest a hectare of corn that she has ready to harvest.

loans.name: Elna

texts.en:
Elna is a 49-year-old married woman from Carles, Iloilo. She has two children aged 7 and 10. For 20 years now, she has been operating a fishing business and seaweed farming with her husband. She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fishing nets to replace the old ones and the ones torn during the typhoon Haiyan. Elna relies on this business for the basic needs of her family and she hopes that through this loan, she can continue to recover her livelihood while providing for her family's basic needs.

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business and another source of income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets

loans.name: G.s. En Dios Confiamos Santa Elena Group

texts.es:
El G.S  En Dios Confiamos Santa Elena esta conformado por tres integrantes, dos mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables de familia  con ocho hijos bajo su responsabilidad, son originarios del Jicaral, lugar que está ubicado  en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Estas personas son de condición muy humilde, luchadoras, En la actualidad luchan día a día para poder brindarles a sus hijos estabilidad económica física, moral, y cumplir con sus sueños y metas como es brindarles a sus hijos los estudios, y construir sus casas de habitación. 
Gracias a su perseverancia y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Gissel y tiene por actividad económica la crianza de cerdos en pie, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa  de habitación.  Ella dedica a su actividad unas ocho horas diarias, cuidando alimentando  los cerdos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra  y venta de cerdos, concentrados, desparasitantes, trigo, vitaminas etc. G.S En Dios confiamos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The group GS In God We Trust Santa Elena is comprised of three members, two women and a man.  They are responsible parents with eight children under their care.  They are originally from Jicaral, a place that is located in the northern part of the region.  They are characterized as hardworking, responsible, willing to improve.

These people are in very humble condition, fighters, currently struggling every day to provide their children with physical, moral, economic stability, and fulfill their dreams and goals and provide for their children's studies, and build their houses.

Thanks to her perseverance and desire to succeed, Gissel is the coordinator and she raises hogs.  The business is located in her home. She is devoted to this activity about eight hours a day, taking care of and feeding pigs.

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and her business, to purchase and sell pigs, concentrates, wormers, wheat, vitamins etc. GS In God We Trust is grateful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of pigs, to purchase concentrates, wormers, wheat, and vitamins.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul tiene 30 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado de su conyuge y un hijo de 4 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico de un piso ubicada en caserio Tayales sector el Salluc, distrito Santo Tomas, Saul es natural de la zona, él se lleva bien los mienbros de su sector, caserio y pobladores del distrito, pues cuenta con buenas referencias personales y comerciales en la zona, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Saul es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1.5 has. Variedad catimor resistente a enfermedades, plantación esta en su tercer año de producción tiene 4 años de edad, cultiva café en caserio Tayales Sector el Salluc distrito Santo Tomas, actividad la realiza hace 10 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de cafe. Adicionalmente cria animales menores (gallinas, cuyes, chanchos y otros) y cultivo de productos de Pan Llevar.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento y cultivo de 1.5 has. De café en producción, asegurando una buena producción para campaña 2015, reflejado en un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende obtendra mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Saul is 30 years old, he has a stable home at the side of his wife and a child of 4 years old, he lives in his own one-floor home made of rustic materials located in the small village of Tayales, Salluc section, Santo Tomas district. Saul is from the area, he gets along with the people from his section, small village and people from the district, as he has good personal and trade references in the area. His house has water services; said community is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca, northern highlands of Peru.

Saul works growing coffee, he has to date 1.5ha. The catimor variety resists diseases, the plantation is in its third year of production, it is 4 years old. He grows coffee in the Tayales Sector hamlet in Salluc district, Santo Tomas. He has done this work for 10 years, he has experience in the coffee growing sector. He also raises small animals (hens, guinea pigs, pigs, etc) and grows products for bread.

The aim of the loan is to maintain his 1.5ha coffee plantation, assuring a good production for the 2015 season, reflected in an increased sales volume and therefore more income so he can improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to maintain and cultivate a 1.5 ha coffee plantation

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda, 42, is married with eight children. She helps her husband to earn a living. She runs a general store in their village while her husband is farming. It is their main source of income, but it is not good enough for the family since they are only a tenant farmer. She worked hard in order to earn more to put up a retail business in their community. Her plan succeeded, and she is now borrowing a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. She wants to improve her business so as to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. 
She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to make dried fish.
Bebelyn successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.
NWTF is re-listing Bebelyn's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to generate income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.name: Sara Yeny

texts.es:
Sara Yeny tiene 39 años de edad, es separada, tiene 01 hijo, vive con su familia en el centro poblado Nueva Arica, en el distrito Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Sara Yeny se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para compra de animales dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad, con gran influencia en el negocio; cliente piensa incrementar la venta de animales para poder generar mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo.
texts.en:
Sara Yeny is 39 years old.  She is separated, and has one son.  She lives with her family in the town center New Arica in Cayaltí province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, north coast of Peru district.

Sara Yeny has been dedicated to raising and selling farm animals and has over 2 years of experience in doing this.  Her business is located in her own home.

She has requested a loan for purchase of animals and such investment will serve to provide more variety.  This will have a large influence on the business.  Her clients intend to increase the sales of animals which will generate higher revenues, higher profits and so improve her quality of life and that of her son.

loans.use: to purchase of animals in order to have more variety of livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom in his house.

loans.name: Rosa Dimas

texts.es:
Rosa es un hombre de 65 años de edad, estudio hasta 5° grado de educación básica, no continuo porque en su comunidad el estudio llegaba hasta ese grado. Está acompañado, y su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, tiene 3 hijos de 23 años de edad, 32 años de edad y 36 años de edad, pero ninguno vive con ellos solamente vive con su pareja en casa.

Rosa desde su adolescencia se ha dedicado a los trabajos agrícolas, aprendió de sus padres que fueron agricultores y él trabajaba con ellos desde muy pequeño. Tiene cultivado 7,000 mts. cuadrados de maíz en un terreno ubicado a 15 minutos a pie desde su casa y 7,000 mts cuadrados de frijol en un terreno ubicado a 30 minutos a pie desde su casa.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas, fertilizantes  y químicos agrícolas para asegurar la cosecha de los granos básicos.
Espera seguir trabajando la tierra para que con el fruto de su trabajo, mantenga a su esposa y vivir sin ninguna preocupación.
texts.en:
Rosa is 65 years old.  He studied until the 5th grade of basic education.  He could not continue because the community schools only went to that level. He is married, and his spouse is engaged in household chores.  He has 3 children, 23 years old, 32 years old and 36 years old.  None live with him; he only lives with his spouse at home.

Rosa since his teens has been dedicated to agricultural work.  He learned this from his parents who were farmers and he worked with them from the time that he was very young.  He cultivates 7,000 square meters of corn in a field located 15 minutes walk from home and 7,000 square meters of beans on land located 30 minutes walk from home.

The loan will be used to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers and agricultural chemicals to ensure the harvest of basic grains.  He hopes to continue working the land for the fruit of his labor, to take care of his wife and live without any worries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides for crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats for raising

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en: Tasleem is the age of 35, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods, provides services for repairing electrical components such as ceiling fans and washing machines, and troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He also sells electrical components such as bulbs, switches, sockets etc. He wants to buy new inventory for his shop but does not have the amount required to buy new inventory. Therefore, Tasleem requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband becomes empowered to buy his desired inventory. Tasleem is thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more electrical material for her husband's electrician shop.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a married woman and a mother of four children from Baybay, Leyte. Sonia has been engaged in the poultry business for more than two years now. This is the source of her income. Sonia lives in the typhoon ravaged area of the country. Her small poultry business was affected by the typhoon that hit the place several months ago. As of now, Sonia is requesting a loan to buy more chicks to raise and animal feed. With this, she will be able to improve her poultry business as well as her income. In the future, Sonia hopes to make her business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to raise and animal feed

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila tiene 64 años, es casada, conocida en el medio por la labor de crianza y venta de animales. Ella vive en casa propia, con conyuge y un hijo (con discpacidad), los otros hijos viven disipados. Teofila cuenta con buenas referencias familiares y económicas, vive en una comunidad ubicada a 42 kms de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan al comercio, agricultura y ganaderia.

Teofila se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos, cuyes y carneros, desde hace más de 14 años aproximadamente, Necesita préstamo para invertir en arreglo de habitación de casa(techo, piso, pintura,etc.) lo que le va a dar mayor comodidad a su hijo y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teofila is 64 years old, married and known in her community for raising and selling animals. She lives in her own house along with her life partner and her son (with a disability). Her other children live in different locations. 

Teofila has good family and financial references. She lives in a community located 42 kms away from Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region, northern shore of Perú. The people that live there are kind and respectful, and they dedicate to commerce, agriculture and stockbreeding.

Teofila has worked for the last 14 years raising and selling small animals like pigs, guinea pigs and rams. She needs this loan to fix her house (roof, floor, paint, etc.). This will allow her son to be more comfortable and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to fix her house (roof, floor, paint, etc.)

loans.name: Kondoa Group

texts.en:
Sharifa, who is in her mid 30s, is married with three children. Two of the children are at school and the other one is still small.  She has been a food vendor since 1998.  She works from 7:30 am until 11:30 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Sharifa's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to build a shop where she is now selling her food. She also increased her food stock. She is doing fine and was able to pay back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a TV set, a deck, and a refrigerator and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy cooking ingredients and meet her customers' demands.  She dreams of building her own house.

Sharifa will share this loan with her loan group "Kondoa", which consists of six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients

loans.name: Shireen

texts.en:
Shireen is a 38-year-old lady living with her spouse and eight children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to save so that she can provide better living facilities to her children but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the motorbike and rickshaw’s body but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to fix the problem. 

Therefore, Shireen has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so her husband will be able to buy the moto rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she will be able to save enough to meet the sudden needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her husband.

loans.name: Alvidio

texts.es:
Alvidio tiene 43 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; en el distrito de Bolivar, la cual es una zona rural, provincia de San Miguel, región de Cajamarca, costa norte de Perú.

Alvidio se dedica a la venta de abarrotes; hace 5 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, él solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; compra de mercadería para su negocio para poder incrementar y diversificar sus stock, lo que le permitirá atender con los diferentes gustos de cada cliente, generandole mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alvidio is 43 years old, has a live-in partner and two children under his care. He lives in a house of his own in the district of Bolivar, which is a rural area in the province of San Miguel, in the Cajamarca region, northern shore of Perú.

Alvidio has worked selling groceries for the last 5 years. His business is located at his own place of residence. He is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for his business so he can increase and diversify his stock. 

This will allow him to satisfy the different needs of his clients, thus generating more incomes, improving his profits, and by doing so, improving his family’s and his own quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Rogelio Manuel

texts.es:
Rogelio Manuel tiene 45 años de edad, vive en armonía familiar en compania con cónyuge y 2 hijos menores de edad, uno de 10 años el cuál estudia en escuela del distrito y el segundo de 4 años que estudia en pronoi del distrito; Rogelio Manuel es nacido en distrito, él tiene calificación 100% normal en centrales de riesgo, vive en casa propia de material rustico primer piso, Rogelio Manuel vive en armonía y respeto a sus vecinos y demás moradores del distrito Santo Tomas, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua y luz, distrito ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Rogelio Manuel es la renovación de calzado de tordo tipo, actividad que realiza hace 5 años en distrito Santo Tomas, siendo el segundo que realiza esta actividad en todo el distrito; sus clientes son personas del distrito y demás caseríos, contando con experiencia en el rubro; y como complemento del negocio vende plantillas fijas, pasadoras y plantillas movibles. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura cultiva maíz amarillo criollo duro 1 has. Hace 8 años en casero el Frayle distrito Santo Tomas; realizando venta de producto los días domingos en distrito donde hay compradores mayoristas.

El destino del crédito será para comprar materiales, insumos y implementar negocio, con ello obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rogelio Manuel is 45 years old and lives in relative harmony in the company of his wife and two minor children, one child is a 10-year-old who studies at the local school district and the second is 4 years old and in a government nursery school. Rogelio Manuel was born in the district. He has a 100% credit rating in credit bureaus. He lives in his own house of rustic materials and one floor. He lives in harmony and respect with his neighbors and other residents of the Santo Tomas district. He has services such as water and electricity. The district is located in the Province of Cutervo, in the region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Peru. 

Rogelio Manuel's activity is shoe repair which he began five years ago in the district of Santo Tomas. He is the second person doing this activity in the district. His customers are people from his district and other villages. He has experience in the field. In addition, the business sells different types of insoles. He additionally works in agriculture, growing yellow corn. For 8 years, he has made product sales on Sundays where there are wholesale buyers for corn in his home district. 

This loan is to purchase materials and supplies for his business so he will get more income in order to improve the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies for shoe repair

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
La Asociación comunal el Buen pastor está conformada por nueve integrantes ocho mujeres y un  hombre, padres y madres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce de la misma comunidad se conocen entre y decidieron unirse para optar al crédito para invertir en sus diferentes actividad económicas, que es la que les ayuda  a mantener a sus familias.
Gracias sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Daneysi  y tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, jabón, aceite, galletas, gaseosas, jugos, detergentes, jabón, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, la rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su productos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. la asociación comunal el Buen Pastor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank El Buen Pastor Group is made up of nine members, eight women and one man, who are the responsible parents for fifteen children under their responsibility. They are from the community of El Sauce. They know each other and decided to unite to take the loan to invest in different economic activities which is what helps them support their families. 

Daneysis, with her desire to succeed, is the coordinator of the group and has a small grocery store as her economic activity. It is a small store that sells food products in small quantities such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, soap, cooking oil, biscuits, soft drinks, juices, and detergents. The business is located in her home. The routine work of this woman is about 12 hours a day selling her products so that in the near future she can get a better income. The El Buen Pastor Group appreciates the help that the Kiva lenders provide to poor people and poor countries like Nicaragua to have dignified jobs.

loans.use: to stock her general store with rice, beans, and more.

loans.name: Vestine

texts.en: Vestine is 21 years old. She is married with one child who is 4 years old and goes to school. She sells clothes and has been working in a business for the past 12 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more bed sheets for selling. The profits from the business will be used for reinvesting and for welfare for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets for selling

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma, is 44, married to a farmer and blessed with one child. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 20 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income from her business is usually spent on the school allowances for their child. Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase coffee, sugar, and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina is a 70-year-old widow and a resident of Brgy. Tguilon, Dapitan City. She earns a living through fish selling.

She has been a member of PMPC for five years and enjoys the privileges of being a member of the Cooperative. Now, she is applying a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy fishing net.

Ludivina deeply wishes to remain a member in good standing with PMPC.

loans.use: To buy fishing net

loans.name: Reyna Consuelo

texts.es:
Reyna tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, con dos hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; domiciliado en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Reyna se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral tales como pavos, gallinas, cerdos, entreo otros; hace 07 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, ella solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; pues desea invertir en la compra de cuyes, patos, gallinas, pavos, para aumentar y variar su stock de animales, y asi poder satisfacer los diferentes gustos de sus clientes, lo que le va a permitir aumentar sus ventas, mejorar sus ingresos, subir sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su caldiad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Reyna is 41-years old, married and has two children to take care of. She lives in her own home in a rural area of Oyotún District in Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the northern coast of Perú.

Reyna has made her living for the last seven years raising and selling barnyard animals such as turkeys, chickens, pigs and other animals. Her business is located in the back of her house.
