Reyna is requesting the loan to invest in working capital; she wants to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs, ducks, chickens and turkeys to increase and vary her stock of animals. That way she will be able to satisfy her customers' different tastes. This will allow Reyna to increase her sales, improve her income, increase her profits and thereby improve her quality of life and her family's as well.

loans.use: to invest in working capital; she wants to invest in the purchase of guinea pigs, ducks, chickens and turkeys to increase and vary her stock of animals.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en: Yasmeen is a 48-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her son works very hard so that the family can have a good and respectable life. Her son owns a clothing business that is the only source of income for the family. Presently, she needs additional capital for the growth of her son's business. For that reason, Yasmeen is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a variety of clothes for her son to sell. In this way, her son can respond quickly to customer needs. With the profits, he will put aside some savings to pay for the electricity and gas bills. Yasmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her son's business. Yasmeen is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her son's clothing business

loans.name: Sandra Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sandra de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, actualmente está soltera, sin hijos y vive solamente con su abuela 

Sandra se dedica a cuidar una niña de 8 meses y a su abuela, anteriormente era empleada de un almacén que se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, pero le quedaba muy retirado y se le dificultaba viajar, por lo que tuvo que renunciar.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar mercadería para un negocio de ropa que quiere comenzar, impulsada por una vecina que se dedica a este negocio, Sandra necesita comprar ropa de damas, caballeros y niños, sobre todo faldas, camisas y ropa interior.
Sandra espera con los buenos resultados  del negocio, mantener a su abuela y poder ir creciendo como comerciante.
texts.en:
Sandra is 21-years old.  She finished high school, is currently single, has no children and lives with her grandmother.  

Sandra makes her living taking care of an 8-month old little girl, and she also takes care of her grandmother.  She previously worked at a clothing shop, but it was very far and difficult to get to.  So she had to leave her job. 

Sandra needs the loan to purchase merchandise for a clothing business that she wants to start.  She was motivated by a neighbor, who makes her living in the same business.  Sandra needs to purchase men's, women's and childrens' clothing, especially skirts, tops and undergarments.
 
Sandra hopes to, with the positive results from her business, support her grandmother and keep growing as a business woman.

loans.use: to purchase tops, skirts and undergarments for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is a 49-year-old mother of seven children who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son’s job is unsatisfactory for getting high income. She wants to help her son with the growth of his business. He owns a medical store in which he sells various types of medicines and injections. His medical store is near a medical clinic. Most of the customers are referred by the doctor of that clinic. Most of the medicines are unavailable due to high cost. Razia knows that her son is able to earn maximum profit if he offered these missing tablets. Therefore, she requested a loan for her son. Razia hopes that her son will be able to buy expensive medicines and injections so that he can earn maximum profit. Razia hopes that through the profits she will be able to buy a new house soon.

loans.use: to buy expensive medicines and injections

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en: Rahab is 20 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortpotal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 7 months, Rahab has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. To help expand her business, Rahab has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food for selling, and will help Rahab to generate greater profits and to pay school fees for her child and her younger brothers. Rahab hopes that in the future she will be able to own a vehicle. Rahab is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: to buy more food for selling

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon, age 42, thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC in the year 2009. She decided to give it a try after she learned she could avail herself of financial assistance for her chosen business. Corazon has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she took a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her pig-raising business. Corazon wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins

loans.name: Miami Group

texts.en:
Shamim, who is in her mid 30s, is single with three children who are still in school.  She has been selling cosmetics for two years now.  She works from 9 am until 8 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.  

This will be Shamim's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to increase her cosmetics stock. She dreams of buying a dryer and starting a salon business.

Shamim will share this loan with her loan group "Miami," which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan

loans.use: to increase her cosmetics stock.

loans.name: Heide

texts.en:
Heide is married with two children. She is 33 years old and lives in Poblacion 3, Clarin, Philippines.

Heide sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 14,900 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Heide has been a member of PMPC for five years.  In the future, Heide hope to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities

loans.name: Digno Josue

texts.es:
Digno de 25 años de edad, soltero con dos hijos menores de edad,  es originario del Jicaral, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza  por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Este hombre lamentablemente no pudo terminar sus estudios pero le hubiera estudiar veterinaria. En la actualidad lucha para sacar adelante su negocio, a sus hijos brindarles mejores  oportunidades de vida.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de ganado. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, el dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su productos. El objetivo del crédito es comprar ganado, comprarles vitaminas, desparasitantes, alimentos. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Digno agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Digno, of 25 years old, is single and has 2 minor children. He is from Jicaral, a place located in the northern part of the region. He characterizes for being a hardworking, responsible man with a big desire of self-improvement. 

Unfortunately, this man wasn’t able to finish his studies but he would’ve liked to study veterinary science. Nowadays, he fights to make his business thrive, and to give his children better opportunities in life. 

Thanks to his desire for success, he works buying and selling cattle. His business is located at his own place of residence, and he spends 8 hours every day in it offering his products. He will use the loan to buy cattle, vitamins, products for deworming, and feed, so in a near future he can obtain better incomes. 

Digno appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified job.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase and sale of cattle, to buy vitamins, products for deworming, and feed.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 45 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jennifer has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of dried fish to sell in her food stall.

Jennifer has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Asmat

texts.en:
Asmat is 40 years old and married. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a government employee.  She has been running a clothing sales business for the last three years. She wants to support her family through her business. She purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market. 

Presently, she needs to purchase some clothes to sell. However, due to the lack of finance, she is facing a problem. For that reason, she has requested a loan from Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Asmat is thankful to the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Mary Salome

texts.en:
Mary Salome is single and doesn't have any children. She is 34 years old and lives in Basirang Tudela, Philippines.

Mary Salome sells assorted goods to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns 2,500 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to restock her store with basic commodities.

Mary Salome has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to save more, and to provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Aydah

texts.en:
Aydah is a 41-year-old married woman from Bethlehem city. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters. all of whom are under 18 years of age. Aydah has been making handmade religious gifts for the past 20 years and sells them to the local souvenir gifts stores. 

Aydah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy more beads and yarn for her business. By taking this loan, Aydah will be able to increase her productivity and her income. 

Aydah appears in the photo while she is working

loans.use: to buy more beads and yarn for her business

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is married with three children. She is 57 years old and lives in Cahayag, Tudela, Philippines.

Daniela is a farmer and grows corn to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers.

Daniela has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Daniela hopes to save more for consumption.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Polette

texts.en:
Polette is a 54-year-old single woman from Bethlehem city. She lives alone in a small house in the city. Polette has been making handmade religious gifts for the past fifteen years. She uses olive wood in her work, and sells her work to the local souvenir gift stores. 

Polette took a loan USD from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy more olive wood  for her business, and by taking this loan, Polette will be able to increase her productivity and also her income. 

Polette is working in this photo.

loans.use: to buy more olive wood for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 34 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Marilyn has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to dry.

Marilyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Kipkemoi

texts.en:
Kipkemoi, 23, is an agri-business entrepreneur from Kipreres in the South Rift region of Kenya. The bachelor has been actively doing this work for three years. He makes a decent income selling eggs and crops from his farm at the local market. He is also engaged in other personal businesses to make additional income. 
Poultry farming has worked out well for Kipkemoi mainly because of the growing demand for chicken products and by-products. He also attributes his success to the passion and vision he has for the business. He spends so much time rearing poultry that most people would probably think he is too involved since he even names the chickens. The biggest risk his business faces is an outbreak of diseases. However, he is very keen on taking all necessary precautions to mitigate this risk. 
Kipkemoi is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to purchase more poultry. With your money, he will expand his business by owning more chickens and selling more eggs. 
Kipkemoi has nurtured a 'saving culture.' He will use the money from this investment to build his savings account and provide his family with a balanced diet.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Neth

texts.en: Neth is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She is a garment-factory worker. She has been a garment-factory worker since 2012. Her husband is 28 and is a construction worker. One of her children is a student. They live in Kompong Speu Province of Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $12 a day. Neth would like to request a loan to buy calves to fatten then resell. This loan will help her earn more income. In the future, she is going to expand this fattening business, build a bigger house, and support her children to go to university.

loans.use: to buy calves to fatten then resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products for his store to resell.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 57 years old. She is married with five children between the ages of 32 and 14. Three of her children go to school. She sells cows, which she has been doing for the past ten years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cows to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more cows to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Reshma

texts.en: Reshma is a 40-year-old woman who lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession, and he has been running an auto rickshaw for the last four years. For many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. Therefore, Reshma requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Reshma is so thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to cover the rickshaw repairing cost for her husband.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en: Rosette is 36 years old. She is married with four children aged between 13 and 5 years, all of whom go to school. She has a shop and has been working in a business for the past three years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more items such as biscuits, soap, books, and pens for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more items such as biscuits, soap, books, and pens for sale.

loans.name: Afwa

texts.fr: veuve afwa agée de39ans, Afwa  réside à Adidogomé. Elle vend  de la boule de maïs et des poissons. Elle  s'approvisionne une Fois par mois au  marché assiyéyé. Elle  revend  au bord de la route, à côté d'une station d' essence CAP. Afwa sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire sa clientèle et  faire plus de profit.
texts.en:
A 39-year-old widow, Afwa resides in Adidogomé. She sells maize balls and fish, and resupplies once a month at the market in Assiyéyé. Her sales are done at the roadside, next to a CAP gas station.

Afwa is requesting this loan to expand her business, so she can satisfy her customers and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 60 bowls of maize and one carton of fish

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is the age of 26; she is a mother of three children and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a cigarette and pan shop for five years near his house in a shop, and the business is operating very well. According to the customers' demand, he wants to offer juices, soft drinks, cold drinks, etc. He does not want to refuse any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well. 

Therefore, Zainab requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy cigarettes, pans, juices, soft drinks, cold drinks, etc., for his shop. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that her husband will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's pan shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida is a 58-year-old woman with seven adult children. She is from Carles, Iloilo. Fishing is the business which she started 10 years ago. Last year, the community of Carles was also badly hit by typhoon Haiyan, which greatly affected her source of income, which is fishing. It brought destruction to their fishing equipment. Aida is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy a new fishing boat. She hopes that with the help of her loan she can go back to having a steady and reliable income so she can save for her future needs and she can support herself and her husband with healthy food and live in abundance in their old age.

loans.use: to buy a fishing boat

loans.name: Chantale

texts.en: Chantal is 33 years old. She is married with two children aged 8 and 3 years old. She sells foodstuff and has been selling for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas, cassava, and beans for sale. The profit from the business will be used to pay school fees and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas, cassava, and beans for sale.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile âgée de 54 ans, Mariée et mère de 2 enfants résident à Adidogomé. Elle vend des pagnes. Elle s'approvisionne 2 Fois par mois au grand marché de lomé et les revend à un emplacement où elle est propriétaire. Cécile sollicite ce crédit pour agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de profit
texts.en:
Cécile is 54 years old, married with two children, and resides in Adidogomé. She sells pagnes (colorful West-African fabric).

She resupplies twice a month at the main market in Lomé and conducts her sales in a shop of which she is the owner.

Cécile is requesting this loan to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: buy eight Hollande and Hitaguette pagnes (brands of colorful West-African fabrics)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 24-year-old man married to Joyce, who adds additional income to support the family welfare. They are blessed with one child. Daniel has been operating a clothing business shop for a period of three years, earning an income of KES. 15,000 (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Daniel was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES. 30,000. He intends to use this amount to buy skirts, shirts, trousers, blazers and coats to sell to his customers.

Daniel plans to use the anticipated income to buy his own plot to build a permanent house. He hopes to become a successful businessman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy skirts, shirts, trousers, blazers and coats to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier Adidogomé,  yawa   est  âgée de 32 ans. Elle est Mariée. Yawa vend de la bouillie au bord de la route et  s’approvisionne  une Fois dans le moi  au  marché assiyéyé et  revend à la devanture de son domicile  . Yawa sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en:
Residing in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé, Yawa is 32 years old and married.

Yawa sells corn mush by the roadside. She resupplies once a month at the market in Assiyéyé and conducts her sales in front of her home.

Yawa is seeking a loan to expand her business and make more profit.

loans.use: buy 120 bowls of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour, rice, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 40-year-old resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is married with eight children between the ages of 3 and 21 years old. She provides for them by having two small businesses: fishing and a sari-sari (variety) store. Gina is asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fishing equipment such as fishing nets, fishing weights and ropes. The loan will ease her worry on how to recover her loss when Typhoon Haiyan hit their place and displaced some of their things. 

In the future, she hopes to have a bigger business so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, fishing weights and ropes

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia, is 48 years old, married and blessed with five children. She has owned and managed a retail store in her village for almost four years. She earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her income usually is spent on the school allowances for her children. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to take a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase beverages, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, and sugar to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, biscuits, noodles, canned goods, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Rita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Rita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Kamsat

texts.en: Kamsat is 35 years old and married with two children. He is a construction worker. He has been a worker since 2005. His wife is a 35-year-old farmer. One of his children is a student. They live in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Together, they can earn approximately $6 per day. Now Kamsat would like to request a loan to buy wood and zinc sheets to build a small grocery store. This loan will help him earn more income from selling groceries. In the future, he is going to build a bigger house with fences around it and help his children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy wood and zinc sheets to build a small grocery store

loans.name: Moureen

texts.en:
Moureen is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse, they have been blessed with three children. She has a grocery business, which she has been running for nine years now. She also supports four people in her family and her spouse provides additional income for the support of the family.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of groceries such as vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To buy more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emel

texts.en:
Emel is married with no children. She worked with her father running a store for many years. When he became ill, they had to close the store so she could look after him. After his death, she had to work again to support herself. She began doing direct sales, including Tupperware. She sold many products but settled on just selling Tupperware. She is now a group leader. Emel has remarried and her only wish is to live happily and peacefully. 

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Emel Hanım evli.Çocuğu yok.  Babası ile uzun yıllar esnaflık yapıyor.  Babası hastalanınca ona bakmak zorunda kaldığından dükkanını kapatıyor.  Babasının vefatı ile ekonomik sebeblerden tekrar çalışmak zorunda kalıyor.  Bir çok ürünün doğrudan satışını yapmaya başlıyor.  Bunların içinde tuppwer ürünleri de var.  Çok çeşit olunca hepsine yetişemediğinden  sadece tuppwer ürünlerini satmaya başlıyor. Şu an da tuppwer de grup liderliği yapıyor.  Emel Hanım ikinci evliliğini yeni yaptığından hayatta mutlu ve huzurlu yaşamak tek istediği.

loans.use: to buy more Tupperware products to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 41 years old, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in her village for almost 22 years and earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her net income from this business usually is spent on the school allowances of her children. Due to insufficient funds in her business, she would like to take a loan of PHP 17,000 to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable production. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more productive.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and seedlings for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en:
Tam lives with her one child and husband. Her husband works as a sanitary worker in the local community.

For the past 10 years Tam has been running a food stall to earn more income to support her family. Tam is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is standing the third from the left, wearing a white jacket. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Tam is requesting a loan to purchase better quality food and soft drinks to sell from her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers, and attract new ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and soft drinks to sell from her stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family.

Trang is now requesting another loan to buy a new computer for her internet shop. She hopes that this new loan will help her to increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. 

She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new computer for her internet shop

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 23-year-old married man and the father of only one child one year old. He lives with his family in miserable conditions in Hodeidah, Yemen. He is a student in a secondary school. Mohammed is a very active and dynamic young man. He lives with his family in a very old house. The husband is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family and to make renovations of the house. Mohammed decided to help his father to make the necessary renovations for their house. The house of the family is very old and needs repair and maintenance. He wants to make it very stylish and comfortable, but he doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Mohammed is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase construction materials such as iron steel, bricks, cement, and other materials in order to make repairs to his old house.

Mohammed hopes to complete all the building and renovation of the house to make it more comfortable and spacious. He plans to complete his study in the University.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials such as iron steel, bricks, cement, and other materials in order to make repairs to his old house.

loans.name: Casimero

texts.en:
Casimero is 44 years old, married, and the father of four children. He works as a security guard while his wife works as a teacher. 

He also has a farm that helps him to support their needs. He grows produce on his farm and sells it in town. 

To restore farm nutrients, he has taken out a new loan from GDMPC Microcredit to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure. He hopes to improve his farm in order to be able to support his children's future education.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Dien

texts.en:
Dien is requesting a new loan to buy good quality coffee and soft drinks to sell. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that this new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her cafe and her sales, and will also help her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality coffee and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Alfonso Berardo

texts.es:
Alfonso Berardo tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su conyuge y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos estan en primaria en colegio nacional del distrito de Pucará. Alfonso Berardo cuenta con buenas referencias labolares y personales, contando con servicios de agua y luz, dicho distrito esta ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Alfonso Berardo es maestro de obra, hace 15 años, el ofrece este servicio en el distrito de Pucará y caserio aledaños. Alfonso Berardo desea invertir en la compra de herramientas para su trabajo, herramientas como palanas, barretas, carretillas, taladro, con lo que podrá darle un valor agregado a su servicio y con esto Alfonso Berardo podrá incrementar sus ingresos, mejorar su desempeño laboral y podra mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfonso Berardo is 55 years old. He lives with his partner and their four children. Two of the children are studying at the Pucará state school. Alfonso has good work and personal references. He has running water and electricity at home. Pucará is in the Jaén province of the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern highlands.

Alfonso is a builder. For 15 years he has been offering his services in Pucará and neighbouring areas. Alfonso wants to invest in tools - such as spades, wheelbarrows, drills and crowbars - for his work. This will add value to his services and Alfonso will be able to increase his income, improve his work and improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in tools - such as spades, wheelbarrows, drills and crowbars - for his work.

loans.name: Juanito

texts.es:
Juanito tiene 30 años, vive con su conyuge y su menor hijo. Dedicado al cultivo de café, en el caserio de vista alegre en el centro poblado el Cumbe, en el distrito de Callayuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Juanito se dedica al Cultivo de café, hace 6 años, él solicita crédito para la compra de abonos y pago de peones para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café. Juanito posee conocimientos en el negocio, y el crédito le ayudará a mejorar su producto asi como su ganancias y por consecuente su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Juanito is 30 years old and lives with his partner and young child. Juanito works with coffee in the town of Cumbe, in the Callyuc district of the Cajamarca province and region in Peru's northern highlands.

Juanito has been making a living growing coffee for six years. He is applying for this loan in order to buy manure and to pay labourers to look after his coffee crops. Juanito has knowledge of this trade and this loan will help him to improve his products and increase and his profits. He could then improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay labourers to look after his coffee crops.

loans.name: Deysi Jhojani

texts.es:
Deysi es una joven de 21 años, emprendedora y vive en San Martin junto a su familia. Desde muy joven a apoyado a su familia en las chacras, es por ello que ha ganado cierta experiencia en cuanto a los cultivos. Ha sacrificado sus sueños de estudiar una profesión para poder apoyar a sus hermanos. Por iniciativa propia se está dedicando a la agricultura. Se dedica principalmente al cultivo de cacao y cree que le va bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y aplica todos los conocimientos que tiene para tener una excelente producción.
Deysi está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar insumos como abono orgánico y pagar el mantenimiento de la plantación a fin de tener mejores productos. Gracias a esto sus ventas mejorarán y así seguirá esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi is 21 years old, enterprising and lives in San Martin with her family. Since she was very young, Deysi has supported her family in the fields and so has a certain amount of experience with crops. Deysi has sacrificed her dream of studying to have a profession in order to be able to support her siblings. Under her own initiative, Deysi is working in farming. She mainly grows cacao and thinks that the work is going well because she always puts in effort at everything she does, and she applies her knowledge in order to have a good yield.

Deysi is grateful to Kiva investors as, thanks to their support, she will be able to buy organic manure and to pay to look after her crops in order to produce better products. Thanks to this, Deysi's sales will improve and she will continue putting in the effort in order to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for her cacao crops.

loans.name: Khoa

texts.en: Khoa is requesting a new loan to buy feed to raise insects. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business and increase his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed to raise insects

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting for his roof.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is requesting a new loan to buy more coffee and soft drinks to sell. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her cafe and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 52-year-old woman. She is married to Joseph who adds additional income to support their family and they are blessed with seven children. Grace has been operating a cereals shop for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Grace was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy beans, maize and green grams (mung beans) to sell to her customers.

Grace plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to provide the best quality education for her children.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize and green grams to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en: Madina is one of the smart students of the first year. She likes to read books and newspapers. Madina also likes to listen to music. Madina every day after classes goes to the library and prepares her homework. She is not married and lives with her parents in the capital of Tajikistan. Madina’s parents are workers. So, they have no money to pay for her tuition. She is asking for a loan to pay for tuition. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Cau

texts.en:
Cau is requesting a new loan to buy feed for the insects he raises and sells. 

Cau's previous loan enabled his to expand his business and earn a higher income to support his family. He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business and increasing his sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed for the insects he raises.

loans.name: Ha

texts.en:
Ha is requesting a new loan to buy materials for producing frames. 

Ha's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials to use in making frames.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is requesting a new loan to buy more sugarcane to sell as juice on her food stall. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more sugarcane to sell as juice on her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Eriosi

texts.en:
Eriosi is single with four children and three of her children are in school. She has no additional family members. She has a business selling second-hand clothes on a door-to-door basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She also gets additional income through roasting maize at home. 

Eriosi has been in this business for 8 years and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to building rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 28 years old, single and a mother to three children. She has a fruit-selling business and she has been running it for 5 years now. She also sells fruit juice and it has been profitable. Edith also has a mobile money transfer business.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of fruits such as bananas, watermelon, mangoes and avocados. She will also add stock of bottled water to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to grow her business and make more income.

loans.use: To buy more stock of water, fruits and soft drinks.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Being a housewife, Saima needs a loan to help her husband with their embroidery business. The loan will be used by her husband to buy needles, thread and yarn, so that he can effectively design various artistic and inquisitive images on rugs and dresses. The earnings from the business will be utilized to educate her children and meet the basic household requirements.

Her husband is also planing to diversify the business by opening a tailor shop where he will make custom clothing on the request of customers. Hence the loan will help Saima's family in terms of generating income and helping them expand their business.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is aged 30. She is married to a carpenter and they're blessed with one child. She owns and operates a retail store in their village and has been doing this for almost a year. She earns a net income of PHP 500 daily. Her income from the business usually spent on the school allowances of their daughter. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase hog feed, beverages, breads, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and will become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed, beverages, breads, canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has a fish-selling business and has been in this business for 20 years now. She is 45 years old, widowed and a mother of 2 children. She also supports six people in her family. She also sells clothes.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of fish to sell. This will enable her to make more profits which she will use to expand her clothes business.

This is her first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and in future she hopes to have a successful business and be able to provide for the needs of all the members of her family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a 36-year-old woman. She is married to Muthama who adds additional income to support their family welfare and they are blessed with four children. Penina has been operating a cereals business shop for a period of five years earning an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Penina was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing her first loan of KES 20,000. She intends to use this amount to buy maize and beans to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Penina plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: To buy maize and beans to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 30-year-old house wife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of three children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, oranges from his shop. 

Presently he is interested to offer more variety to his customers which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase more variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at profitable price. 

With the profit amount her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Julias

texts.en:
Julius, 36, has a mixed-farm where he is based with his family of 6 in Kepreres location in South Rift Kenya. On the farm, he grows various crops and keeps dairy cattle and poultry. For the last 6 years, he has made money selling his farm's produce and engaging in other side businesses. He feels passionate about farming. However, his business is facing challenges such as high cost of inputs and occasional drought.

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. The upside, to Julius, of focusing more on his poultry business is that it is not very much affected by the major challenges he faces: high cost of farm inputs and drought. Poultry feed on feeds that are readily available. They also lay eggs regardless of the season of the year. This investment is provides a certain source of income all year round. 

The money Julius will make from this expansion will cater for his family expenses such as food and school fees. He wants his family to enjoy a balanced diet to grow strong and healthy so that they can be more productive towards generating income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Fadzisai

texts.en:
Fadzisai is a 30-year-old businesswoman from the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She supports her daughter by running a business where she sells fried chips to customers. Fadzisai also volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at the local secondary school in her community; she teaches young students beneficial life skills. 

Fadzisai is requesting a loan from Kiva so that she can buy a large fryer. A larger fryer will make it easier to make more chips and Fadzisai will be able to meet the demand of her customers. More profits will help Fadzisai meet the financial needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a larger fryer to produce more chips.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Agness is single with three children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She resides in her own house; the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water.

She has a business selling secondhand clothes door-to-door, and has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used shoes.  She has been in this business for six years and works six days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality of used shoes. She aspires to send her children to university.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used shoes

loans.name: Elsy Karina

texts.es:
Elsy de 26 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, está casada y su esposo es empleado en una ferretería, tiene una hija de 3 años de edad. Nadie más vive con ella y depende de su esposo.

Elsy siempre se ha dedicado a los oficios de su hogar, pero también lava y plancha ropa ajena en su comunidad, aunque el sostén principal de su familia es su esposo gracias a su trabajo.

El préstamo será utilizado para construir un pequeño cuarto en su casa para una cocina, la que tiene construida de palos y lamina está deteriorada y al llover se filtra el agua, por lo que comprara bloques, cemento y pagara mano de obra.

Una vez construida la cocina, espera mejorar otras partes de su casa, pues tiende a inundarse cuando llueve fuerte y teme por la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
Elsy is 26 years old. She completed 9 years of primary education, is married, and her husband works for a hardware store. She has a 3-year-old daughter. No-one else lives with her and she depends on her husband.

Elsy has always done the household work, but she also washes and irons clothes for other people in the community. But her family's main source of income is the job of her husband.

She will use the loan to build a small room in her house which she wants to use as a kitchen. The kitchen she currently has is built from sticks and metal sheets and has deteriorated, and when it rains, the water gets in. Therefore she wants to buy bricks, cement, and to pay for labor.

Once the kitchen is finished, she wants to improve other parts of her house, because during heavy rains it is sometimes flooded and she fears for the health of her family.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Khái

texts.en:
Khái is 56 years old and is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Khái works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Khái's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In the future, Khái hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en: Emmaculate is a 20-year-old married businesswoman. She resides in Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. With her family’s assistance, Emmaculate has been operating a clothing store for the past year. Further, she assists the elderly with their household chores and is a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at the local school. With the Kiva loan, Emmaculate intends to purchase more clothes to sell to increase her sales and profits. This will enable her to break the cycle of poverty.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Pollyana

texts.en:
Pollyana sells clothes and shoes in Kisumu town and has been in this business for one year now. She is 35 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with one child. She also supports two people in her family. Her spouse provides additional income to support the family.

She will use this loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to add stock of clothes.

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya and in the future, she hopes to grow her business, make more income, be able to provide good education for her child and improve the living standards of her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saziso

texts.en: Saziso is a 22-year-old businesswoman living in Kwekwe District in Zimbabwe with her husband and children. She is very proud to have been running a successful grocery shop for the past six months with assistance from her family. To give back to her community, Saziso is also a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide at her local secondary school where she takes students through life skills and wellbeing lessons. Saziso intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, salt, washing powder and rice with the requested Kiva loan. This will enable her to boost her sales and cut down on the costs. With the additional profits, she hopes to own a big supermarket, create employment for people in her community and remain financially independent.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Future

texts.en: Future is a 20-year-old businesswoman who lives in Lupane District, Zimbabwe with her parents and siblings. Future has been selling clothes at a flea market stall in her community for six months. Apart from this business, she volunteers in her community as a Camfed Learner Guide who assists students with their studies. With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, she would like to purchase more clothing and higher quality clothing. This would assist in increasing her sales and profit levels. With the additional profits, Future would like to pay school fees for her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Liên is 64 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Liên works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle, and has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Liên faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

With her business profits, Liên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is single with four children, all of whom go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She sells used clothes at the market on a retail basis, and has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy a bale of used clothes. She has been in this business for three years and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires to buy a plot of land. She resides in a rented house; the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of used clothes

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is a 26-year-old businesswoman and mother of one child. She lives in Buhera District, Zimbabwe. Callen volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students. In addition, Callen is a hairdresser who operates a business at the local shopping center. She has been running this business for 7 months now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Callen intends to purchase blowers, dryers, and rollers to increase her supplies. Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring stability to her business and it will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase blowers, dryers and rollers to increase her supplies.

loans.name: Future

texts.en:
Future lives in the Mudzi District of Zimbabwe where she promotes cooperative learning as a volunteer Camfed Learner Guide in the local school and runs her own business. 

Future has been selling shirts, dresses, jackets, and shoes at the local market since she completed her schooling last year. She really loves her business and would like to increase her sales volume and expand, so she is asking for a Kiva loan. With the loan, Future can purchase more items of clothing to increase her stock. If she sells more clothes and expands her business, then Future can improve her standard of living and create employment opportunities in her community.

loans.use: To purchase more items of clothing to increase her stock.

loans.name: Tracy

texts.en:
Tracy is a young businesswoman from Matobo District, Zimbabwe. For the past eight months, she has been running a barber shop and selling hair chemicals. Further, Tracy volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide who mentors secondary school students. 

With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, Tracy would like to purchase more hair chemicals and products to sell in order to increase her sales and profit levels. With the additional profits, Tracy would like to pay her siblings’ school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more hair chemicals to sell.

loans.name: Bufalo C Group

texts.en:
Mussa is a father of one kid who is still young. He is married and runs a general store selling a variety of items. He is aged in his late twenties and has been in this business for three years now. Mussa starts working from 07am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

Mussa is requesting his first loan via Kiva's partner,Tujijenge Tanzania to be apportioned among Bufalo C, a ten-member group. The group members will hold each accountable for paying back the loan. 

Musa will use his loan to buy stock to resell in his shop. His desire is to grow his business and be successful.

loans.use: to buy stock to resell in his shop.

loans.name: Upendo - Mtei Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her early 30s, is married with three children; two them are still at school and one is grown-up.  She has been running three projects.  She has been selling fruits, vegetables, fish, and charcoal for two years now.  She works from 3 am when she goes to collect fresh fish, as well as genge items from the marketplace, and she also sells charcoal.  She closes her business at 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Joyce's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcaol, to buy fish, and to buy genge items.  She dreams of building her own house.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Upendo - Mtei," who consists of ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, to buy fish, and to buy genge items.

loans.name: Damares Elizabeth

texts.es:
Damares tiene 31 años de edad, vive en casa familiar, es soltera no cuenta con ningun hijo en su poder, ella es natural de la zona.Damares vive en la parte rural dele distrito contando con servicios de agua y luz, dicho distrito es Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Damares es la venta de ropa para caballeros, damas, niños cuenta con negocio propio ubicado en el mercado de abastos de Pucara cuenta con más de 2 años de experiencia en el rubro. El destino del crédito será para ivertir en su negocio surtiendo con mayor cantidad de productos para campaña navideña, con lo que le generará mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Damares is 31 years old. She lives in the family house. She is single and is raising no children. She is from the area. Damares lives in a rural part of the district that has running water and electricity. The district is Pucará, province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the northern sierra of Peru.

Damares' activity is selling men's women's and children's clothing. She has her won business located in the market in Pucara. She has more than 2 years' experience in this type of work. The loan will be used to invest in her business, stocking it with a larger quantity of products for the Christmas season. It will generate more income and thus she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her business, stocking in with a larger quantity of products for the Christmas season.
